HZJHmuieCFTA1kKMCV9XYg.text: The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the food is actually good. With that said the service is horrible, to start it took the server, in a mostly empty dinning room, 30 min to attend the table. When he did show up he brought us menus but never asked if we would like a drink. When he finally returned to take our order he still didn't take our drink order and almost left the table before we all gave our order only staying because we had to bring it to his attention. Once the food was delivered he never returned to see if we needed anything else. We had to flag him down to ask for drinks and he again walked away while we were still ordering. Lastly they charge an automatic 20% gratuity to the bill. Needless to say this was the entire meal experience; unimpressive and lacking. Never coming here again, which is sad because I like the SLS hotel.

SXBOv-avsxY27oy_IRSeOw.text: We used to come here when it was The Griddle and loved the insane pancakes. Unfortunately great things don't last forever and we came to find it replaced with mediocre food and overall slow and unresponsive service.   Wait in line was about 30 minutes on a Saturday morning. Ordered pancakes and an omelette and took about 15 minutes to come out before finding out the server got the wrong pancakes ordered for us. Got the replacement in a few minutes (would have been nice if our original order was that fast). Nothing memorable about the food, which was the exact opposite experience (and the reason we longed to go back) when it was The Griddle Cafe.   Took us 10 minutes to track down the server to pay and even to come back to pick up our card for payment. Lots of empty tables around us by that point.

8tFJaJdnU7WeqXJ50vRgRw.text: First time here very good service excellent food. No chatty patty waiters all professional enjoyed it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs side of potatoes. This steak was incredible.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa served to perfection!! Early morning breakfast for two.

VOA2bY2Ba9OQ7fQ7EUMbng.text: Joseph T. Was great!  Really enjoyed a hearty breakfast. Chicken tenders and Huevos Rancheros were really good.

ZYEAYMM8I20rLi9CuRxBKQ.text: Though the food is pretty good this place is by far the worst run restaurant  in Las Vegas. The hostess is as clueless as a baby gazelle who lost her mother and is aimlessly wandering through the tall grass. The wait staff, more apathetic then a 30-year old unemployed stoner casually spending his days on his parents basement couch playing Mario cart on his antiquated N64.   Clearly this place is staffed by a millennial generation of would be dancers or musicians who would clearly rather dream of making it big then focus on the job at hand of bringing me my food.   In short - or not - this place needs to step it up.

Jura4NJJBHajaR31s0T9Yg.text: I've been here several times. Sometimes I've paid full price, while others they've been comped because of casino play. I haven't had anything I didn't like yet. I've had their wings, their nachos, their sea bass, and their steak. Everything was delicious. Just don't order the steak expecting steakhouse quality steak.   Oh, and their cucumber margarita is spot on. Refreshing and literally intoxicating!  I just hope Tom Y. reads this: why complain publicly about a place when management already did everything they could (comped your meal) to make up for what you believed to be lack of service?  You sir don't deserve anymore free meals, but I'm sure you'll weasel your way into them in the future.

POnhtZg1ZTIEzrfFdfkxCA.text: 5 stars for Jim! Great service from the start. He made my entire family feel welcome and he was on point throughout our meal. Thank you Jim for the laughs, love and friendship!

FAzo-_taUn4aIvYjiQodiA.text: Great ambiance. Great service. Always open! Had a very late dinner here last night - a very fresh farmers salad. This morning I ordered the breakfast tacos and they were even better than I had expected! We sat at the counter and our waiter was Luciano. He was great, and definitely made our dining experience even better

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full bar. And this is only half of it!

zbnWP-77uh2SbjXxnWBITQ.text: Things are a little subdued here at the Northside Cafe this Wednesday night before the Mayweather fight. This coming weekend I'm sure the crowds will be starting to form and this place will be packed (not to mention the Rock In Rio crowds later in the month)! The last time I was here, I had an order of nachos which was really yummy and the gf had the infamous pastrami sandwich. Our server on the graveyard shift was Nicole and she provided great service and was the reason we ordered the nachos. She was very knowledgable about the menu and was very friendly and pleasant.  Tonight we're here on the graveyard shift an the restaurant is about 1/3 full. Still a decent sized crowd for a Wednesday with not too much going on in town.  Tonight's server is Henry. He did a good job, was attentive and on top of things. I like the fact that the tables here are cleaned and reset quickly and that the food I had here is consistent.  I just had a taste of the gf's turkey wrap and it's pretty tasty. Her fries were good too... Still thinking about those nachos... Lol. Thanks Nicole. :) we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Club with Sweet Potato Fries.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ burger with fries
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apparently the Pastrami Sandwich is still available during breakfast and lunch hours! Yay!

P4S-jmfqbRGH4Z7Qc7rlDg.text: Come back, Griddle Cafe, come back!  This place used to be a Griddle Cafe, which started in LA, and is one of the best places anywhere for breakfast. They lasted five months before they packed up and returned to LA for unstated reasons.  The only things this place kept from the GC were the French press coffee makers (good call) and the prices (bad call). I don't mind paying $14 for a great breakfast, but not a lousy one.  The coffee was $5.  We got the hash and eggs. It was very small and the corned beef hash was tough and fatty. We mentioned it to our waiter and he just agreed and seemed as if he heard that sort of complaint all day.  The meal was comped, so we didn't complain too much. We assumed everything would taste lousy at that point, so we didn't ask for anything else.

a_Pu24IHPwhwtiUDo2g0xw.text: We stayed at the W couple of weeks ago and dined there a number of times.  This place works like a well greased machine for breakfast and lunch. Joseph is a real gem there, he should be cloned and spread all over the place. Quick, personable, good salesman but not too pushy. He hooked us on Mojitos there (kudos to the bartender, tasted the same every time. Fantastic)  The food is solid. Chinese was good but a bit too salty. Looks like the kitchen also serves in room dining (same items) and the pool. You can tell by the quality of food there is a chef with a brain and skill behind this.   The downside is dinner service. We came a couple of times around 5-7 pm and good luck trying to find a server that cares. I understand this is downtime but basic sequence of service should be followed. At some point there was literally noone on the floor we could ask for anything. Food was still good but service subpar.

eIx3n3JVx-rD-1JMTwDnKw.text: I had the pleasure of dining in The Northside Cafe on my first night in Vegas (Stayed at SLS for the first time as well with my boyfriend). I can honestly say amongst everything we had in our 3 day trip to Vegas, that this cafe was the BEST!(No, I am NOT kidding). We got the chicken tenders basket, which were the best tenders I have EVER had (sorry Culver's!) and my boyfriend got the nacho's and said they were "bomb-diggity" (basically, they were awesome).  We ate at many other "well known" establishments throughout our trip and were horribly disappointed, and spent WAY more money, I wish we had skipped a "must eat" restaurant (or two) and just eaten here again, and tried something new!  Servers are awesome and attentive, we will be staying at SLS on our next trip, and will absolutely be eating here (at least once or twice!). Highly recommend!

aOlv1DYe0Y4gmJrw7hFjLQ.text: Just checked into the SLS and needed a quick bite to eat. Wasn't a terrible experience but definitely could have done without eating here.  The hostesses and waiters are polite and very helpful and attentive but the food is eh... Iffy.  And it also took forever to come out, in a non-crowded place.  I had the popcorn shrimp w/ cocktail sauce and it was okay. It came with pieces of popcorn sprinkled about the plate. Cool theme I suppose. Anyway... It was seasoned well and the sauce was tasty, only came with a few shrimp though.   The chicken tacos were a big disappointment. Chicken was cooked well but not seasoned at all, bland. Tortillas were dry, pico de gallo was okay but as a whole it wasn't pleasant.   I think the best bet going here will be to order breakfast food(served all day)...

Z4N19WoU_UYaxOFIq3Vzww.text: Great food, great service!! Thank you Joseph!!! We will be back again on our next trip!!

Lo6Hs6NCju8h7nCba5N_qg.text: Without a doubt, the worst Chinese food EVER Even worse than pfchang which until today I thought was bad. Save your time and money

pWh2fkjNYZIPG0ztkKxytg.text: We had the veggie burger and kale salad. Fun and lively atmosphere with a real fireplace.

K22Ush-29xkqfP3RBdueJA.text: Amber our tattooed funny and friendly Bartender served up great drinks and Chinese food for me and my wife. For the last 3 night straight. Always please with the food and service. In fact the whole staff and management and the cooks does a great job.

RC0wwFJ-EQDq-2TTMjjg1Q.text: I had such a great experience with the staff and the food that I ate here twice in one day!  My colleague and I ordered our meal to go but Peter, who helped us, was so sweet and kind that we ended up hanging out a little longer than expected.  He truly went above and beyond and was extremely kind - even giving me a to go cup for my iced tea.    Thanks Peter!  Also...please try the tomato soup - it is DIVINE! Seriously...this is jazzed up and absolutely delicious.

P2mv-LTc_FxN_vVe9rWLDA.text: The food is crazy good. Service is great.  Bartenders make excellent drinks. Great place for anytime.

mkHllcpv0DeCiextD3955A.text: Beware of undercooked eggs! But the manager was great in handling the situation that followed said raw eggs and was a very gracious host.  Also, their gluten free options are not clearly labeled and pretty confusing. But if you check with the kitchen, they will let you know what is naturally gf and what can be made as such. It just seems silly that they could label which pancakes could be made gluten free, but couldn't label anything else.

1VxEVEu6df45S-Wnz5sx3w.text: Went to go eat with my bf for our first time & our server Juan was very attentive! Great customer service! We enjoyed some yummy breakfast burritos. Definitely going back for the Chinese Menu Juan mentioned to us

MF5Lrg0h7VLvKV6pffrtWA.text: I have stayed at SLS for 4 days and I have ate at this Northside Cafe and AMBER has been my server and she is AWESOME!!!!!  Great personality and customer service!!!!!  Sitting at the god bar was awesome every time with her as my server!!!!  Love her!!!!

OP7gZNjMu6hi_rdu0HIrsw.text: The best cafe ever! Caters to customers' wants and needs. I ordered something off the menu and they made it for me. Best service by Arnulfo and Kassey!

-xMOeIDayPSN8IfBAhiyRQ.text: The food here is amazing!! You can't go wrong with this for breakfast or lunch. The wait was only 15 minutes so don't let the line cool you. Just be patient.

SxGcTe4ju0lsAFPLgMwl7A.text: The food is delicious!! For Vegas the prices are very reasonable. It's located inside of the SLS Hotel and Casino. The ambiance is laid back, come as you are. We ate there several times. I had the corn beef and hash, the corn beef was good quality and tasty but I was not crazy about the potatoes. I normally like them with a little golden crisp. I also had the chilies quiles and the salmon with lemon butter sauce and garlic mashed potatoes, on separate occasions, and it was absolutely delicious!! The servers were very friendly. I can't wait to dine there again when I visit Vegas.

lU2QyvIo3UIt4Drg8KJKJA.text: I gave this place credit for being what I thought is wasn't.  I wrote it off as a simple hotel restaurant.  I was mistaken and I admit it. Solid menu and great coffee.  The coffee is served in your own French press.  Yum yum.

ZvbwQc1P0PigH6O7i5A-yw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner.  It was our first time coming here and I'm so glad we did!  Our server Christian was excellent! He greeted us with a "good morning" even though it was 6:30 at night.  We all had an "only in Vegas" moment!  Overall service was great.  Lots of hard working people there. I recently became a member of SLS rewards program which offers great deals especially for locals.    Now on to the food.  We had a 2 for 1 deal and I ordered the tomato soup and grilled cheese.  It was delicious and cheesy!  The soup was rich and tasty.  My bf ordered the Philly cheese steak.  It came with sweet potato fries that were also yummy! We were both too full to finish.  This was a great choice for a date night dinner.  Thanks Northside!

6SPT6S8nh-WKlmDJa2SWEw.text: there burger are so good and taste like a nice summer day at little league base baseball game when your a kid with a cold soda there really good.

_xebIbhdmjz-xN9vju6klg.text: Good food! I love the French press coffee. Our waiter was very nice and helpful with any questions.

HzuzBPRCHKRhKPtSpOaWJg.text: Great breakfast!  Worth the walk to the SLS!  My husband and I went on a busy Sunday morning.   Joseph T was our server,  he did an amazing job.  Our coffee was filled at least 4 times.  I had a breakfast meat substitution that he accommodated graciously.   Really awesome food.  Really great people!!  Totally hit the spot and we will be back next time in Vegas.

FGw976ZWMk3rdl5f2jaTog.text: ask for Joseph! He's the best, he'll get you the comfy booths and the bomb fried rice! Great alternative to the other places in SLS....Katsua is literally triple the prices of LA.

8aChmKZ4WOgJDgy-QeNF1g.text: I've eaten here three times this week because I'm in the hotel. I've had breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Overall, the food has been a huge disappointment every meal. The pork tacos were bland and tasteless. How do you mess up tacos? The steamed buns came out cut open on top and the spongey dough began to harden before I could even finish. Service wasn't great either. The value of what you are getting is poor when you consider the price. But it's the only thing available 24/7 in the SLS.

j5u91fKDCd5jMQN-z8Ec2g.text: We were a party of 9 for brunch.  The restaurant were not busy but split into 2 booths. We ordered both breakfast and lunch items.  Everything was delicious and the service was great.  Definitely a hidden gem in Vegas!

amIf_Ux3BLyLucDVTZA35g.text: Love Lola, she was the best. We will be going back especially when she is on duty.

eW0JJ7UnR2nTRpAjSA4bwA.text: Very dusty. Staff is slow. Menu needs work. This property is already struggling. Management is non existent.

44bXCLJLzH89T0746Da5Lg.text: Me and my girl went here for breakfast. I had the breakfast burrito which was really filling and tasteful. The only this is I wish that I had shredded potatoes instead of the whole quarter cuts. So in some bites I didn't just end up with a mouth full of potatoes and not being able to enjoy the egg, cheese, peppers,  or the chorizo. It came with a small side of Pico, which honestly I would've preferred salsa. The green chiles salsa added a hint of like flavor which was a great kick.  Over all I enjoyed the burrito and presentation.  Wifey had the Philly cheese steak which was tender and bread was so soft felt like it melted in your mouth. It was superb and I would recommend it. They sell both sides all day.  My server was average nothing was outstanding and there was a 20 min wait for a water refill. The noise level was enjoyable a mixture of music. The environment does gives off an 70's dinner fill.  The place wasnt jammed busy but this is a THURSDAY .

3zjs4HfFC98sa__QIw4TlA.text: The garden salad was good, the farmer salad was excellent, as was the house margarita. Food, drink, ambiance, and price point was enough to give it a 4 stars alone, but the service, especially the bartender Mike, was as good as it gets. I came in twice during my stay at SLS because it was open late and there were vegan/gluten free options. On my second visit Mike welcomed me back by name, with a big smile. I dined alone both times and left with a feeling like I had just dined with old friends. You just can't beat that. Love this town, love these people, just a great experience. Cheers y'all!

HIiVr9xc7wJNHktc7u3G0Q.text: I just had the most delicious lunch at Northside!  I had a coupon for 2 free entrees (it pays to join The Code!) for this newly renovated restaurant at the SLS Hotel & Casino, and it expired today, so I came in. I got a Club Burger - ham, tomato, lettuce, bacon and Swiss and a Chicken Caesar Wrap and ate half of each. I'd ABSOLUTELY be back!  I sat at the counter and had a great chat with my server/bartender, too. Clean, delicious food, friendly staff.  What more could you ask for?!

dqUkctG1xFIlxw884K1EVw.text: Cashew chicken was so good, also good  prices on drink special.   Thank you Juan, you were great.

LiDsMjIFnPZu1_8061xIVA.text: This place was great for morning hangovers! Some of the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had were made by Luciano Gesualdo behind the bar! And the portions of the entrees was neither too small nor too large. The service was fast too, no waiting. Would definitely go there again.

6WKccIYzh70qkuFKWA9vWQ.text: At the SLS casino, brekky is a bit limited.  With everyone hungover, or tired from a night out, this spot is in HIGH demand.  Knowing that, this place is a large restaurant and can accommodate big parties.  One comment about the hostesses...they act as if you need them.  They also have an attitude (they think they are better than you because they are sitting you?) I'm not sure.   But to the food.  The waffle with all the fixings was great!  Such a large serving with fresh fruit and very tasty with your choice of syrup.  This plate cost the Vegas price of $14.95.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. waiting in line
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fixings

UfoBqPR5cXDCuSt_8nDBqQ.text: Very disappointing. We waiting a hour or more for food. We were a table of 6. Waitress was very inattentive. Once we received the food WE SENT IT ALL BACK!!!! It looked disgusting and tasted even worse!!!! Chicken fried rice wasn't fired just white rice w/ very minimal pieces of chicken. Pan fried noodles had some type of jelly looking stuff in them. Just gross !

4dOqraRtm1uZJCIjong9JQ.text: Stopped in here for a late lunch...and got blown away! Luciana was a fantastic Server and the Kung Pao Chicken and Sweet & Sour Soup where 5 times better than another popular chain that rhymes with "Bangs". My food was so delicious, you can see how much got left behind on my plate. And their cocktails were really yummy too!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M081eRkon3hqOb2Iw4NeKQ.text: The Griddle Cafe with unreal sized items had lines formed a million miles long to join in the eating frenzy.  I was literally crushed when I learned that The Griddle Cafe at SLS Hotel closed, and another diner-restaurant turned up in its place.  Then, combined with the fact that buffet has closed at SLS over the last year, too, well, I reluctantly tried the Northside Cafe.  The menu is nice.  Open 24/7, they have lots of options and separate menus for each sitting.  I went for breakfast, and returned gladly for breakfast again the next.  A nice experience with a small french press for coffee ($4.95), the scrumptious and elaborate Greek Yogurt Parfait ($9.95), and the Breakfast Burrito ($13.95) were all very worthy.  Mixed great breakfast food with lovely service and you have yourself a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito ($13.95, 4.5 stars)

L82gM-NthhsvAudOTXpNiA.text: We have been staying at SLS resort the last 4 days and have come here to this restaurant 4 or 5 times and have had the worst service. We waited 35 mins just for our server to come to our table after we asked 3 other servers to help us. Only reason we come back here is theres nothing else in the casino thats opened late or that serves breakfast

RbE95fEBpCJxP6zC0wyfXg.text: Service exceeds expectations (two stars) The server accommodates our dinning needs without being prompted, does not interrupt our conversations, and goes the extra mile to ensure our restaurant experience is relaxing. He moves at the speed of life and made breaking bread extraordinary. He was also tastefully playful as he and his coworker posed in the background of our selfie. Very fun group.  Food was above expectations (one and half stars) The ordered food was as good to look at as it was full of flavor. There was a twist to the huevos rancheros that I didn't expect - the corn tortilla was crunchy and a pepper was placed on the top to nibble on throughout the meal. My wife had the chorizo that I nibbled on too - a bit salty with a slight kick. Eat these dishes fast otherwise these crispy delights will go soggy.  The theme of the restaurant is modern Vegas, which is consistent with the SLS hotel. The name of the restaurant has something to do with Chinese, but I didn't see any of that here. They are priced above average for the product delivered, but that's just Vegas. The music varies with weekend, it was cowboy Christmas when we came, so country was rocking this place when we were there. They have some small TVs in the back playing football. (One star)  Four and a half, but with the price, I'd give it just a four.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eA-fIJb9D2Q__NuGcTAXag.text: Why is the service here always so bad ? I live across the street and would come more often except the service is always so bad.   It's almost always the same servers when I go, an Asian girl and a bald guy and they are just slow and forgetful.   The food is pretty good which is why I didn't give them one star

pzlA4Sjmin9Y04ZA-VzoLg.text: Had the bacon and spinach omelette, Husband had steak and eggs, good was very good service was fast, waitress was attentive, what more do you need?

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3D_Cui_zAGYoyTfhTB_fbQ.text: DO NOT EAT THERE!!! I was chewing my food then suddenly I felt something weird in my mouth. It was a piece of wire! I was so disgusted.

QUwtmb4xiAT0plQW5lUazg.text: The egg white frittata with turkey, mushrooms, arugula and feta is AMAZING! My server Jim and the vibe of the place were on point too! I'll be back!

o1d7Lygb6PrRS1Yv4-a9lQ.text: The food was good. Slow service. Not enough waiters.  Waited 15 minutes for a waiter to come to table.  Servers are nice and working hard.  Bad management.

ScQE6_VEcuLhLJrl8TPeOw.text: Just checked in to the SLS this afternoon and decided to try this place. My wife & I weren't that hungry so we just ordered the Yang's fried rice & XO udon noodles. They were both very good, very satisfying. The service was fast, polite & efficient. We'll be back to try more items on their very diverse menu.

-qYWYyUeYtKBOn4EemNLyg.text: Oliver is absolutely amazing! He's personable, attentive, and has an infectious spirit. Normally when I order here, I get it "Togo", but this time I stayed and he gave me a reason to come back. He recommended the Philly Cheesesteak and it did not disappoint. Thank u for excellent service!!!!

WCb8r2o0x2llY_qACMfT_g.text: Had an early lunch. This place did not disappoint. Our food was excellent and so was the service. We went back late night for some carrot cake to go. It is the best carrot cake I have ever had in my life!!

OqRj1Z77Z0axBPT8m36m7w.text: I came here and went on a whim after a pool party at SLS's fox tail day party. It felt like being at an upscale Denny's though. Our group was about seven people and we were sad way in the back away from everyone. Back to school I wouldn't say that's odd but typically it seems like African-American people always sat in the world right now away from playing a general population site. Not saying anything about this place here it's just something to think about. If it was all right here. Nothing spectacular and it wasn't terrible that you never come back. It's just not a place you would recommend somebody go to if they were in the Vegas area. If your hungry and at the SLS then sure this is OK to try out. The menu has a great variety of food so there is definitely something there for everyone. All in all I will likely go back because it's close to the SLS pool, but if I'm not staying at the SLS I have no reason to be here.   #EatHereOrNot

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry pancakes
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos

WEGb0BVoHH8LFeLpWzamIQ.text: We had breakfast and dinner here. Both were outstanding. The avocado toast was delicious - especially with the freshly grated lemon, a nice and unexpected touch. I went in with low expectations for the Chinese food but have to say, we were very surprised. It was authentic and flavorful. Our server Oliver was friendly, informative and made dining at Northside memorable. He made fantastic recommendations and all of them came up aces. Next time we will definitely be back for the hazelnut French toast!

YC1yo2UlnV9whKTTJL4mJg.text: Had breakfast here. The hostess had given us lunch menus but we came for breakfast. Arrived at 10:58 at the close of breakfast. Our server Joseph had our backs and asked the chef for gluten free  pancakes and they were great and so was the coffee. Joseph was very attentive and personable and made the dining experience  very pleasurable. Thank you Joseph!  Because of you we want to  come back!

s47V14SLiU6q6NgSALp1DQ.text: Located inside the SLS, Northside Cafe is the only restaurant open 24/7 with a wide selection of American and Chinese foods. It's located right across from the pool entrance and also next to the other Chinese restaurant. Entrees are on the expensive side and the taste quality doesn't match the $$$ tag. The room service food you order come from the kitchens inside Northside Cafe.   Ambience (4/5): Restaurant is very sleek looking. Cafe was never empty the two times I was there, tons of occupied tables. There are both large booths and small tables for any party size. Great place for people watching too, as you get get all sorts of people walking into grab a bite.  Food (2.5/5): I ordered the beef chow fun and the Char Su buns. Beef chow fun had a great taste despite there being way more vegetables than actual noodles and protein. The char su buns was a disappointment though. Despite its high price point for two small buns ($6), the buns were not  made in-house. Most likely ordered from a frozen food purveyor. the bun texture was very doughy and didn't have much meat inside.   Service (4/5): Table was not very clean when I was seated. I had to ask one of the staff members to wipe it again. Otherwise, service was excellent.   I would definitely try Northside Cafe again if I find myself on the North side of the strip late at night. I would just stay away from the Asian menu/selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow fun
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Char su buns

3mVN-6IKzIgi7Rbm2XkzUA.text: I don't know what it is about this place but my husband and I love it. (We like SLS alot too) Great food, coffee, Bloody Mary, service...all good. Price is ok for Las Vegas also. Great spot for inside a small (er) casino. We'll be back in 2018!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish bacon and mushroom omelet.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worth $14.95. For real.

WzyWzN97X9QU7I7BveaTxQ.text: Came here for late night eats, food was great but service was a little slow but it was busy. Restaurant was very clean and server was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t6hISfDi5RLortZ0wxzfaQ.text: I would have left five stars except for they forgot my loaf of bread and gallon of milk with my to go order. Also my burger was already cold by the time I got home which is just a quick drive to los Angeles.

o7CzseA1Np8xChsLl6TBJg.text: The ambiance of this place is a 4 or a 5- it's very nice-looking and the staff is nice. Wendy was our waitress.  However, I would give the the food and coffee a 2.5. We came here for breakfast - we ordered coffee, a breakfast burrito and eggs Benedict. When I added milk to my coffee, it curdled up and floated in chunks to the top. Gross. I told the waitress and she got me a new coffee and milk. The new one had one small curdle but I drank it anyway because I am a coffee fiend and was coffee-deprived. The coffee was also very weak...you could see right through it (see my picture). We didn't want to complain and wait again so we just drank it. The second refill was better. The cups were tiny though (I'd say 4 ounces) and they cost $4 each with free refills. We only got two cups each and were not offered additional refills before getting the check. We saw other people walking out with to-go cups so we asked for the same. I kind of expected the coffee to be taken off the bill (since the milk was spoiled)  but it wasn't.  My breakfast burrito tasted good but it was 80% potatoes, which I would not expect at a price of $15. The eggs benedict was okay also.  If you are a coffee enthusiast staying at SLS Vegas, I'd definitely recommend Perq, their coffee was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito - stuffed with mostly potatoes
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weak coffee :(

cxPUUYQErh2F6kQ_lTQDtQ.text: Ordered the Walnut shrimp was delicious bit lacked the honey mayo sauce.  Service for take out was friendly & fast.

KPDuWgCH0fk6smwRPGwq_g.text: Good american food here. Perfect for breakfast + lunch. Wait isnt long. Blueberry pancakes are heaven here.  Portions are nice and big and entrees themselves are not expensive for a vegas strip hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry pancakes

uhi-MS6jgpHb5pV7kq-_Ag.text: Joe is now the night shift manager and service has already noticeably improved.  When the hotel was changing over to Starwood I felt that things had definitely slipped. Feeling great about this place again!

xkAoLiKbr8pReefiGjAg1g.text: Walked in with my family, waited for a server for 10 minutes, asked for help, another server rudely dismissed us, so we walked out and went to Umami Burger. The service here sucks and I've heard the food is just okay. Time to shut this place down and bring in a management company and employees that know what they're doing. There were 3 hostesses at the front. What a waste.

3aLpoCP8Jthm8q4bIfU_Gw.text: I've been here 4 times in the last 3 years. One of my favorite breakfast places. The food is really good! Prices are decent for the amount of food you get! The only complaint I have is the service is slow... Don't be in a hurry and you'll really enjoy it.

9_NMj30ygdy-BT2K05EZ_A.text: A nice clean typical in hotel restaurant but just what we needed after our night at SLS. Would return if I found myself that far down the strip again.

SPortBFXIr3fypowaGOAfQ.text: average food for above average pricing....  had the breakfast.  it says you can have it all day but i would skip it everyday.  i cannot describe as anything other then standard food.  the omelet did not make me want to come back.  the potatoes were the red kind, seemed more boiled than anything else.  the service was okay but clearly understaffed, or at least felt that way.

ptfHPZ0CRBBi2h1FMzKjOQ.text: OK. The absolute best service ever! Our server, Joseph, was incredibly helpful. I have an extremely strict diet and have a lot of restrictions and he was able to accommodate all of it with the Best and sweetest service ever! I'll definitely make this my go to when I'm in town

BmR1sNEH3ADhc3SVE07yDQ.text: Filthy, not a single booth clean- guests to my left had to ask for utensils to eat with a hitch means to me they have sat there with hot food for a while. This place is very dark inside- I get that it is 24/7 but... really it is cave like.

MAssUJw35g1igdpMsA8raQ.text: Jim was a great server. his recommendations were spot on. the french toast was really good but it's pretty sweet so make sure you have a sweet tooth. the burrito was also amazing. it was pretty filling so make sure you're hungry, have the potatoes in the side. coffee was $4, not really worth it but refillable.

GnKZrWyxuzMDRnwhdQICmw.text: I've only eaten breakfast here, but the food is above average. The strawberry waffles are great, but their pancakes are way to dry and cake-y for my taste. Service is pretty good and the staff are very friendly.

JP6IqR90I4r_HYRfqwBL5w.text: Stopped by here for breakfast again while staying at the SLS. Again, they still take long to do everything. Takes them an hour to bring the food, another hour to bring your check. They only have plain bagels, which is a bummer. BUt their strawberry and nutella waffle was TO DIE FOR!!! I wish i would have had it again before leaving. Im not even a big fan of waffles but this was heavenly...

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry waffle with a side of nutella... HEAVENLY

td-QY1INfm-izyet4ABUuA.text: We were staying at the SLS and wanted a late night dinner.  Northside provides the room service for the hotel but we decided to run downstairs and eat at the actual restaurant.  It's open 24/7 and has a extensive menu but not too extensive where you question the quality of the food.    The decor is very cool and modern and the service was great.   We ordered off of the Chinese menu and enjoyed everything we tried.  We also ordered the banana pie dessert and it was tasty.  Although the SLS hotel is spotty their restaurants do not disappoint.  I would recommend this cafe if you are staying at the hotel or just visiting.

EqZYpfgxUCU4mkAwpOZ4Tg.text: Our group spent the week in Las Vegas for Con Expo and we had a standing reservation for our entire stay at the Northside Cafe for our morning meeting and breakfast.  The food was outstanding but the staff was superb.  Nakisha was amazing.  Our group of 11 to 14 (depending on the day) was astounded that on the second morning that we were there she could remember their orders and have it waiting as they walked in.  Personally, I enjoyed her infectious smile and fantastic attitude.  Hands down, this was one of the best dining experiences that I have had.  Considering that I travel almost on a weekly basis, that is a sincere complement.

Dn7dNoLSmIzZJgHofNuEGw.text: Everything from dinner to breakfast was awesome!!!!!!! Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm! Highly recommended day or night if your hungry this is the place to eat while staying at SLS

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NwuKH1cG2QORbsSUoQRcXg.text: Don't come if you're hungry, slow or no service. The other issue when we first got there the person on the front while I was trying to get her attention, held up her finger while she was on her personal cell phone as if to tell to wait till she was done. Once seated we waited for 10 minutes and finally we got some water, another 10 minutes went by and nobody came to get our order even though two guys were just standing there and talking. Bad customer service, and not recommended for hotel guests. We finally walked out after 20 minutes. This was May 25th around 6 pm. They need CS training or get people that know what CS is.  So sad.

Iyv1EJdYVrOu84HIAvGlFg.text: Northside Cafe....hmm......I think the name just keeps them under the radar, but its truly a hidden gem in the desert. I ordered the nachos and the grilled cheese with roasted tomato soup and my wife ordered the Chinese steak n asparagus with yang chow fried rice. One word to describe the barbacoa nachos "undefeated" a real winner!!!! The grilled cheese just perfect and the roasted tomato soup was full of flavor with the correct balance of acidity...so good it brings comfort food to another level. The Chinese ny steak with asparagus was on point times ten, also the yang chow fried rice reminds me of our Hong Kong trip....Its rice, chix, shrimp, pork, egg, scallions with a lot of love.....so good!!!!!! Our server was friendly and attentive...THANK YOU  Joseph T.......Definitely be back again.

fpd8WcFJUscka_lcwgck2g.text: My girlfriend and I go here for breakfast on our weekends. You can never go wrong with the hazelnut chocolate French toast! She will either get the breakfast tacos or eggs Benedict... sometimes both!! We love this place. Great cheat day restaurant!! If you're fitness addicts like us!

_rRoQUmvvVSf3mhOkTfYyA.text: Luciano GeSualdo and the whole staff at Northside Cafe were friendly and accommodating. Recommend ordering the Pineapple Margarita from Luciano and there food is great too!

r5csBkvHqtCLPH9aBn_ENA.text: Friends and I are at the SLS for a business event. We chose the Northside Cafe for mealtime...We were so glad we did! Everyone at the table had complimentary things to say about their meals! I ordered a cheese sandwich (mmmm-mm yummy provolone) and a roasted tomato soup. The pesto garnish was delicious. I sampled my husbands Asian dish and it was tasty too. The Jasmine rice was moist, the chicken and sweet and sour sauce was good too. The service was really on point thank you Joseph. We noted suddenly that we had run out of time and Joseph helped to get the check handled. Another thing I enjoyed was having the staff ask about our experience as well...Louis the assistant general Mgr was there when I asked for a business card. He was interactive was wanting to make sure we were being helped. This staff seems to work well together.... And we were able to get out the door and on to business. Such a great example of being concerned for  the customers needs. We will definately be back

uoMiVqNZl12ii1gtXNKpGQ.text: Luciano Gesauldo gave us excellent service and made me the most delicious drink! We loved the guacamole and tacos! We will definitely be dining here again.

kpryihc1QmPnkn7Pg9mMcQ.text: Fellow Yelpers are right!! Service is disappointing, but the food it good. A bunch of young men, who stand around looking lost. Our server was spaced out, and so inattentive. Only the good food saved this place.

aJZ0jcUamA2f1-21Fzs7GA.text: mixed feelings...on one hand, the food is good and the cocktails tasty and strong, but the service is TOO slow and aloof...step it up girls and boys, this KEY restaurant at SLS could make or break the hotel.  where is the management?  maybe put a couple on the floor and teach your servers to help each other out and give your tough clientele stellar service.  i saw several folks walking out in disgust and the hotel begs for better!

jCZ32x0z09-ON3UY_-4GYQ.text: Tried this nice diner looking cafe in SLS. I can say the food is delicious and a 5 but the server was a 3. We ordered their breakfast and I will shout from the roof about how delicious the hazelnut French toast was. It came cooked well and full of flavor. Also, the Hog omelet was delic and the ham made that omelet scream. I ordered the pork and eggs w potatoes dish. I believe the menu says it has jalepanos but I didn't really taste any spice but I did enjoy their table hot sauce. Try them out!  I had one little problem w a hair on my plate but I sent it back and didn't have anymore surprises.

d0Qq6tOYtM9aQyEGbWZouA.text: Had great experience eating here. Our server, Christian, was spectacular and catered to our every needs. Overall great experience and would come again.

y9xnxmDS0VUvUpPTDjS8SA.text: New restaurant that took over for The Griddle Cafe. Had a great breakfast and the French Press coffee is dreamy.... I am still thinking about it. The plates are large and for Code members...we had a two free entree coupon! Amazing! Love this SLS.

TvgT-eSfHa6-ZkWaE6qv1g.text: LUCIANO was an amazing server!! Amazing food and customer service.. Highly recommend this place and this server!!

-yAKFeQhRuwQtUq0AhZWKw.text: ok, I wanted to dine in Ku Noodle but they were not open for lunch...also my partner likes plain food...well go to Northside Cafe and that's what you get including not so enthusiastic waiters.Maybe he had a bad day but don't let your customers know it.

4LhIVZB8xw_x_XkO6v_6lA.text: Great place for breakfast definitely a must try when youre at SLS i tried their turkey club and sweep potatos and they were amazing. The service was outstanding too my server juan m took great care of us

MBXOlGAJfzA3RrXV1e8NEQ.text: Awful. We were hoping to grab a quick bite to eat before the concert we are attending as we wouldn't be eating dinner until 1030. Ordered a flatbread and salad to bring to the room. The flatbread tasted like cardboard with canned green chiles and a pathetic excuse for tomato sauce. The salad was passable for salad. Waste of money. Get it together, Northside.

xf90k3gtXOzPcjSXtuMIlg.text: I was staying at SLS for my vacation and i had breakfast there everyday. Food was good, service was outstanding . Not only did our server juan m provided us with exceptional service but he is also a hottie.  SLS is a great place to stay at all the staff was friendly and their many dining options make it even better but you should try the cafe food after the club or for breakfast.

xXUr8UGpWj4nqSvdNzslaQ.text: Though I missed the huge pancakes, the food is still great and servers were friendly. Thanks to my server, Christian for the excellent service! 5 star for the food and service! Going back again next time!

GEQHJVUh9c2QF7Xbdbj6yg.text: Nick gave the best customer service! Kept up with my drinks and made sure my girlfriend and I were completely taken care of. Keep up the great work.

RAFp1r7XEbKkFwglwUYB6A.text: Christian was a great server. He made sure that our coffee was hot and fresh. Our food came out great and his service was excellent! If you get him as a server, he'll sure take care of your foodie needs!

OEX5gO77N83Nuxw3OhMvxA.text: Nice place to take a break when you're in Las Vegas. Not pretentious at all and has a friendly staff. Good food options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

8pfATheNgoL9ETz-lWuoxw.text: I have had dinner several times at Northside and the food is always good. This time we had Juan M as our waiter and he was very impressive. His professionalism, courtesy, efficiency and overall has a  great personality. Being LOCALS we eat there quite often so in the future we will request Juan M whenever he is working.

AwS7abHLVTMLI3aQJpIsOA.text: Exhausted from walking around all day. Didn't really know what to eat so we decided to stop by and eat here. Thank god there was no wait. Hostesses were really nice sat us down. server was "Juan Mayorga" he approached our table took drink orders, Was really nice, talkative and asked about our day and what shows were watching ect... Then we ordered Buffalo Chicken Wings, Nachos and Spicy Shrimp Street Tacos. Food was "okay" but the server was "excellent". I would go back if I want a quick bite but I would want Juan to serve us!

MHapJ5dPQKv0iyK5LF9J1A.text: Great food, had the filet with shrimp scampi. French pressed coffee and great service from Christian!

gmF384qiZKym91PajASjtg.text: So here's the deal,  I like the wide variety of things on the menu. They're open 24/7 and have a causal vibe with a decent ambiance.  You can get anything from traditional diner breakfast to Italian,  Mexican,  and Chinese.  So if it's late night and you don't know what you want, it's a nice spot.  However,  I'm thinking that with this wide variety,  the quality may suffer.   I ordered the parpadelle with short rib ragu.  Sounds delicious doesn't it? Well I'd say it was an issue with quality of ingredients, and partially preparation.  The short ribs were tough and chewy and not trimmed properly,  and the parpadelle was slightly undercooked. My friend ordered a cheese steak sandwich and her said it was... Ok.   All in all not too bad,  but not that good.  And we were also waiting to be helped for about 20 minutes before anyone came to the table.  I think it was a miscommunication on who's section the table was in,  so I understand,  but still...  Has potential,  could use some work.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib ragu and parpadelle
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cheese steak sandwich

QRO4b7HcfYcKH37H3Mkiqg.text: Breakfast Bloody Mary was balanced by the thick, crunchy and cured bacon strip.  I had the lox sandwich and it was a mound of freshness and flavors.  Thank you!

n6sKKImyOXJAmPv9RQ5rCw.text: This restaurant is really good! I love the food here and the prices weren't half bad either! This is a place you definitely need to try if you're in town! Our sever Joseph was the best!

ryKXFD1hjDhoeyl7T8KeKQ.text: I am SO not happy about this. I specially asked the woman and guy hostess if the soy chow mein is like real chow mein noodles. And they told me yes. I ordered to go, and I'm not sure what this is. It doesn't taste good at all. I'm so disappointed because I was starving after my long drive. Just wanted to come back to my room to enjoy dinner. I feel mislead.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Says Chow Mein on the menu, but nothing like it, Nor does it taste like it.

WOi9yFEO_MmJ5V_VGGm_TQ.text: This morning I ate the most amazing thing. Hazelnut French toast. Then the eggs Benedict with cheesy hash browns and orange juice with the perfect amount of pulp. If you're staying at the SLS this place is a must-eat. On top of all the nice atmosphere and great food our server Joseph, was great and came prepared with good recommendations. 5 stars!

Sv2fbmK8je4Fi7OesYdhvw.text: Get some late night vegetarian options! The limited menu past 11PM doesn't even have 1 vegetarian entree. What??? I'm pretty sure deciding to get dinner after 11PM is a regular occasion in Vegas. I ended up just getting chips and guacamole. My guacamole was disgusting, old, with slimy onions and cilantro. I would have ordered a fresh batch, but it took 20 minutes for the server to come back and check on us, and my friends had already finished their entrees. Also, the server acted annoyed when I asked if the kitchen could  make me anything vegetarian. Basically, he just cut me off and told me there was nothing the kitchen could do because it was 11:10. I find it hard to believe a staffed and stocked kitchen can't make a meatless entree on the fly. Then again, they can't even make decent guacamole. At least the chips we're crispy, and the salsa was okay.

dEBDxInaSIIp1TcZlbeF6g.text: Just left Northside full and happy, thank you Joesph Amazing server.  Made Me & my wife's Christmas even better.  Can't wait to come back and enjoy another meal.

ISL_vPbAAmRA8feQf3FdGA.text: The service was incredible; the food was even better. Come for the shumai, stay for the schezwan. I literally walked over from Katsuya...ten times the service and flavor at half the price.   Let's just say I'm a sucker for value.

7NTDpSnRSKGSCaIoMtb5VQ.text: This restaurant is located inside the hotel. It has chinese food which I thought wouldn't be well-tasted becuz of the Western style of this restaurant. However, they were so delicious, especially: less oily. Yang-Chou fried rice, salt&pepper squid with rice, chicken and corn soup, and soy sauce chou mein are very tasty. The staff are very friendly and enthusiasm.  When I asked for to-go boxes, they gave me huge boxes so I asked for smaller ones. Also, there are big plastic bags, 3 sets of cutlery, you know, not many restaurants do that.  In sum, I had a very satisfied dinner with my family! Very highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FXvFWXE82zH9QRpFImWpfg.text: Joseph was an excellent server. High spirited and was entertaining, the food was delicious and came out a lot sooner then I thought, would definitely eat here again since it's open 24 hrs. Many choices in the menu

UrEoU5z6DAzB5I72r4H_IA.text: If I could give more than 5 stars, I ABSOLUTELY would...my day started with 4 hours of dialysis, aka torture lol...and then I hopped on a plane from Dallas to Vegas...my first stop was at the Northside Cafe, where I had excellent customer service from my waiter, Oliver...the pork fried rice was EXCELLENT as well.  ....fast forward a few hours and I started having crippling cramps (common side effect of dialysis) ...I came back downstairs to the store looking desperately for pickle juice and a banana around 2am...the store had neither...so, getting desperate, I walked back over to the cafe, and told the wonderful Oliver what was going on...without hesitation, he goes and gets me a cup of pickle juice AND a banana....so to sum up my story - I had a terribly rough day until Oliver swooped in for the save! I will be forever grateful and will be a returning patron.  Thank you so much!

bpCt17uDz10vgUipk7O8qA.text: As we became helpers, down the years, we have found out that giving a "5"  is hard find these days This resturant/ cafe, I would like to give a 3.5 stars. Normally I would give a 4 Star, but they are losing that extra half star due to service... when you arrive, you wait online out side the cafe, until a table is available, when we were finally seated around 10 minutes, not bad at all.  It took another 13 minutes to be greeted by our sever John.  ( other tables around us where seated after us and greeted and received drinks before we were even greeted) John was a good server.  Food was fabulous-  We ordered two coffees One order of Eggs Benedict- 2 poached eggs, Canadian bacon, served on an English muffin topped with lemon hollandaise sauce, with breakfast potatoes. One order of Caramelized banana (3) buttermilk pancakes filled with chopped and caramelized bananas (mine had no filling) add an extra $1 and receive caramel, candid walnuts & strudel on top. Also served with warm maple syrup, tops off the pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of coffee
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

e3T42Un2KplDopfSfDuUuw.text: I really wasn't feeling Brian our waiter he didn't check to see if we enjoyed the food he was not courteous at all only reason why I know his name was his name tag. Food good and hostess Najia and De'Anthony where awesome and very friendly and helpful. We talk to Anthony the mgr about the issue he said he will talk to Brian and gave us a voucher to come back on them.

LDkCEWj_22EQsLRH9Vy5Gg.text: Always a great meal here. I had the 3 course dinner with Greek Salad, the main course I had Salmon w/Asparagus in a lemon cream sauce and dessert I had Ny. Cheese Cake w/Strawberries. I sat at the bar and this was a suggestion from the waiter. It really hit the spot. Simply Awsome! Everything done to perfection.

3_4tpWyM-lFRB_3VlMnBEw.text: Their menu is very limited and overpriced. Honestly just go around the corner to the deli and pick something up.  They have so much staff but their service sucks. All they do is talk amongst each other and it's not even that busy.

sgqqHDcAw9rHFLACdmoorg.text: I tried this restaurant at SLS where I stayed.  Ordered the noodles Beef Chow Fun with gravy. It was hot and delicious. Also had the sui-mai. Was also hot and delicious. I would recommend this place as they have very nice menu. Something for everyone. Not just Chinese food. My only tip to the restaurant is to expedite food to patron once ready. Sitting at the bar can see food waiting for minutes on.  P.S  My server was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Chow Fun with Gravy

WuI5gmAker20dUb3N12DRg.text: Server Joseph delivered amazing service to my partner and I.  Very friendly and funny server.  We would definitely recommend to come here especially a night after going out on the strip.  Service is great and food was the perfect cure.

6coUmu3hc0Bms75RF6kg8A.text: Our server, Joseph was amazing! Personable, friendly and attentive. Food was outstanding and huge portions. Definitely a great joint to check out while in Vegas.

MDmDPUSvgu7pNZTJgsymIQ.text: I came here on a late night food-hunt with my family. We were going to go to Umami Burger but they were closed, so we saw this eatery as a convenient option since we were hungry, and they were open until late.  I like that they had their menu outside. There were a lot of options, and the cafe looked clean and well-kept. Our server was nice and informative.   We ordered the Kung Pao Chicken which was starred as one of their favorites. It was tasty and not too spicy. Perfect, since my nephews were with us. We also ordered the fried rice and had requested the chicken on the side. This was comparable to other Chinese-style fried rice dishes I've had before. We also ordered the Orange Chicken, also good but not too much of a orange flavor sauce. The Honey Walnut Shrimp was very tasty and the shrimp was big. It was on the pricey side of $16.95, but worth it. Actually, all of their prices were a little on the higher-end, in my opinion.  The Eggplant Tofu was just okay. We agreed that it lacked flavor, almost like it needed more of a garlic or ginger taste, or both, even maybe a little more salt, which is unusual since Chinese food is usually really salty. The Pan Fried Noodles was good; and we were happy to find out it was much like our Cake Noodles in Hawaii, our home. It was crunchy but soft too with the gravy. It had Gai Lan and mushrooms on it. I would come here again if I was craving Chinese food in Las Vegas.

f49zgqdgxkOj_vYye45Syg.text: We were sat very quickly, came down for lunch around 9 am. Server was friendly, and had our French press out to us in no time. The coffee was great, both of us ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it was tasty. The chorizo was perfectly seasoned and the sunny side up eggs were cooked to perfection. Also saw some French toast come out on the table next to us,will have to try it next because it looked very good! If your at the SLS I'd highly recommend checking this place out for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros

zp-N5pvv2WSc9nHJigG3SQ.text: Denny's is comparable, I'm not sure why it has anything above three stars. The food is mostly basic and at times is bland. The chicken tenders were hard and mostly unappealing; same goes for dumplings. The fried rice was lacking something, it was okay but missing a good taste. The service fell short for a good hotel like SLS, can't say if I'll come back but I'd avoid it.

Skm1BG7PR1hVMbc7G9ieug.text: Been here twice in the last 24 hours. Not sure why we went back again after the service was bad and food is average. Probably because we are staying at the hotel and it was convenient.   No thanks, we have vowed as a group to not return.  It is very confusing because it seems like there is plenty of staff in their red shirts, they just aren't doing their jobs.

wu_ldrAU-qfexbeY5L84eQ.text: I was at the SEMA show at the convention center and the SLS hotel was within walking distance so I thought lets find some food there.  The options at the SLS aren't that great but Northside Cafe looked promising (for a Cafe in a casino).  Me and wife but got breakfast options,  the ham steak and eggs and corned beef hash.   The ham steak and eggs was good and a the portion size was decent...the corned beef hash was also pretty good (massive amounts of butter!) but the portion size was comically small.  The bloody mary was decent and oddly enough the standout item from this meal was the piece of Rye toast I got with my ham steak and egg.  For some reason it was just really delicious.  The price is typical for this type of place,  ~15 dollars an entree.     I was considering giving this place 4 stars because in terms of the food it's actually in the upper half of casino cafes but the hostess was really rude (or just clueless?).   When we were leaving, I asked the hostess if there was a place in the hotel that served coffee.  She was like well we serve coffee here...and gave me attitude while pointing to the sign above her saying "well this is a CAFE."    I was like uh...ok.      Technically what she said isn't wrong but it's how she said it that's the problem.

vfJnM_io-6CDECpQDZBzNg.text: I'm so sad to say that we had a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE LAST NIGHT. We have eaten many times here and it was great! It's now a year later and we were hungry after a  concert about 1am so yes it was late, maybe that's why it wasn't so good BUT it doesn't give the staff a reason to be RUDE completely ignore us, 4 tables were sat after us and were served before us.  I guess there is a late menu now which has like 3 items on it! All we wanted was a grill cheese! How hard is that! Then out of the 3 items on the menus they offer late they didn't have hal  Maybe this place is still good early just don't go after midnight if your hungry!

57prNfEhzvtgVxon7n8Iag.text: This place was amazing. The chocolate hazelnut French toast was best I have ever had...hubby had Chinese chicken basil which was also great!! Server, Oliver was attentive and a superstar!!!!!

TuUbFtm-N9yERbLXzDWyVw.text: Came here cause our uber driver recommended it. He ended up coming with us and drinking cause it's vegas so why not! Had an amazing waitress named Stephanie and we started talking about what SLS stands for and I said SUCK LICK SLURP! I hope they use it for something like a signature drink !

KUWEeuMNGXeIuRlBDDMNhA.text: Late night menu is horrible. Very very limited. Will not return to this place. Find something on the strip, anything would be better than this.

gQRNF-ESdUEloscS_WjRAw.text: Ordered the strawberry waffle which was pretty good, ordered panfried shrimp & pork dumpling was not good at all too much chives, my boyfriend ordered the chilaquiles one word HORRIBLE they were not chilaquiles more like nachos with just some pico and some nasty chorizo. The food is no where near authentic. Customer service was whatever never got our drinks refilled or ask if we needed anything. Disappointed :/

Nby5ib8WZcE-Vyy3hxwkGQ.text: Update since the restaurant responded on Yelp: I want you to know that the service and quality of food only went downhill since my first post. After literally begging someone to take our order, we received out meals with incorrect items. In addition, the hot and sour soup was like tar. I had ordered a pork bun - knowing it would take 20-25 minutes. After being told 2x that it would be on our way, the waiter showed up 30 minutes after the order to say my meal was never placed. So no food for me...   Sure they discounted our tables' meals, but since I ordered the soup and bun, l left with no meal. This was a horrible experience! Go elsewhere. This reassurance is not staffed to service customers and the food was awful!

kqOj-xMcMM-nnG-rnyPcXg.text: My friend and I stayed at the SLS hotel for a few days and Northside was our go to spot for late night and early morning grub. The Nutella French toast is a must try for breakfast if you like sweet like I do! The Philly cheesesteak was mmmm mmmm good for dinner! If you are feeling the Asian menu I highly recommend the orange chicken. All and all the prices were great and everything we tried tasted good. The only thing that caused me to knock off a star was the service. We visited at least 5 times and the service was inconsistent and not great. The servers were not rude, but we just found them to be very busy on a couple of occasions and MIA on other occasions.

As for a quick meal, this place is fine--if a little overpriced.  However, the other food choices are so much better here that I can only see myself choosing this spot  for convenience.

QyAWGGoiNXliw4zSgH74Dg.text: Just finished breakfast at the Northside Cafe.   The Whole Hog omelette was delicious and the press coffee was great.  My wife enjoyed the Eggs Benedict and said that it was cooked to perfection.   Along with the good food, the service we received from Joseph was fantastic!  Joseph was engaging and made the meal fun.

edEEl0lcf5PniOX60t0dFA.text: Ordered the Mongolian beef. Surprisingly it was really good. But my gripe is that it came with no rice... what kind of Asian restaurant cafe or not would sell a main dish with no rice included?

shV21gGhpwFYdX1F4aYy6w.text: They had me at French press. Seriously - why don't more restaurant serve French press coffee? So strong and smooth and delicious!  The decor is a bit greyscale for me, but it works - imagine a desaturated fifties dinner with an industrial modern twist. The waiter was great - quick, friendly, and accurate and the place was clean.  We're both on a health kick, so we needed to modify our orders a tad.  I had the protein frittata with added mushroom and no toast and he ordered the steak and eggs with added spinach and no potato and no bread.  The order came out perfect - eggs over medium, steak medium rare. Everything was perfect. The food itself was good   Overall very good experience. A tad pricey, but it's convenient.

GQD8ISJJGHED2cVUKOnHFA.text: First time here. We stoped for breakfast... Everything looked so good! We shared the continental breakfast and breakfast tacos. Both were delicious. Portions were large so we might not need to get lunch. Our service was great. Prompt and polite.  So many good places to eat in Vegas!  This place is well worth considering.

VJDiXFoCOw9pJeIULntHfg.text: We went here twice for breakfast as part of a SPG reward. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. We enjoyed the breakfast burrito, grilled cheese with tomato soup, and the Denver omelette. The service was good and they even provided a cup to take some coffee to go at the end.

wupR2eSnEndr_O-gm0P44w.text: If you're staying in SLS, definitely the best spot for a variety of foods is Northside. From burgers to Chinese food either way you can't go wrong. OLIVER MADE OUR EXPERIENCE HERE THE BEST. We've been here a few times and he was hands down the most exceptional server we had. SHOUT OUT to you man! Thanks for your hard work and keeping on top of everything- especially at busy times.

oVRwuD5RnsA14xOheWsZfA.text: Change in plans with work so went downstairs from my room to get some lunch. Had the turkey club. Came out on a roll which was slightly stale but that was fine because there was plenty of food otherwise. Steak fries were good. Avocado on sandwich was fresh.  Sat at counter and service was attentive.  24 with tax and tip for a diet and a sandwich. Pretty standard I think for Vegas. I did see the fried rice come out. It looked like it was not the best thing on the menu.

t2RoS-UPOMPBPhKKwE4RnA.text: Pricey for what you get. Food was like what you could make at home, but a bit worse off.  Decor was a mix between retro diner style and something more contemporary, but nothing with any 'Chinese Kitchen' motif.  Service was bland and could be better.  The location was great though, as it was conveniently situated for us. I won't be coming back.

CIhupDwLo6XPEjHQcwk4SA.text: Great breakfast food, and terrific wait staff!  I would definitely hit this place up again if I were in the area.  The server was funny and hustled, the eggs were great, and the place was fun.

MGgDRUrO_ssnjXn_QFgIJg.text: Likely one of the most saddened persons in Las Vegas when The Griddle Cafe at SLS suddenly shuttered, but impressed by Northside Cafe during a substantial breakfast just days after the switch, it was on the invite of SBE's Director of Dining that myself and five friends sat down to experience the restaurant's newly launched dinner and late night menus this past Saturday - a total of 32 plates showing a great degree of diversity with the majority far better than one would expect from 24/7 dining, though one specific section proved barely passable at best.  Admitting up front that the experience was fully comped, a few requests made of the kitchen while the vast majority of the items were served carte blanche, it was at a large booth in the far corner of the room that our party was sat and with IHeartRadio playing lightly overhead the meal was presented with exemplary service, first bites of shrimp atop popcorn perhaps a bit *too* clever for their own good while the stack of banana pancakes served a strong reminder of the high quality marking my aforementioned breakfast, the pure maple syrup presented steaming hot and drizzled liberally to our heart's content.  Opting next to send out dinner entrees, the later rounds focused on recently launched dim sum and Chinese plates, Northside Cafe certainly is not skimping on ingredient quality as both the rib eye and filet were served a juicy medium rare, the trio of snappy shrimp deftly doused in garlic while asparagus and potatoes were both as good as upscale steakhouse fare.  Blase as ever about salmon, the fish itself nicely cooked though a bit lost amidst all the brightly citrus sauce, a duo of pastas was presented simultaneously with far more balance, the fettuccine cooked perfectly al dente with heavy cream laced inn garlic while the cheesy pockets of ravioli were quickly devoured by the left half of the table, the simplicity of the crushed tomatoes and herbs praised by an Italian at the table reminiscing of his grandmother's red sauce.  Transitioning abruptly to Chinese, the next nine plates offered on a newly launched list of dim sum, suffice it to say that substantial tweaks are needed before this part of the menu can be appropriately recommended, the fried items by far the best of the group while pork was sticky and far too sweet, the steamed options universally overcooked as if by an inexperienced hand,  Admittedly shocked by the drop in quality, and soon to become even more confused by the fact that actual Chinese entrees were confidently prepared as if by an entirely different kitchen compared to those sent out before, it was to a whole steamed bass that eyes were next widened, the flesh rich and moist with a delicate bit of lemon and lovely top-notes of scallions and lemongrass.  At this point already overserved, some items boxed for home while others unfortunately went to waste, it was still to nine more full-size plates that the slowly dwindling table was treated, the salt and pepper  dazzling beneath delicate batter while fried rice, chow fun, and everything made with noodles was on par with the best of Spring Mountain Road, without too substantial a hike in price.  Dining partners already waiving the white flag, or at least folding napkins and debating the pros and cons of renting a room within the hotel rather than carrying the food coma home, it was with five desserts that the evening would end and although the cookie was far less 'gooey' than one may have expected there was no lack of quality anywhere else, the fruited options each outstripping modest expectations while the peanut butter cup studded cheesecake was silky, smooth, and not oversweetened, the bread pudding taking the opposite path in offering the steamy custard block topped in ice cream with a shallow pool of golden brown sauce.  ****Offering better food than almost any 24/7 spot in Las Vegas, with prices far more forgiving for comparable items than at places further South on the Strip, Northside Cafe continues to impress on a level far greater than passers-by may notice, the dim-sum menu a lone exception while breakfast, dinner, Chinese plates, and desserts offer plenty of well-priced hits.

Prices are reasonable and they have a bar with an OK selection of beer.

P58AE89L7ivzI9QLUNrn7w.text: The Northside Cafe was exactly what we needed for a late night bite.  The food was delicious and our server, Joseph, was top notch.  Attentive, great personality and took very good care of us and all his other tables.  Will be back!

1KX36UfYUS_7T2QvU0Ei3A.text: So, I am one of those people that before I go somewhere I do a bit of research on the area and the hotel itself.     In my research, I found that the SLS Hotel is the new home which where the Sahara hotel used to be.   I found that there is a chandelier made out of the old Sahara hotels door knobs, there is also an installment of the old chandeliers is right in front of the pool, and at this restaurant there used to be a place called the griddle which had scratch and sniff wallpaper.   Well the griddle is gone, and Northside Cafe stands in its spot. As I approached the hostess stand, it was a young lady named Mercedes, who asked about the old wallpaper. It just so happened that I've bit of the old wallpaper is in the glass casing in front of the new restaurant. She was so sweet, and she even allowed me to literally scratch and sniff the wallpaper LOL. And yes it still smells good LOL she did not have to do this for me but it made my day for someone who is a researcher like myself LOL make sure you stop by and see her at this place!

Tj0rJvZw6dli_ztDtocdKQ.text: This restaurant shocked us at how great the food was. We end up doing the 3 course meal which consist of a ceasar salad, steak and potatoes and strawberry cheesecake. The steak was juicy and the potatoes was to die for.

DNXAj0njtwODMrVHZi51IA.text: The food: A The waiter: A The experience: A  While visiting Vegas, I had dinner at Northside inside of the SLS hotel. I expected "Vegas-style" cafe, but I was treated to more. Firstly, the menu was unique as it had diner dishes beside Chinese food, and waiter, Oliver, proficiently laid out some options for me based on what I wanted. I ended up with a rice with chicken and shrimp dish that was excellent. Oliver was a wonderful attendant, but topped all when he and my best friend coordinated bringing me a birthday cake--candle and all. Made my day.   This unique cafe is a must visit for a quick, but high-end bite. And be sure to ask to sit in Oliver's section for an expert experience.
