OdUuQCj3sGgnwnM1_Iw5Og.text: We had absolutely amazing service at this restaurant, which was one of the only ones opened late at night at the hotel. I forgot the name of the server (started with an A, Albert?).  The food was delicious- the tomato soup and the Mongolian beef were both great.  I wasn't a fan of the jasmine rice, and the tea was absolutely terrible. But everything else was wonderful.

Bo7y3s5mgpu5xiCkB-2Z3A.text: Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen is the 'diner' in the SLS Hotel located just off the casino floor.  Open 24 hours.  I've eaten here a number of times.  My favorite item is the Greek salad with grilled shrimp added. The salads are always fresh and crisp.    I've tried the breakfast burrito and found it okay.  Felt like it was missing something but couldn't really say what would improve this dish.  Huge potato pieces in a big burrito were a bit overwhelming but not a bad choice if you are in the mood for a burrito.  Good quality coffee.  Service here is always good.  This restaurant is clean and the open kitchen is immaculate.  Northside Cafe is definitely a solid choice if you are seeking a diner type meal especially at odd hours. Alcohol is available.  Prices are moderate.  Didn't save my check but the Greek salad with shrimp is about $16.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YKtJCFq3KjnS-0E708ofUQ.text: Another one of those "if I could leave 0 stars" reviews, coming at ya.  I've stayed in this hotel twice and eaten at this restaurant 3x. Every time it's been disengaged staffed, incorrect orders, long wait times... And who doesn't carry honey mustard???   ON TODAY'S visit, the one that sealed the fate and earned this review was brought to you by the inability to cook eggs. I ordered mine over medium. They brought me over easy. I asked, "hey. These are over easy. Can I get the over medium please?" "No problem. I put in for over medium, but I'll ask again and add 'well done'." A few hours later, once my sausage and potatoes are cold, they bring out 2 more, over easy eggs. I poke them... to confirm they are just two more eggs over easy, and yes they are. My server goes, "Are those medium enough?" I was like, "...um... No they are over easy too..." And he goes, "Well those are OUR over medium."  LOL WAT  Followed up with, "You must really know your eggs!"  Yes. Sir. Knowing the difference between over easy and over medium makes me quite the connoisseur.  TL;DR Service is bland, food is slow, lighting is harsh. You have to seat yourself and they don't have mountain dew... WHO DOESN'T HAVE HONEY MUSTARD OR MOUNTAIN DEW????

cHBF1XHmd3YQm9l5OKoEhA.text: Great breakfast, nicely timed with quick kitchen times and an attentive wait staff.  The Whole Hog Omelette was great and I will have it again in the morning!   Nice surprise to find in a place with limited restaurant options.

XLfS8Qs5hoT9fh3NK6Ss_w.text: We came by on a Saturday at noon. There were a lot of available tables but the kitchen took 50min to get our entrees ready. The waitress did apologize and gave us a new round of drinks on the house. The food was good though, we hope they will improve.

GEGR0Z5QZQgAsmphz676Hg.text: My husband and I decided to go to Northside for my birthday dinner.  Yes, a lot of pressure on Northside to give me that great meal.  KC, our server, suggested the surf and turf.  I could not have been happier.  The steak melted in my mouth, the shrimp was tasty and my side of asparagus was wonderful.  It was the perfect amount and very very good.  My husband wasn't as crazy about his pasta with chicken but I gave it 5 stars because of the great service and my excellent meal.  Give it a try!!

KhUi1mxIBh2ruEUQc9HjWA.text: OMG this place is yummy.  I had the carnival torta, the meat was so juicy and tender.  Prices are very reasonable and portions generous

2gQxkN-HKLbbc8ZKyml_jg.text: Had the Nutella French toast and oh man... It truly was orgasmic. The fiancee liked the breakfast burrito as well, but I really didn't. Still, I can't say enough, GET THE FRENCH TOAST.

OIN6Ew09da0kTOjUqSGmWw.text: The Nutella French Toast is amazing! Only thing I wish is that they still did the 20+ varieties of pancakes like when the place first opened as the Griddle Cafe.

_ZmMs7vpshF2p_XbXT-1Ow.text: I have mixed reviews about Northside Cafe. Actually, I don't really know what it is. There's nothing negative about the place, but I felt a little uneasy dining at this establishment. Regardless, I found myself returning every afternoon to feast at the SLS Diner. I remember ordering the protein scramble and I loved it because it was made with egg whites. Any restaurant that offers an egg white option deserves mad respect in my books. I guess the only small complaint I have is that it's tad on the pricier side, which I really don't mind all that much. My African-Filipino-American roommate ordered the sweet potato fries and he literally fell in love with it. He's the type of person to never consume unhealthy dining options; however, every time a side order of sweet potato fries ends up on the dining table. Even though I'm not a fan of sweets, I decided to try it myself. Let me tell you this, I guarantee it won't be a disappointment.

ACqtBKfhBjQL7FWQdDuO2A.text: I love breakfast for lunch so when I came in and asked my server what breakfast  is best Maria suggested the burrito. Best thing that ever happened! Amazing food and service!!!

TFD0crceYzcXfLRHELFisA.text: One of the few casino restaurants that serve regular comfort food. Maria was a great server. always came to make sure my drink was filled (which is very important to me) and that I was taken cared of, making this place one of the few strip restaurants I will come visit again.  Food was great and reasonably priced (for a casino).  Overall good food, great server, and good price.

-LqS6bO_IFHSLOWUObq2rA.text: Found this place wandering around SLS and ordered the French Press coffee with my girlfriend. She ordered the spinach and bacon omlete while I order hurveo rancheros breakfast which the waiter advised me on since I told him I was medium hungry.  The portion was perfect for what I wanted just as he said so good recommendation. Very polite as well.  Also I found out this place is open 24/7 which is awesome.  I'd recommend this place.

11slhSVEXGW9ofi_nIFr6Q.text: This place should get a minus5. Ordered a simple 2 egg breakfast plate and sausage wasn't done, potatoes cold and eggs weren't how I ordered them, got my toast after I was done eating what I was gonna eat. Server didn't have enough to do so stood over us and talked the entire time. Waste of my money. Nvr again

3JxHlZ3U-44WY_zV2ljj8w.text: Food was good, I had breakfast, but my host Mercedes was even better. Extremely accommodating since I had my two little monsters with me and helped me procure some essential daddy products. Nice to see real people in a party city! She's very cute with a nice smile too so that helps brighten up the day.

PVTDHAb7wQs4JtXtq2evhA.text: Sad to see The Griddle go, but this place is equally as good. Service was wonderful, Juan M helped us and was personable and had great recommendations. Definitely will be back soon!

3ajFhl_uPqtonjCSKE7H3A.text: This place is terrible.  It is new, so hopefully it will change things up.  SLS doesn't have many food choices during the day, and we were staying there for a week.  So we ended up eating breakfast there our first morning, and then once more for a small dinner.  It is overpriced, and the food is terrible.  My husband ordered steel-cut oatmeal, and I ordered pancakes.  His oatmeal was something like $12, which seems like a joke.  And my pancakes were dense and flavorless.   Another time, we just got soup and salad.  We had the cobb salad, which was lacking in flavor and ingredients.  And I got the roasted tomato soup, which I am certain came from a can or container.  I also had the "warm cookie" and ice cream dessert, which came on a scone instead.  The ice cream, even, was terrible.  Most disappointing experience of our Vegas stay.  Every other restaurant we tried had a standard far above Northside's; this place needs to straighten up.

Pr3z366Y57SX-wQHQa1eQg.text: I really liked the decor with its exposed brick walls. The chicken Parmesan was pretty tasty but it was our server Tony that was excellent !!

1IGmRDkM0cXKhy4Cjopg9A.text: Nice food and service! christian Santos, promptly greated us and was more then accommodating  that our drinks were served fast,. He's very polite and friendly!

SpbmX2Kyt-lqWDJsPqXiww.text: Christian Santos did a good job in serving us here at Northside Cafe.  Being my first time to come and eat in this place.  Food was good and excellent service.  Keep up the good work Christian.

OLcydWLL1joGhB9TCGjFVw.text: Amazing staff, specially Tina. She went above and beyond to accommodate us. I would return here more often because of her. She is very friendly and attentive. Great food. For the best dessert, you got to try the croissant bread pudding.

1wwwvxuMkLTyqhHuYPoLQg.text: we went to northsaide cafe at 2am kassey (our waiter ) was very nice and great personality  we ate steak and eggs ill say its the best steak and egg in town :):):):)

lyCXabS9hMkCfOo2GCx-JA.text: Went in the other day with my girlfriend for lunch/early dinner. Food was great (had the fish tacos). Bloody Mary's were awesome. Service was killer. Harlon was great. Will definitely be back.

qgAc1wqqdfr5mOu4hkuKdg.text: I had to write another review. The tomato soup was super delicious. Everything was just fine. Service was excellent. I believe Miguel was my waiter. Keep up the good work and I will keep telling people to go to Northside. I just wish you would open up a cafe in Henderson, NV.

-OdpUV9uNb9uf52070jk6Q.text: Still 5 stars in my opinion, even a year and a half later! My server Joseph was great, the food was still awesome and huge portions, and the local specials and drink can't be beat. They still have the secret locals special, which is a huge relief, because paying full price Strip prices hurts my soul. I'd also like to compliment the bartender, who used gloves while he was making my mojito (getting the mint leaves out of the bag). No one ever does that, unless they know someone is watching them! This is a place that has shown consistency and that's great in a city that has so much change!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This drink is amazing!!! Melon mojito
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry margarita

2hUJkyrTFZR_cGTgqSOLwA.text: We arrived for dinner and it had a variety of food options. Mexican, Chinese, Italian, and american from recollection. So a little bit of everything for anyone.  The bad, it is outrageously priced. Portion sizes are large however. I had a Rigatoni I could not finish and was delicious.  My wife ordered a fish that she ate and said nothing about.  My son, and this is where the rating went down, ordered Nachos. That is simple enough. But, he did not want Jalapenos on it and specified it. He was disappointed when it came out clearly with Jalapenos on it. He decided to try his hand at telling the waiter. He very politely said he was disappointed it had Jalapenos on it. The waiter brushed it off by saying it was due to the pico de gallo. UH NO! We looked first and tried that. It was all over the large plate, inside and out. You messed up, just apologize no excuses. They did correct it by sending a new plate quickly with no pico di gallo. Now it was just the ample beef, sour cream and nachos.  What you could have done, apologized and offered to take it off the bill or complimentary dessert. NOPE. Just the excuse was offered. We can tell the difference between something mixed into a condiment and fresh Jalapeno thrown onto the plate and in the nachos.   So, high price and doing poorly on something very easy to put together results in a lower rank.  It could have been a 3 or 4.

-_q_5vxsG9dgSjltG842iA.text: This was our first time in Vegas, and we  had the pleasure of eating at Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen. The food was great but our sever Andy was amazing. Great service!!!! Totally worth the experience!!! Thx Andy @

to36O2j8vSZSyurya0GdQA.text: 24hr spot in the SLS hotel.. Food pretty good. I ordered the shrimp cocktail and buffalo chicken flatbread. Shrimps was really good.. The pizza wasn't bad just had too much garish and onions on JT.. Chicken was crispy and diced up which was good. Overall pretty nice place to come

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Flat bread and shrimp cocktail.

ecgdFM99St1ulxrbAGzqrg.text: We just had a terrific breakfast.  They gave us a huge booth and a fantastic server - Oliver Mitchell.  Oliver was really competent and friendly.  He shared some excellent tea insights (I love artisanal teas.) and brought us some hearty breakfasts starting with a full pot of coffee.  Standouts included the huevos rancheros and avocado toast.  Steel cut oatmeal with mixed berries was a  generous, tasty meal as well. We will gladly return for our next breakfast.  Big thumbs up to Northside and Oliver. They do hospitality expertly.

DaADUjwb3xxZ055sAsLpWA.text: Came here on a Sunday morning and started waiting in line, until we figured out we could skip the line to sit at the counter. They have a really good menu with a lot of options. We ordered the Chilaquiles Verdes and the Whole Hog Omelette. Both delicious choices. We also ordered coffee and were brought out little individual French presses. What a pleasant surprise! It was a cup full of creamy goodness.   What made our experience here even better was the friendly server at the counter. Very personable and genuinely nice.   If you are staying at the SLS, you don't want to miss breakfast here.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Individual French Pressed coffee. A must have here!
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles Verdes. Delicious!

vBIQoOdctMuixywGK3l6NQ.text: The customer service here is ok. It could of been better. The food was delicious! I ordered the Bloody Mary drink here and it was very different as in it had a sweet sugared bacon strip in it as a garnish. It was surprisingly really good! The drink in general was really good.  Also I ordered the huevos ranchero plate. It had two fried tortillas with chorizo, beans, cheese, and two sunny side eggs on top! It was awesome and I'm glad I ordered it. It was really big and it will definitely fill you up. The best part is that this restaurant is open 24 hours!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary with sugared bacon garnish!
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Ranchero!

WgQvfuKiXamJD9o3Mq_tyg.text: Not terrible. Not exceptional. Fills the void for breakfast but if I had more time I'd head elsewhere. Typical hotel pricing. You pay 2/3rds less at a typical hometown diner and probably fill your stomach better. I was surprised when the basic 2-egg platter comes with one slice of toast when being charged over 14 bucks. Food OK-value not so much

Sq7iHmrQBEW4I4I2kbqqDw.text: My fiancee and I ordered a few Dim Sum plates in addition to our entree and were disappointed to find half our order was over cooked and cold. It was evident the kitchen was behind this particular evening but our server Oliver made it easy to give a 5-star review.  There's something to be said for great customer service in the midsts of a Saturday evening rush.  The dumplings are great too

71gYRw9r2nhkpIcjE3gDbQ.text: This is a perfect restaurant to go to if you're out late . My service was perfect and quick , Brian was very informative and professional. The manager on duty was amazing as well. Thank you so much and we will return can to the cafe when we are in Vegas again.

XIsXCIlkrI8GRmpjNaYxnw.text: A pleasant surprise with a simple menu. Stopped for a quick bite and enjoyed the couple of items we tried.  The tomato soup was very tasty with perfect consistency. The grilled cheese on sourdough bread blended three cheeses perfectly and had just enough butter to make it tasty. The fish tacos were great and thumbs up to the beans served with them.  Give this place a shot for a simple bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4tSnFvBPoQqizIaJTh8Xtg.text: Went twice: once for lunch and once for dinner. Food was excellent  and pricepoint quite low for Vegas. The three star ranking is due to the total lack of service both times

JiBZI8m7a1cYajCQTVhWow.text: I'm local and enjoy the great service this fine city thrives on. After asking for the locals menu the server seemed pissed. Locals who literally live next door and potentially come over a lot more than the once a year clientele = more tips. I'll have to say the worst & nastiest service I've had in LV. 4 of us had drinks & food   Would have had 2 drinks if asked. Finally showed up with check before clearing table or asking if we wanted anything else. Horrible.  BTW the foods good. What a shame.

IFEo4YuLUXDVLywQZ4lcxg.text: Just finished having dinner and we are stuffed!  If you are a guest at the SLS you can check out the menu on the smart tv in the comfort of your room.   I ordered the baja taco while my wife had the club sandwich. Both orders came out fairly fast (about 10 min) and both dishes were very tasty.   Service: 4/5 Food: 5/5 Ambience: 3/5

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja fish tacos. (Doesn&#39;t come with pickles or the cherry tomato though. Took it from my my wife&#39;s dish)

_Rvfs173p-mKxOBlr_Ndkw.text: No one talks about the noodle soup with dumpling. It has egg noodle and bokchoy. It hit the spot. I was missing this.

w1hjFxI6oXWmWrSZVWWWKg.text: Love this place! Was served by Dominic and was very nice. Kept great conversation and truly wanted to hear how my day was going.   I was working at the table for a good hour and was not bothered or pushed out. Also great food!

WKBL6pyLJHxfEFa2--K9Jg.text: The food here is amazing! Really really good! Big portions But service kinda sucks. Ordered banana pancakes and they brought me the wrong pancakes to start with then I had to wait 10 mins for the correct order to come out. Then our waiter didn't really pay any attention to us. Was too busy with other tables we waited a while for the check finally. And waited awhile for the food to come to the table

cRZ_kKydI_md7A7fMjkSyQ.text: If I was measuring just the food, I would have put 3 stars.  This outing had the worst service I ever experienced.    Waiter forgot our table's app completely. We told him that we were getting separate checks. Waiter messed up which orders were on the proper ticket 3 times.  After that, he improperly added gratuity to the tickets, charging some of our party 2x, and leaving it off others.   The manager eventually comes out, and takes another 10-15 min to figure things out. Doesn't even offer to comp a dessert or a coffee. Restaurant wasn't full, so being distracted wasn't an excuse.

AKcI1yi_VvwP6XjfJxizHw.text: Their portion sizes are great!! My first time in Vegas and this was the place we went to for breakfast. I had the omelette platter and it was delicious !! It came with toast and a side of potatoes. The only thing that I didn't like was that the coffee tasted old.

8_arViGl4UV3m78gGJC4Qw.text: This is a great place to eat , excellent prices , open all day and night and reasonable prices.   Stopped by for my second visit and my server Joseph was just the best.   After a long two days at CES needed a quick bit and his positive and strong service did the trip.   Will not only come back here but stay at SLS since the people are so great.   Thank you

3nni6zL8dl8NRkElzszT0Q.text: I am sorry I came here. I had the three course meal for $19.95 and was really disappointed. The caesar salad was my starter and it was okay. Really generic but edible. For my main, I had the fetticini and it was the most bland crap I have ever tasted. I had a bite of my friend's prime rib and it was gross - tough and foul tasting. I did not have the desset because by this point I was feeling quesy. When I asked how much a glass of wine cost since it is not listed on the menu, I was informed that it is $11. What? That is cray. Drinks are free literally when you cross the threshold back into the casino. Seriously, unless everything else on the menu is way better, I would not spend my cash here.

ubYpEAiNTsppBB7091kDug.text: Great place to start your morning, had breakfast 2 days in a row . We where a group of 8 so in those 2 days we tried just about everything on the breakfast menu. Every dish was perfecto.

NBQEq0S41zaoW9Or_s_wPg.text: Surprisingly delicious food and great service!   Visited for breakfast and had it for in room dining, amazing.  Their Chilaquiles were bomb!   My all meat omelet was even better!   The toast was thick and on point like the ladies sitting next to us lol.  The best part of the meal was out cappuccino. Just enough foam... Nothing fancy, no hearts but tongue tingly.  I'll visit again for sure when in Vegas and at the SLS.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Point me to Vegas
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberries

IF2jmGShRskvLLwvlWr01g.text: Horrible service.  The waiters are more concerned about chatting than doing their job.  They consistently get orders wrong.  It takes an average of 15-20 minutes just to get water. We have to ask for the right amount of silverware after we have been served food.  I refuse to dine there but my boyfriend insists on using his dining dollars or cash in there. Go to the other much better restaurants in the great SLS.

eZSrooFFUlWCCTU91pZcFg.text: After a long day (and night) on the Vegas Strip and after seeing Britney, we decided to eat here because McDonald's was closed and we didn't have a car for drive thru. I ordered the chicken fried rice. It was good, but costly. I only ate half because I was full and there's no fridge in my room to have leftovers (only a mini bar). This place is also 24/7, but only serves Chinese until 2am.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dbkgCxFkygQohS4kXDFrhA.text: I stayed in the W connected to the SLS where Northside is and I'm glad this restaurant option is so close. I had a healthy protein frittata each morning and the asparagus was cut really well and added a unique touch to an otherwise simple dish. The staff was kind and even let me switch my table to a booth without a fuss. Overall, a good option for a sizable meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wk4z3OLho6dmtM0Nrj9nGQ.text: I really should blame myself. What was i thinking eating Chinese food at a place that serves burgers, and pancakes all on the same menu, but with prices that are higher than some Vegas buffets? But my feet were tired, and it takes forever to get out of the casino mazes. These sort of restaurants are the perfect trick for casinos to keep you within their fortress, because they got a lil bit of everything. The menu is really all over the place, and you know it was put together to try and satisfy the diverse clientele they have. Which is probably what you can say about a 7-11 as well.   I ordered the Yang Chow fried rice. And it was an epiphany. It was the 1st time I ever thought, wow, it IS possible to screw up fried rice. As if the shrimp was left over from a buffet, the rice came in an orange box with the words "Uncle Ben" on it, and the flavor was sprinkled with cardboard.   The Dr. Pepper was good. The soda machine mixed in some root beer flavor. And that's cool with me because I love mad mixing soda.

pz5-iv4ARcdDTF939Vf3mw.text: Guests at the SLS Hotel, my boyfriend and I were very hopeful for our first meal in Vegas. Regulars at the SLS in LA, we were more than trusting in our choice to eat here, ready to coat our stomachs with carbs before a night of drinking. The food tasted average, but the service was friendly. Next we went to hit the town but hit the toilets instead. Less than an hour after leaving, my boyfriends stomach started to ache and then so did mine... The rest of the night was spent walking casino bathroom to casino bathroom trying to salvage fun out of our near ruined night. Buyers to warned.

M96Tt6Ldzb3SKSKm_8iGEw.text: Had dinner. My Server was Oliver really great, fun and upbeat personality. Awesome smile. Oliver recommended the Russian mule...I have to say it was crazy delicious and much needed after a very stressful day. Thank you Oliver.  Oliver went above and beyond with my order. I had the Chinese basil chicken with jasmine rice and broccoli and ginger on the side. Food was absolutely delicious  Service was fast, atmosphere was fun. Will definitely come back again on my next layover to Las Vegas.

9mhMDj0j_6tNZBWSZGbVLQ.text: Typically this place is legit.  Just ok tonight.   I expected more and better service.  Manager wasn't any help either.

3dkUfyxzALn8MzpyR65-dQ.text: This place was absolutely great. I love the variety of foods. The food was delicious. The staff are always friendly and Oliver is an amazing waiter. Keep up the good work. ;)

2s8gdrgqq0jwei9H2sGNQA.text: Ehh.  Quite the disappointment. I had been looking forward to trying Northside Cafe for quite a while.   Tonight, while doing some gambling at the SLS, we decided to grab a bite to eat here.  Ordered-  - Combination Fried Rice ($11.95) with pork, shrimp, and chicken - Orde of Chicken Wings (plain) ($9.95) with ranch sauce on the side - 1 side order of Garlic Mashed Potatoes ($6.95) - 1 Diet Pepsi, 1 Water  (+) Service was probably the best thing about this experience, as the young lady who waited on us was friendly and attentive, certainly no complaints regarding the service (+) chicken wings were actually pretty good! Only 6 to an order, but at least they were tasty.  (-) garlic mashed potatoes were a huge disappointment. First, the portion size was pathetic. This was roughly about 6-7 bites. This should have run $3 at the most. $6.95 is downright criminal. Plus their definition of garlic was ready mix mashed potatoes with a few garlic dices on top. Very disappointing. (-) Combo Fried Rice was plentiful in portion, but extremely bland. At least I know they don't use any MSG in their Chinese foods. That dish was way too bland to have included any measurable amount of MSG!  Maybe one day we will return to try some of the breakfast menu items, but this was a bit of a letdown and I don't see myself going out of my way to go back..  Maybe I will try Ku Noodle next...after all I am one of those rare locals that actually likes playing at the SLS...  for Northside Cafe though, it will have to be..  2 stars.  Meh. I've experienced better.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. interior
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Garlic&#34; Mashed Potatoes $6.95 not much there :/
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Fried Rice $11.95

Ir79DvX3x6YQ4icfY66tOA.text: Service was decent, prices are outrageous for mediocre quality food. Food poisoning the first time we ate there (chx wings)... then we got nachos and wings for room service next night since it was the only food available late night and allas food poisoning again.... never again northside... sorry

84ghqxGUrTp536jZxoDhBw.text: It's in Vegas!  What can you say?  The food portions are generous.  The drinks are bottomless.  They serve a few ethnic types of food.  American, Spanish and Chinese.  I had the breakfast and it was hearty.  I have tried their Chinese menu.  The Kung Pao Chicken and Eggplant dish they were Asian but something was missing.  Can't think of it but I will update later.  Because it was right next to the slot machines the ambiance was loud and bright.  Sometimes there is a line to get in.  The food is a bit pricey.  They are open 24/7 that's a huge plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito is huge hit!
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kung paid chicken is pretty good!

WrYKAe0ugBOvVvZ1IO_92Q.text: Service was very good but that's where the goodness stopped.   It was late so we opted to choose a few selections off of the Chinese small plates menu, although they do serve non-Chinese entrees as well. I thought since it was a Chinese cafe, the Chinese food would possibly be better. Nope.   We started with the Hot & Sour soup. It was decent. A little thicker than I'm used to. It was much heavier than a broth consistency. Otherwise, it was pretty traditional. It actually was a tiny bit hot which I really appreciate. The flavor was okay.   Next, the pork steamed buns, which took 20+ minutes to prepare per the server, were undercooked and doughy. This is one of my favorite dishes and I do know how it is when cooked correctly. They barely had any pork in them at all either. It was more of a very thin smear of pork paste when I opened it to see if it actually had any pork in it after not having any in my first 2-3 bites. The flavor was also missing.   We also tried the pan fried dumplings. It was a combo of pork and shrimp. This did not work. At all. Weirdest fishy flavor ever.   Next we ordered the veggie spring rolls because we were 0-2. They were okay. Traditional but again, no flavor.   I would certainly skip this place unless it's after hours and it is the only restaurant in the SLS/W that is open 24/7.  But I would suggest staying away from the Chinese menu. I saw a pasta dish come out that looked good.   In all fairness though, this cafe does the room service for the W and breakfast the following morning was good. I had the breakfast burrito and I would order it again. So I give 3 stars for that instead of the 2 stars originally planned.

h-rPUPI0vjEh1uPAMVPwkQ.text: Najia Was fantastic!!! She really set my night off on the right foot! Super friendly and shared her thoughts on her favorites!!! Gotta have the carrot cake if you haven't tried it! Erin

aa_zo7w4feFywF1newaAuQ.text: Terrible service... food is good, but everything is so slow and I don't think they know how to handle one table at a time... sucks.

i0mqrUXd8XIZXbPow_5rLg.text: Decent diner type food inside the SLS.   Very nice attentive service. We came in on a late flight and it was our only dining option in the hotel.  They had a very limited late night menu, but had all the usual suspects covered for that time of night, nachos, burgers, basic  breakfast etc. The nice thing was they had a pretty decent Chinese/Dim Sum menu available beginning at Midnight. I didn't grab one, but the table next to me did,  when you order coffee, you get French press. That's so nice, I wish more places offered that in place of drip coffee.   I had the Chow Fun some sticky rice and a fat slice of chocolate cake. Just the thing a fat kid needs after a long flight and day on the road.   The place was nearly empty when we were there. I would even eat here if I wasn't staying in the hotel.   I'm sure the SLS has some swankier dining experiences,  but if you're just looking for a casual place to grab some grub, this place will fit the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat slice of Chocolate cake. This is what I&#39;m talking about Ed, you know who you are...
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry Beef Chow Fun

H_-EcvTOHm9BtnIlYFln3w.text: Worst service ever they take over 30 minutes to get back to you to take your order they don't acknowledge when you come in the door it's really sad that the hotel is busy and they don't have enough servers

9DTxeEZhLTnV7OzNZQZucg.text: Just had breakfast with my husband at NorthSide Cafe, it was busy at 10am. Christian was our server, he recommended us the philly cheese steak, and it blew us away like *ka pow* , their portion was crazy and I couldn't be more happier. ( we also had cobb salad and breakfast burritos and they were delicious as well) We love staying at SLS hotel and will definitely come back next year!

H__yw5oLGFLjjC0e5TG9eQ.text: We just arrived in Las Vegas on Monday and weren't sure where to go for food. Our concierge recommended the Northside Cafe at the SLS. Prices are higher from where we are from but just about any place you get food from in Las Vegas is going to be pretty expensive. Our omelettes were phenomenal and we did get a lot of bang for our buck. Lots of options to choose from on the menu and they gave me so much food that I had to take my omelette back to the hotel to eat for breakfast the next day. They seemed to be really busy and forgot a number of things and took awhile. My mom's omelette which was supposed to have chunks of ham in it, didn't so our cook redid hers really fast and it came out just perfect! Servers and the cooks are very friendly and funny here. Customer service here is fantastic. I would say this is a good place to get breakfast and that I would come in again.

OpKODnAQcYE6eTMbZmeB7g.text: The food is really tasty and the service is top notch. We had a friendly charismatic server named "KC" that accommodated our late night drunken escapades. I requested celery instead of chips for my guacamole and to my surprise he was able to fulfill it with a smile. The Steak and eggs rocked and the chilaquilles were delicious....Don't miss out on an opportunity for good food and great service. Ask for Kassey to serve you....

xBzSdD7y63yTCinEyha5Yw.text: First off, I love the SLS hotel, and the fact that this restaurant is open 24 hours at this hotel is great! Perfect place to hit up after the club and go crash in your room after, or to grab breakfast in the morning without having to drive anywhere. Everything on the menu is good so unfortunately I can not name plates. The sweet potato fries are delicious and they have the best mashed potato I've ever had! The staff is a tad bit slow sometimes but ehh the food makes up for it.

qm5iCXD6_EW0UGdmE4MJ_g.text: my review today is about Mike! he is one of a kind! he is adorable, handsome, professional! the service overall was very low in the hotel but Mike made it perfect! such a nice guy! he was doing everything and more for the customer! can't find enough words of appreciation about todays pleasant situation happened with me! I am telling you guys U can go to this place for very nice meeting with MIKE!!! Thank you Mike if you are reading for you very nice and professional approach! such a pleasure meeting you! Thanks!

dif-QUQPHloURAG7YkZnUQ.text: Great place for breakfast! Healthy and delicious food, good service: fast and courteous people like Ismael made for a nice environment. My husband and I went here for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed it. We would like service like this everywhere...that's not too much to ask for  :D

DE69I3kJ9SlqdqQzNS1fKQ.text: Great fun and smiles at Northside Cafe! James, my server was great, attentive without being overbearing and friendly. Love going into a place where everyone is happy and smiling. Ordered the Greek Salad, you would think there is no risk with such an item, but it can be. The portion was perfect, dressing not over the top and super fresh! Thanks Northside Cafe!

RzEnfhtQLgXhaH5IYvDknQ.text: As a Vegas local I decided to come check this place out because of their local specials. This place is located inside the super cool SLS hotel. I had not been to the SLS since the month that it opened.. And it looks like this place is taking steps in the right direction. I had the Northside burger which the server suggested.. And MY was it amazing! What's the sauce that they put on this thing? Love it! I definitely recommend coming to this spot! Great locals spot as well as for people on vacation.

-DPvmq9D5iQ-u-pDDeu-rg.text: Ate here for lunch , our server Christian was excellent, on the ball and was more than competent in his job which is rare these days. Our food was good not amazing, worth the money, will return.

yasgt-nWVUqIAf5VRo7cRg.text: First time eating here.  Blueberry pancakes were so good they don't need syrup.  Everything was fresh and hot including the coffee.  This is my favorite breakfast spot to eat in Vegas.  Can't wait to try their lunch.

OjHkjB_ozurtu-CFiKwKRg.text: Its my first time at the Sls, so i tried to have dinner with friends. So we ate at the Northside Cafe. I ordered some. Chinese dishes, pork ribs was amazing. We also added american dish, and the pasta was so good. The sauce it flawless and mouthwatering. I was impressed by the ambiance and the server,  Christian was amazing. He made sure that all our drinks was ok, he has a delightful manner and very friendly. Making our needs met was absolutely thumbs up. Thanks Christian! We will keep coming back to Northside to try some other menus and for the great customer service we has experienced. Recommendable!

dvaKbVPYlCG4LbHLN_tgDQ.text: Joseph was the best for my friends and I. He's so fun and personal. Exquisitely gentleman like. Genuine and puts us at ease. Thanks joe!

eTO-hAbWoXip7E1bd0bpXg.text: There are very few times in life when you can walk into a restaurant (starving) Let the server order what he thinks is best on the menu and NAIL IT!!!! Thank you Juan M for ordering a Reuben sandwich and sweet potato fries.

sU_JxXvQiHX3YpLS2LSgRw.text: Wow! Got a flyer in the mail for this new cafe at SLS good for tonight only. Grabbed some friends to check it out tonight and what? They aren't even open lol. They are replacing the griddle. Good luck with that

03H2ZRqJAVJ8IF4_CokiQQ.text: Luciano made an awesome margarita and gave great service!!! I'm coming back before I leave town.

8Av8fJfedCuFv5-qq456mw.text: We had a great experience dining at Northside Cafe while staying at SLS.  Stephanie was a wonderful hostess who helped us understand why the cafe was definitely worth at stop.  Jim was our server both times we stopped in and he could not have been more friendly and hospitable.  The food was very good and creative considering the casual cafe atmosphere.  I especially enjoyed the French Press coffee served table side.  I'll be sure to come back next time I'm at the SLS!

GBkjFt9hHGyHIpvV75sG3Q.text: stayed at SLS and got back to the hotel around 3 and I needed water ---just iced cold water. but instead of paying $5 for a bottle ben and i decided to grab a "snack".  ben got the pastrami with fries and i got a bowl of fruit.  service was sooooo slow and food was helllla greasy but it was convenient and decent priced.

HOJFctqDaEhZVyCGp6PYFw.text: Our server Christian provided excellent service.  He was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  The Buffalo chicken wrap was delicious!

E9JYvP3JnCzGsn6pAodmWA.text: We ordered the Chinese food and it was GREAT! It was so DELICIOUS that we took more food to go. Tina was our server and she was AWESOME, very inviting and gracious.  She went out of her way to make us feel special and important.   One of the best cafe experiences Ever!  THANK YOU TINA, NORTHSIDE AND STAFF!

Y53hMR98xg1SMrFRqHm2Uw.text: Dinner was great, Christian Santos our server at the restaurant was fantastic. He accommodated us with each request we asked and helped us throughout the night with out issues but food was great as well and would definitely come back again.

BVCOcG1q-qaXNMtnKuvemg.text: Since we received a 2 for 1 entree postcard, we decided to try the Northside Cafe on a Sunday night. Super busy--had to wait in a fairly efficient/organized line. Nice atmosphere/cool booths/retro chairs/nicely done interior.  The service was extremely slow--cordial enough, but oh so slow! Perhaps it was all the hungry tourists, or maybe all the locals came in for the 2 for one deal?  The food: Mixed reaction here: Husband said it was "good"--even though they brought him a different entree than what he ordered (he was too hungry to send it back)...I found the Chinese cuisine to be simply meh--not horrible, but not Wow! or anything.  Will we go back again? Yes, probably for a 2 for 1 deal--but will most likely do a salad or a sandwich--since the Chinese cuisine didn't cut the mustard for me.  Nice that it's open 24/7 and has a wide variety of menu items.

ar8W6dtY1rNZsBA9zCZI5A.text: Thanks Joseph service was great and food was excellent! We ordered Chinese and it was delicious. I would definitely recommend eating here.

JPpwD0aPcqlv4oPH6QOwIw.text: Having been granted late checkout, I had breakfast here. My only order was the congee (available after 11am). Both the congee and service were excellent. The $8 congee comes with a small youtiao (Chinese crispy donut)  EDIT: Came for dinner too which was not as nice of an experience. Service still top notch. Tomato soup was pretty good not great. Rigatoni was bad. Tasted prego-like and was also extremely salty. Even though the portion was good, I had to stop halfway because the salt was so overpowering. The only compliment is that there is plenty of meat in the sauce. The cheesecake was also below par, chalky, and honestly Jack in the box cheesecake is almost as good. At least it was nicely presented. I hesitate to drop my review from an initial 5 stars to 3, but God Damn that rigatoni.

BGCa3cOCjnePv0da-ZYz4Q.text: Had a late night snack here after going to a show. Our server was great and though we originally received tacos (ordered cheesesteak) it didn't take long for them to correct the dish and I had it right away.  Sandwich was great, even coming from a Philly guy. Service was great and we were in and out in no time and off to bed.

REZDAKYv2PmlH18xTnwDlA.text: I love this restaurant, it's a must go for my coworkers and I every time we meet for a conference in Las Vegas. Personally, but the gluten-free options really added an incredible touch.

nPy7LWQJKMCJvVuP3Ay_5w.text: I was a little concerned with the service we would receive based on other reviews but I am happy to report our waitress, Doria, was great. I was craving surf and turf and after seeing the photos of that dish in Yelp.....I knew I needed to try it. I am so happy I did. Everything was on point. The sauce for the shrimp was spicy, creamy and heavenly. The steak was tender and delicious. The french fries were just right! We were staying at the SLS hotel so we charged it to the room and earned SPG points. It's a win/win!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf with French fries. Everything was delicious. The sauce on the shrimp was phenomenal!

nO0RTgGRntL-IBTvuI2HxQ.text: Today is our 25th wedding anniversary minus 1 day. We have been to many restaurants over the years.  while ordering, we requested the food be served HOT. Our server Stephanie acknowledged our request and delivered. My husband acknowledged the meal was hot. He continued to comment throughout the meal that it was still hot.  THANK YOU STEPHANIE for making this doing experience amazing.

2d8ECITCxdB8hnon7N7Rlg.text: Had a great time!!! The food was great and prepared very fast!!!!Amazing service by Joseph!!!! Will definitely come back another time

xpBD4iSTIjQKXtG92Vxr_g.text: So, how would you define shithole ... Poor service and subpar food... Well, you got it there... Not many neighborhood dive bars can " rise" to that standard... Food was cold.. Like really cold and we asked for milk 3 times ( mind you, place was nearly empty) and got nada... Really, star minus

IAJqckRhT-aBhSlN2Jl9rg.text: Excellent restaurant, any time of day. So many options and types of cuisines. Generous portions and friendly staff! A must try in Vegas!

wqnyZTZVpv2a7ZfA043XHQ.text: Awesome food and the staff were fantastic. Very efficient and courteous! Definitely will be back again!

xCRb-zSIPcDkEZ1LKkuDAg.text: Stopped in here at about 10:30pm which in Vegas time, I get it - it's super early. In eastern time it's okay everyone-chug-your-drink-and-order-another-before-it's-last-call time. So their menu says "breakfast 24 hours" which my confused time zone of a body thinking it was probably post-bar, drunk food time decided that pancakes sound the best. When we tried to order pancakes the waitress said "pancakes take too much prep time so they're not available". These must be some serious pancakes because I've never heard of such elaborate preparation for a plop of runny cake batter like dough on a skillet...  They also have a secret menu if you ask but it's like a mini version of the regular menu all printed out. The whole point of the secret menu is for it to be secret and should never be written out for the average common folk meandering through Vegas to stumble upon.  Anyways, I got the Al Pastor tacos and they were good.

qqBLO_tsUx4sXlMAqpvyhw.text: Pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food at this 24 Hour Diner.  Whenever you see Mexican, Chinese, and American food on the same menu, you ought to be somewhat skeptical.  And then ordering the Chinese food on that menu is very risky.  But I did it anyway.  I ordered the Chow Fun dish and it was surprisingly delicious.  The noodles were of great texture and the flavor was not overpowering.  Usually Chinese food can be overly salty, but this dish had the perfect amount.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the service leaves more to be desired.  I checked in late on a weeknight and was the only person in the restaurant, yet I had to grab my own menu after a few minutes of waiting around.  I actually was hesitant to recommend this place to my folks because I was worried about the quality of service during the actual busy breakfast/lunch/dinner hours.

vZTpDc9-AB1Br-ENAPty6A.text: Not too shabby! I went to eat here for the first time while also checking out SLS for the first time and I was DEFINITELY glad I stopped in. Juan Mayorga was my server and he was absolutely fantastic. He helped my girlfriend and I choose what to eat. I'm a big fan of French Toast so of course he suggested I try the French Toast dish the cafe provided and it was AMAZING. After seeing that Juan was a trustworthy person, Lol, I asked him what else I should check out inside the SLS and he quickly recommended a few things. He was patient and friendly and those are key qualities to have in a server!  (I also never tried Nutella and it's pretty damn good lol)   Thank you Juan!

5HSi3ankRcc7-Er5pxbwww.text: Came in for breakfast one day after doing a bit of table games. Was greeted pleasantly by the hostess Stephanie and noticed they were super busy. Luckily she got me in within no time!   As I sat and looked at the menu, I noticed the breakfast burrito. Who doesn't like all your breakfast foods tied into a warm and delicious tortilla! It took a while for my server to come so Stephanie came back and put in my order, talk about going the extra mile! My food came out promptly and just as I assumed the breakfast burrito did not disappoint.   I will definitely be back to enjoy this great service!

guv_URQPAxQ4b85AAq8I7w.text: I came with some of my friends for a late lunch and it wasn't as great as I hoped it would be. Our server was not very attentive, and was chatting it up with people at the bar and even told us to hold on. On the up side I ordered the GRANOLA PANCAKES and they were delicious. I hope the restaurant finds better staff to attend to the customers.

JLwEYX50ZC3zH5_de_-KUA.text: Good breakfast location at SLS hotel. Surprisingly crowded given how empty the hotel and casino were, a wait at times and service was a little slow though friendly. Had a Denver Omelette one day and Corned Beef Hash the other, both tasty. Vegas Prices.

etDSjkJtts-XOVKqW3Daig.text: rancheros was delicious, service was fast. LOVE the layout of the place. I'd definitely come back!

88MkVpsvLITAiGF0UKtBuw.text: The food here was absolutely delectable!!! I had a Greek salad with the Seared Salmon and she had chicken Alfredo.  The atmosphere is upbeat and friendly. I give 3 stars due to the lack of service form our waiter Juan M. We seen him when we ordered dinner with desert and then the again for the bill. We had to ask 2 random employees that may have been hostesses and third who was waitressing the table next to us. Juan M was polite, and pleasant, I'm sure he is good at his job but The performance today with us was poor, we were left waiting and reaching out to other employees for service. Lastly when I ordered my Salmon meal it came with a Caesar salad, I asked for a Greek salad, he replied "it will be an extra charge" I agreed to it. When we got the check I noticed they not only was I charged extra but I was charged for a " 1/2 salad . So since I was charged full price for a 1/2 Greek salad $7.95 what happened to the Caesar salad that came with the meal? So their just gonna keep my Cesar salad and charge me full price for the 1/2 Greek??? Not good business!!!  Sorry Juan M. But you still got your 15%.

bZbuuu7In7EKQ4MCZZ2zow.text: My boyfriend and I have been here on multiple occasions on various vegas trips the past two years and found it initially due to the strong ratings here on Yelp.  We are also staying at the SLS this weekend and he stays there for work on occasion.  It is convenient when you are staying there, however it ALWAYS takes forever to get your food and the service is subpar. It seems like the server to customer ratio is good,  so there isn't a shortage of staff however they all seem to be standing around doing nothing even when you have asked for something like another set of silverware or some more water.  There is no sense of urgency.  In addition the food is nothing special and isn't cheap (although I guess that is to be expected on the strip). I don't mind paying 14.00 for am omelette but I do expect it to taste good and have good service!

DOObkK2WReD3FWByXxpU9w.text: Super awesome food. My expectations were exceeded. Joseph was our server...cool guy...ask to sit in his section. Orange chicken is really really good

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2jCnym7rq9NzugH6_xsyTw.text: The food was good, not great. I had issues trying to get a refill for my coffee. I thought I would be able to ask any other server but most were not around, they gathered in the back, after 7 minutes I had to get up and ask for a refill.  In my week stay here, this was the only restaurant I found lacking in service.

BrYVhSrigDpYUdTuK4F1mQ.text: We love the food and the service.  Joseph was excellent and friendly, very attentive indeed.  My husband had the Nachos; the chips tasted like home-made and not from the giant bag of pre-made chips.  The portion was very generous and the toppings were abundant.   I had Beef Chow Fun and it tasted wonderful.  Ask for their locals menu if you live in LV, great prices.

aIlISkygw4APPK9buWmQ0A.text: I'm staying here at the SLS Hotel and this place is very convenient. That being said the service has been great. The staff is friendly and go out of heir way to accommodate you if there are any requests. The food has been very good as well. I'm on the road around 250 nights each year and I'm very happy to have this place in my hotel right now.

5gBg3_g3A26PTK0Ectb9KA.text: Had dinner here on Monday 8/16/2015. We arrived around 6pm and were seated immediately. Our server (Lola) was prompt and friendly. She kept our glasses filled throughout the meal.  Our food was excellent. I had the surf n turf. Shrimp were large and the filet was cooked properly. My guest had the ribeye. She loved it. I will definitely be returning next week.

_5Vd9SMnakM2WSe9DQSpIA.text: I stopped by for dinner.  The guacamole was good; but, since they put the pico de gallo in the same dish without draining off the liquid, it was watery.  I had the ravioli and they were so-so...not sure how to explain except that they tasted warmed up... The sauce was either watery, like they didn't drain the water, or oily...  I'm thinking watery..  not a great experience.  I had an Arnold Palmer and this drink can be very different from restaurant to restaurant; but, I enjoyed it,  I would order the guacamole again, but ask to separate the Pico de Gallo and I would order the drink again.

-5IiohUSKNGuT_i4uoYBRw.text: This place is amazing, especially for locals.  I got delicious buttermilk pancakes for only $5.99 (locals menu).  For locals, this place has Denny's-level prices but the food is top-notch Vegas class all the way.  It feels very much like a local diner, and I will be going here for breakfast all the time now.  Breakfast is 24-7, so it doesn't matter what time I go.  Luciano was an excellent bartender, he checked on me to make sure everything was good and if I needed extra coffee.  He also chatted with me for a bit about how to look for good deals throughout Las Vegas and what kind of deals and great events can be found out the SLS.  If you eat there when he's there make sure to ask him the same.

I4ZfiQw-WAnrxgzvBNHE2g.text: Northside is more than just a cafe! They have a great menu which includes breakfast, lunch, dinner, as well as chinese items. Its not too pricey for a hotel restaurant. The servers are nice and always there to make your experience the best it could be! Also try the orange chicken and turkey club sub ranch!

BoyKivqk_QCVGnP06lhsRA.text: I understand Vegas is a busy place, this is about our specific server. We waited over 10-12 minutes for everything.  Drinks, place order, to go box, check. He was very attentive to every other table but ours. Our food was delivered by someone else and can tell it had been sitting in the back for at least 10 minutes under the lights.  As far as food goes, can't really be honest, it was cold.  I won't be back here and I will not recommend it either.

-xIuj8KL0bWiEqn554aF8w.text: Whatever you do...DO NOT EAT HERE!  Quite honestly, the food is just really bad. We ordered an Asian dish and chocolate peanut butter cheesecake. The food was greasy and tasted as pre-packaged as they come. The only reason we ordered cheesecake is because it looked great in pictures, but it tasted like rubber. It's was expensive and I am so sad I wasted any calories on it.

nCOw6woa7_G-MYSNPJBYMw.text: surprisingly authentic kang pao chicken! but SLS wifi is very poor inside the restaurant.

-TRAedb8TtbGONFJupKDtQ.text: If I could eat their Verde Chilaquiles everyday I would! They're so good. And i loved that their bloody mary came with candied bacon. Delicious and great service! I will be back on my next Vegas trip.

T1BZ9H5Ue5BmWk3x8rAzAA.text: Super service by Mr. Joseph T..!  Friendly, witty and just all around kind service... promote him..!!

wFmy5ofsRmM-B7H-JA3UpA.text: Service is ridiculous They are not friendly, every guy that works here is on super slow mode Ordered an egg white omelette, and apart from taking 30 min to have my order taken waiting 20 to get, my omelette was wrong. Wtf They need some women in here!! Annoyed.

7Ocd3fjmK-aEzZD8miXPKA.text: Sub-par at best. The Chinese food is so so but the service is even worse. Had to ask for a server after 10 minutes of sitting at the table watching people pass us. The server forgot our chips and guacamole and when I asked for recommendations on a meal he literally just pointed at some things on the menu-but didn't describe anything. Plus he was suuuuper slow with the ticket-as I watched him at the host stand talking and I was trying to pay and get out. Ugh.

X9yYThWcxES3Rh6gqHzrrQ.text: Decent breakfast for standard LV Strip pricing. Service can be spotty but had a great server this morning - Joseph - fast, personable, positive attitude... super solid server. Should be hired at a 5 star Michelin restaurant. This review is for him, not restaurant.

X8yqs8RED4LgeoR51TWudw.text: Poor service and bad food.  There is absolutely nothing good about this place... neither of us finished our meals.  Flavorless, bland, boring and definitely NOT authentic chinese food.

Hf-jcUf6mVwqcx5OaIr_RA.text: We were seated quickly and the food was great. We both got the 2 egg breakfast, and have no complaints about the food.  My only suggestion is for the staff to take on more of a team approach. We sat with empty water for quite some time and other servers walked by with water pitchers but never even glanced at us.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 egg breakfast.

ROgrOvffePAgOdUByDi_aA.text: Came here after looking at the menu outside, the carrot cake pancakes looked so good but once we got seated it wasn't an option on the menu, no biggie, I'll order the chilaquiles but when our order came to the table, I was served eggs Benedict, the coffee taste pretty bad too. The food was your average diner food.

PkAINL_0FKsUkT36Okw55w.text: I'm. A huge fan of all day breakfast, Chinese,  certain Mexican dishes and unique appetizers and Northside has it all. It's almost like they took the best selections of everything and then created a menu around it. I'm sure you'll find something everyone can enjoy, I certainly did. We had orange chicken, eggs Bennedict and banana pancakes and all 3 were absolutely delicious!

wkuTiSd1fnVYS3gT0Hek8w.text: Wow! Pretty disappointed that I have to change my first five star review to one star review. After moving to LV and I live really close by and I've been to this place many times. Over time it's gone from amazing to okay and then to really bad. This place is really poorly managed, like bad! I don't know if it's because nobody wants to work here or they don't pay enough. Every time I come here it becomes worse and worse. So the last time I was here food was so dry and bad. So so disappointed. Will never come here again. Good luck getting attention from anybody when you go here. If you want to ruin your night come here.

qzPopwFNG6upm9JhSX0Z0A.text: Great place and great food! Joseph was a great server! I'd definitely come back to this place. Highly recommend everyone to come here.

jNJTWQRa90_dsHI-57ehBw.text: Very yummy late night Diner-I mean how often do you get to eat dimsum at 2am or Chinese food in general for that matter. The food was great everything was cooked perfectly as requested the burger was super juicy and the dim sum shrimp buns were so delish! But what definitely stood out as well was the excellent service! Thanks to Joseph who helped us decide our order and was patient and very friendly. Super prompt and checked on us throughout the entire meal. Definitely recommend the Northside Burger and fries as well as the Steamed Buns and Sesame Balls-Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame Balls and Shrimp pork and Chives
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Northside Burger cooked Medium so delish!!!!

xUaja42sd82eOIXZbsK0OA.text: We live across the street and we went for breakfast two of us got steak and eggs Both of us did not eat the steak The steak was grisly and fatty  We told the waitress she said she'd go to the kitchen She came back with the bill Today we talked to a few of my neighbors around the pool and we all had the same agreement  Not worth it stay away

VZquw_UrvQrgKzXn2vAo4Q.text: Beef noodle soup/ Congee were the best dishes here so far that we've tried. The beef was perfectly cooked and the broth was absolutely delicious. The congee had the right balance and the fried Chinese doughnuts that came with it were the perfect match.   Now for everything else...the dimsum was 2/5 stars since the hargow was a bit hard and tasted like plastic and the shumai seemed alright but still mediocre. The walnut shrimp was decent but it's pretty "normal"..it also came with hard broccoli that was barely cooked (more of a garnish I think)  Everyone here complains about the service which needs a bit of work initially, but during the time we came it wasn't as busy so the service wasn't too bad. So they get a 4/5 from me

xHGvyN2rCU-YHFCZ1vnpdg.text: The food was phenomenal, the service was the opposite. We went on a Friday afternoon before the crowds, and our server made the experience twice as long as it should have been. There were tables beside us that came and went in the time we were there. The group sizes were the same, the only difference was the server. The drinks are over-priced for the size, but the food was delicious and came in generous portions. It's not a bad choice if you're willing to risk the service being poor.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YnD79rob0tjlQB7ksCWffQ.text: So I only sampled the Chinese menu (which is what drew me here initially), and I really enjoyed the food! Service was a bit slow at first but improved during dinner. We shared some dim sum and two dishes. Note: dim sum is made fresh and takes a bit of time so order that first! We tried the pork buns and chive dumplings. We also enjoyed the stir fry udon with beef, yang chow fried rice, and concluded the experience with a 6-layer chocolate cake. The food was excellent, the cake was ok. Perhaps it would have been better warm. And I will definitely return! Love me some udon!
