Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H6wcUQAVc-x15RBgVkcOAg.text: Bad service!!! First they said they don't have Latte/cappuccino because they espresso machine is broken. Repair it!! Who gives King Pao chicken by itself?  Should I bring my own rice to eat with it. And the server won't even tell you unless you ask specifically "does it come with rice?" And he would say "yes at an extra 1.95). Be proactive!! Wife asks for extra veggies in her chicken fried rice and sever says " oh we don't add a bunch of vegetables, what specifically you need?" Learn to serve and treat customers properly!! Puts the check on the table and doesn't even ask if we want a dessert. Seriously dude!!! Worst, bad experience.  Will never come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yNRansri760BZFQb5OyVFg.text: Came here for dim sum and Chinese food.  What I received was excellent and fast service with good food.  Joseph was amaze balls!  He had a ton of tables and still made me feel like I was his only customer.  I ordered the braised tofu and har gow.  Surprisingly the tofu was delicious. Har gow was descent.  Either way good place to satisfy my Asian cravings when staying at the SLS.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Har gow
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised tofu

Cm4eMvQ38m-YIh94AsNe9A.text: Perfect spot for a late night meal if you are on the strip of Las Vegas and do not want to go to Denny's or Ihop.  The environment was simple but good for two or a large party.  Our server was very friendly especially seeing that it was 11:30 pm.   They offer a variety of breakfast, cafe burgers and fries and a lot of Chinese food.  We ordered orange chicken, Kung pao chicken, fried rice, cake noodles, eggplant tofu, and walnut shrimp.  The star of the night was the cake noodles! So much flavor and a perfect combo of sauce and crunchy pan fried noodles.  The egg plant tofu lacked garlic and ginger but the tofu was cooked perfectly.   The prices are a little high for what you get. Ur you will be content and the food is delicious.  However, a lot of places on the strip are a lot higher.

KYpJymPHl5Pxm0qChGLwEg.text: Ate here the first two mornings we were here. Really good food and service. We had the same waiter for both times and he remembered us from the day before.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut waffles.

pXdWITUtw6jYLSO0DBx7bg.text: The food was delicious.  The service was horrible.  We saw our waiter only once after waiting almost 10 minutes just to get our drinks and place our order.  The food was brought out by someone else and then we never saw our server.  We had to flag down someone else just to get our check which took over 15 minutes.

bhDTcH4-Tz0nRmbnO7iHeg.text: I dine at this restaurant today- lunch. Orange chicken is refried, processed, chicken pieces with sugary orange sauce. The broccoli is good. The service is slow. The orange chicken is b-a-d, look for Chinese food elsewhere.

lxO1vhL5CNdT99B1NCbALg.text: Excelent food at reasonable prices. The dim sum was great and cost $6 per plate. We had some of the udon as well which was very good. The missing stars are for service, mid-day on a Friday it was not very busy but we had to wait and finally track someone down to get a booth cleaned. 15 more minutes until we could order water and other drinks. The food came out in a timely manner but we had to literally wave down a waiter when we wanted more water or tea. Overall mixed bag, we would probably try again because the food was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kFBel7dI-CNgXH3CBd5Dxg.text: The food was mediocre. Never mind I'm being too nice.. the food was pretty bad.  I got a noodle dish and all it had was clear broth, noodles, and some vegetable. Absolutely zero flavor.  There weren't any specific wines called out on the menu so I asked the waiter what was available and she named a few. I ordered one of their reds and it was one of the worst I've ever had. Absolutely painful to drink. She was happy to take it back but then forgot to take it off the check. Gah.

tL1PkZpdCRexVQyDDE7IoQ.text: Located in the casino area of the SLS hotel this 24 hour cafe is actually very convenient because they serve all types of food ranging from an all day breakfast menu to dim sum, tacos, salads, burgers, and sandwiches. Their dimsum only opens from late night to 6 am so plan accordingly.  We stayed at the W hotel which is located "inside" the SLS hotel so it was really easy to walk downstairs and grab food whenever.  I ordered a Huevos Rancheros for $15 ish and thought it was super odd that mine would come on a hard shell taco instead of the usual soft tortillas which was really my fault bc it did state "hard shelled taco" on the menu :(. The meat also tasted like canned minced meat which I really wasn't a fan of...sorry I've been spoiled with the super cheesy, soft, melty ones you find in the mom & pop Mexican restaurants in Cali...  Anyway, its a good place to go for late night/early morning grubs if you have a group of people who crave different types of food.

Jujqe_31JI8DEfUYDwmZLA.text: Got the 3 course dinner- caesar, fettucine, cheesecake. Everything was fine. Nothing extraordinary. Our server was super friendly. I'd give it a 3.5 if I could.

R3_UOwnQre4vptOzZdWS3w.text: All i can say is if you're looking for Chinese this is not the place. I ordered all the items marked favorite and while they looked great coming out of the kitchen they lacked so much flavor. The service is nice but slow. Very laidback. I would come here for a coffee or sandwich. Not Chinese food.

SBLIXKU0LLIdaKuldcX0uw.text: From what I can see it was one of the few Chinese restaurants that was not too overpriced! An open dining room and bar section. It was seat yourself. We ordered one dish which was the noodles and it really had an authentic smell and tasted really good and not too much with oil. Our server was super friendly and talkative.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uSshfL6rfDP1Rs4MIN16Sg.text: Amazing service every time !  Heart to come back and see a familiar face Alex !  He's one of the best bartender in this restaurant for late night dining. He's professional kindhearted and just an outstanding person. The food always comes quick and as busy as it can get he always has a genuine smile .  He sets the tone for a simple meal or just a nice quick bite. The food is delicious and served fresh every time.  This is a great place to grab a late night good bite every time and even better if Alex is working.    Thanks Alex for making me  always making me  feel welcomed @Northside SLS Las Vegas!  J R Lopez

w7seNXsuSCrhV6kfl3Ax-w.text: Their salsa tastes like marinara sauce. Nobody wanted to serve us.  One server approached and asked if [guy's name] had taken our drink order yet.  No, he hasn't. So he took our order. When we finished, another server approached and asked if we needed something and we said we needed the check.  He said, "Oh, [guy's name] hasn't been back yet?" and I said I hadn't seen him in a while. You know that kind of half-assed service where none of the servers take ownership of your table and they act like they're doing you a favor since your real server has forgotten you?  This place. Oh, and when they bring Chinese food/dim sum to the table they should bring it with all the Chinese condiments. They didn't.   Poor service and the food was OK.

QpSOky2ug-o7spjhdIoGZw.text: This place is just meh. We stayed at the SLS for a weekend and they gave us a $50 credit to blow on food. The benefits of this spot is that they are literally open 24 hours a day, with the changing of menus as well so it's not constantly the same thing.  The servers are super sweet and accommodating. The food is basic American food, but they do have a random Chinese menu which I heard was really good, but had not tried it. Prices are what you'd expect for Vegas diners. Expect to pay around $11-15 per person. The meals are larger than what I expected however so at least your money goes far!  Sub par food, excellent service.

AchdlD5jkRg1HAipYik7Dw.text: We stood at SLS Hotel & Casino on 3/24/18 and decided to choose a restaurant downstairs for dinner.  After doing the "rounds", we decided to come to Northside as they had a variety of food options.  I ordered the braised tofu with brown sauce with a side of brown rice, and it was excellent!  The side of rice was less than $2 and it was a good portion.  My boyfriend ordered a hamburger with fries, and my friend ordered chicken wings with fries.  All around, the food portions were big, and everything is reasonably priced for what you get.  It's cozy in there, but hip, and they do have televisions all around.  I would definitely eat here again.

hBTiheEgrVCcMg6Z6kAmRQ.text: I wish I could give this restaurant more stars.  I sat down at the table and was waiting for my friend to arrive.  It was awhile until someone finally placed waters on the table.  The Server never came over to ask if I wanted to order an appetizer before my friend arrives.  He finally showed up when my friend arrived to take our drink order.  I ordered the Protein Frittata with no mushrooms.  It came with mushrooms cooked into it.  I had to pick around them as I didn't want to wait for them to re-make it.  The guac appetizer is quite good.  Service could certainly be improved here.

OhBDLLvZYPJXOkl2xhBZtw.text: Nice cafe located in SLS Breakfast is nicely done with crispy bacon - just as requested  Dim sum was tasty with nice sized portions which weren't overwhelming after a long day of travel Staff was consistently pleasant and attentive  Pleasant surprise tucked away in a comfortable venue!

YOG8ddRICOBqGDAiY4g3NQ.text: Arrived around 7pm for a little mother's day dinner. If it's your birthday SLS invites code members for $30 off an order of at least $60 so my mom decided to invite my sister and I for a belated coupon redemption lol. The sign out front read "seat yourself", so we did at a nice big booth where literally 8 people can sit altogether. You know your a family when we all order different entrees just to switch plates to share with each other, at least thats what we always do. Nachos for appetizers, mom had the salmon, sister ordered the grilled cheese with tomato soup and I had the fettuccini alfredo with added shrimp. All the dishes were very filling especially since we couldn't finish the pasta and had to take it to go. We ended with coffee and a slice of cheesecake which fit perfect with a bittersweetness after all the heavy meals. This cafe comes with a bar in the back and has a very open space about it. If you do check in through yelp there's a $5 off promo to use in any specialty cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese menu
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grill cheese

nUM19haoONEJWPqM3hwGOQ.text: Our lunch selections were the Roasted Turkey Club sandwich with fries on a multigrain roll for $15. I really enjoyed this and it was all I could eat once again $15 seems a little pricey for a sandwich but the protein size makes it seem alright. My wife picked the Cashew Chicken and rice, you actually have to pay extra to get rice. She was not impressed by her dinner as the cashew chicken lacked flavor in her opinion. Probably better places to eat but I did like my sandwich.

aRa1Cn6myQBIlVSWPODFoQ.text: Such great food and amazing service!! Oliver took really great care of us and was a 5 Star server. :)

UEl6ipNXtTihUB6X2mFTrg.text: Had a great breakfast here sharing the caramelized banana pancakes and chilaquiles. An excellent combo between sweet and salty. Get the streusel filling on the pancakes! Service was quick and Joseph, our waiter, was fabulous and funny! Prices are on par for Vegas. Definitely will be back if I stay at SLS again!

hcLTEyqXFcpbHTDcS43Liw.text: I loved it here!  We stayed at SLS and came here at least once a day, sometimes multiple times a day.  We got all kinds of items off the menu, breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night room service (yes this will do room service :))  We always had good service and loved the feel of it.  Would come here again and again.  Consistently good food.

Ba1Br6oGdCcYTLiKpVVV9g.text: Place was dirty. Floor filthy. Server was so quiet had to keep asking what?? Coffee had no taste prices are high and the hostess was mean. We asked for a booth and she said 10 min and 3 were available and gave one to someone before us. Not a good experience.

M1VFQQ9vSlX38Lt25RoWaw.text: I travel quite extensively as an airline employee and I have had many experiences in the hotel travel and restaurant business. The Northside Cafe at SLS is excellent and particularly Stephanie is the most positive and uplifting server that I have ever experienced. She is always pleasant and goes above and beyond to provide the finest service. It's obvious that she takes great pride in her work. She is truly an asset to the brand. Check out the Northside Cafe and see for yourself.

SS_yO_-CCglxHNPeH61EyA.text: Definitely order the 3-course dinner.  Great value for your money.  Really enjoyed the meal and my server Juan was exceptional.  Very attentive and anticipated my needs before I did.  I thought the wine was expensive though and the price for it was not listed in the menu.  Nice but not worth $11.oo a glass.  Will definitely come back.

fZBgIXNUX9hpP-hQFfzprw.text: I ate here twice - once for dinner (take-out) and once for breakfast. The food deserves 3 stars  - and the service for a late night dinner take-out also deserves 3 stars. But the breakfast that my girlfriend and I had here while we were staying at the hotel had dismal serve - totally dismal.  I had to scrounge around for my own jelly for my toast while my server was up front chatting and laughing with another server. And I found the manager to help us to get more coffee. We got it - but the service did not improve. So - 2 stars is what it gets.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $10 press pot of coffee

2zNuP0OwIYYsVsBRI_9_YQ.text: It's self seating diner. Friendly staff. Had the beef noodle soup and the lotus wrap. Soup served hot which is nice. Plenty of noodles and beef. Broth very tasty. The lotus wrap are made when ordered. Nice to eat when it's hot, not like some dim sum restaurant when it's been sitting in the cart. I like the atmosphere in there. Have plenty of tv to watch games or just listen to music.

y8P9WvfhiDhsxxFGZy8o2A.text: Infuriatingly bad service. Long story short, it took over an hour for a take out order that was quoted as being ready in 5-10 minutes over the phone. I eventually got so fed up of waiting at the restaurant with the apathetic staff, I went back up to my room and arranged for the room service staff to deliver my food for me.  The Chinese menu is solid, I will be going again for more when I get the bad taste of their (lack of) service out of my mouth.  + Hot and Sour Soup: Bold vinegar flavor with lots of tofu, bamboo, and wood-ear mushroom floating about. Came to me boiling hot, even with the 5 minute commute to my hotel room.  + Yang Chow Fried Rice: Interestingly included shredded iceberg lettuce in the mix. Shrimp were few but larger sized than other places.  +/- Pan Fried Dumplings: Three to an order, very juicy and well seasoned without being overly salty. Some pieces of pork in the filling were too grisly to chew so I wouldn't order this again.  - Staff will not offer you any updates or apologies while you are waiting at the counter for 20+ minutes after the promised time. They will not offer you something to eat while you wait, they will not apologize, they will not make eye contact with you, they will not acknowledge your presence at all. The one thing they will do, is give you your check as soon as you arrive, without telling you that your food is not ready. I will never make the mistake of tipping BEFORE getting my food from this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot and Sour Soup, the only reason I eat here.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Bean Sesame Ball, $5.95 for an order of 4.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Har Gow, $5.95 for an order of 4.

0HfMlWhtRuX8A51mOinSmQ.text: Came by for a quick breakfast and this did the trick.   And yet, I felt kind of underwhelmed. A little smaller portion. Potatoes that were just ok.  A few days afterwards, I just can't remember anything too memorable about the meal.  Good big coffee. That I remember, but the rest, it's fine. Just like Vegas.

NdXtwnL99rbMUxMAAslfBg.text: The sign is misleading because you think they only serve Chinese food but they have a full menu. We had breakfast one day and a late night snack on another day. The breakfast burrito was perfect and not complicated or excessive. We requested all toppings on the side and everything was served as we requested. The chicken quesadilla was the perfect portion size and the pico and guacamole served with it  were delicious. The staff is pleasant and fast. The establishment is clean and the kitchen, exposed in the back, was run well and looked very clean. The beef noodles with gravy was light, had a nice appearance and tasty. The two eggs with potatoes was done exactly like a home cooked meal. The pricing is very fair and I would definitely go back to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6o5BiGZToU9iPfYkSevmjA.text: I had the loaded omelet and it was very tasty. Make sure you ask for extra extra sour cream on your omelet, it just make it that much better. The redskins potatoes on the side were also really good. Great spot in the SLS. I will be back when I'm in Vegas again

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded Omelete! Amazing

UoB9rAlDtUkmglmlDB85Jw.text: Chilaquiles is the word here.... served verde style with an authentic chorizo that is hard to explain the flavor... little tangy a little cumino'ish.  Chips seemed homemade and retained a crispness all the way to the end... Mexican cheese and diced jalapeno all played well together... Worth a trip!

m-LWsKvLb0teS_llFn4jmg.text: Great job Juan M service was great. The food and drinks were awesome! My burger was made just the way I requested. The drinks were also good. My husband never had to ask for a refill. Thanks Juan

S29AiFEm8F9Y-JRXz7cIfw.text: Do not eat here! Got the worst case of food poisoning ever. The chow fun with gravy tasted a bit weird, asked the waitress to bring me a different one and it was pretty much the same plate reheated. I have never felt so sick in my life.

1W53h2jtB21jrlVDW3Kt1w.text: My friend took me to this cute little cafe while visiting the SLS hotel. The hostess seated us promptly and the menu had a lot of special breakfast and lunch choices. I ordered the L.E.O scramble which was an onion scramble layered with thick cuts of smoked salmon with a side of bagel and a dollop of sour cream. I really wanted to try their pancakes since it consisted of interesting combinations such as a carrrot cake style, red velvet pancake style, and the caaramelized banana pancake. I hadd to try it, but didn't want to order a whole order of it since it was a 3 stack.. Our waitress gave me the option of getting it as a side, so I ended up ordering a caramelized banana pancake. Our orders came all at once, and the portion size was huge! The pricing is a little higher than any other cafe's, but the portion size makes up for it. The food was delicious, and the pancake was REALLY, Melt in your mouth good!! the dynamic of all all the tastes just mesh together. We enjoyed our meals and had leftovers to take with us. Service was great, the food was great. I will be back :)   PS- it's open 24 hours, but will get really packed after midnight since the Foxtail nightclub is RIGHt next store.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Leo scramble- comes with bagel cream cheese, eggs benedict, chicken applewood sausage, caramelized banana pancake
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict with side of chicken apple sausage
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. L.e.o scramble. Soooo good!

PNW0ngMalZvy2E9tonbGRA.text: This place seriously has something for everyone. Our server, Richard, made some great recommendations and took excellent care of us. Much better than the average waiter who takes your order then disappears.

SPz5hzutxUeoTaRDJChgcQ.text: First time at Northside and everything was EXCELLENT! The food was great and Joseph our server was awesome! He was polite, very attentive and a little funny...lol.....We will definitely be back before this vacation is over and hopefully Joseph will be our server every time:-)

vzvEcNqRxs0GEkCskXaljg.text: This place was absolutely awful.  The service was the worst service I got my entire trip to Vegas, and that's not a nice thing to say because the service everywhere was slow and not attentive.  The amount of time it took to get anything - a drink order, the server to come back to take our food order, our actual food, I think the bill was the longest wait of all!  I would have rather spent time at the pool eating some snacks than at this restaurant for 2 hours... And the food was terrible.  I got an omelet and it tasted like garbage.  There were 10 of us in our group and nobody was impressed.  I was shocked to see such high ratings here.

k6CSm_iCGZaoaIUcm0k24A.text: Excellent food. I especially recommend the French toast with Nutella on it! The atmosphere is a little noisy and you may have to wait a few minutes in line to get in depending on when you go, but the food is sublime!

amaYwrD6ApeycB-eUvt6ig.text: Under staffed  Tables not cleaned and restaurant manager had a attitude!! Not great way to start evening .. However we got Sunny for our waitress.. Just great!!  I will test food and write more.. I have to say we ordered Chinese .. it was pretty darn good! Still very understaffed!!! Our waitress was running her butt off and continued to give us great service.. but many other tables didn't have Sonny for a waitressz

lnta_ENOaBpGf8nR6Yj9lA.text: Trying a new place. Delicious blueberry pancakes! Get the Bloody Mary. Has candied bacon in it! Fun place for a quick bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Pancakes with honey syrup. Yummmm!!

p-XbmGbcFSdWYR7cwJSSrQ.text: The restaurants are the highlight in the SLS, and Northside Cafe is no exception. Good, hearty hangover breakfast and/or lunch options at less than Vegas tourist-gouging prices. They make a mean Bloody Mary and french press coffee too.

oWhlQ6UzOAXoFIdCryfIRw.text: Northside Cafe is pretty tasty.  I'm a fan of the sandwiches and sweet potato fries.  However, the service is a bit slow, even if the restaurant isn't very busy.  If you are staying at SLS, Northside Cafe is your room service option.  (They do stop serving to your room after a certain time on Mondays-Thursdays though, so don't order too late if you want food delivered to you.)      I noticed that they very recently added Chinese food to the menu, but I haven't had a chance to try any of the dishes yet.

aNOP29F_qXjoFCnuUoaSlw.text: went to the Northside cafe on the weekend and am very glad I did. Wasn't sure what to get and had a few questions about the menu, but the manager Lewis was very helpful! great breakfast selection and the French toast was delicious, would definitely go again!

A_Ay6ErqK1YBHA9Ac5aQ5g.text: Ok, an update to my review of the Northside cafe. Because of my first I was contacted by the Manager Jessica Romo. Jessica convinced me to get the cafe a second chance, so I did. This time I had a party of 4 and we were allowed to order whatever we want. I order the club burger and I must say that was an incredible burger. The flavors were excellent. Then other members in my part have shrimp cob salad, avocado turkey could sandwich, the street tacos, torta and the blueberry pancakes. (My man Eric made sure they were cooked this time. ) All was delicious. We were pleased with our server Angela and the fact that they gave us the VIP treatment. Overall, awesome effort by the staff and the food was delicious.

AIqRdivo2xfKuAWaBi-TRA.text: We enjoyed our meal at Northside and our waiter Joseph was great and very attentive and friendly. The ambience was like a modern diner in a nice hotel and casino. We had no wait to get seated on a Friday night. They offer a mix of classic entrees like burgers and pasta and fish. It also has a full Chinese menu. The soy sauce chow main had a texture that was so fun to eat. The one thing that disappointed us was that the sweet potato fries were not hot when they came out.

d_9HS09ChitFsZSVq9r3Lg.text: Awesome food and service! Joseph was an amazing server, highly recommend! The turkey club sandwich was really really good!

J0klDGK6zujOm7vlZ4Khfw.text: Go for the breakfast burrito. I am giving 5 star quality for the burrito and the girl who remembered exactly how I ordered it yesterday - having only met me once. Excellent burrito and huge portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding breakfast burrito.  Huge portion!

4_UvOuQ7ybsM_qsE7En9Rg.text: Great food and service.  For faster service sit at the countertop.  Had bacon and eggs however the waffle with strawberries looked Delish.

Wxi43PWXSRXDyCcTvcTB9w.text: I ordered chilaquiles verdes and the food was delicious. Service was fast and friendly.

GIAch8uUppD5BUcN8U1apA.text: The absolute best coffee on the strip! I crave their coffee! I've eaten here a few times and never been disappointed. The Huevos Rancheros were amazing. The service is impeccable. I can't wait to get back!

gw18Y0SEtXLo6d79rlv4kA.text: My friend and I were hungry for  Chinese, we were not disappointed - the stir-fried udon noodles with shrimp were wonderful!  Our server Juan was great!  Would definitely come back.

sYxu1uYdvZQkaKjagNS2cg.text: Just finished my first meal here and it was less than impressing for a restaurant apart of the SLS chain. However, the service was great. We ordered the nachos and the Philly cheesesteak -- the nachos were delicious! Full of barbacoa, guacamole, and all the fixings. The Philly cheesesteak was another story: dry, untoasted dinner roll with dry steak and few mushrooms. It's definitely not worth it as it doesn't live up to expectations. Not to mention, the restaurant is right across from the pool entrance and my boyfriend had a perfect view of someone stumbling out and vomiting in the casino but hey, this is Vegas. Regardless, it was an okay experience just steer clear of the cheesesteak.

fwTAYjBrq-mv8485rDwNmA.text: We are locals and took our parents here tonight got the prime rib special on a Friday so good! Some of the best ever! Our waiter Juan was very very kind and accommodating! Definitely recommend him and this place!!

yC6HfktmVmv_iyi3pDUrvw.text: The food was delicious here. I just got the night time breakfast eggs platter but it was perfect. Sourdough toast!  (Yum!) I wish I could have tried some of the morning breakfast dishes as they look fantastic. The best was our waiter Joseph. He pretty much is what all waiters should be. Great little place with a cozy atmosphere.

n3UpefLJw9hwjii_Hkqdyg.text: No wonder the line to get in here for breakfast was so long, delicious coffee served in a French press and the best Huevos Rancheros I've had in a long time! Pancakes looked really good too. Next time I  want breakfast in Vegas, I won't hesitate to come here.

4OaL_9ld5Jfiir4ldrgR0w.text: When you're out late on the north side of the Strip (and conveniently staying in the SLS) and you have the munchies after a night out, the Northside Cafe is there to save the day!  Generally speaking, I was concerned about two things - quality of food (it was the only place open in SLS at that time) and quality of service (it was about 2AM and not very many people were there).  The Northside Cafe delivered on both counts.  The staff was friendly and attentive; there was not one moment where I was waiting for my drink to be refilled.  The food took a little bit longer than I expected (maybe 15 minutes for a burger and fries); however, it was well worth the wait.  The food was not only generously portioned; it was also delicious!  For bacon lovers, the Northside burger had great big pieces of thicker-than-normal bacon on it.  The burger was cooked to perfection.  If you like pickles, you get a whole dill pickle with the plate.  And for you fans of sweet potatoes - these sweet potato fries do not disappoint!  They had the perfect level of sweetness to them, and they were crispy.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Northside burger with sweet potato fries.

7y-GM0xKPmyuAz-UqYVUfA.text: Four of us stopped in for breakfast and none of us left hungry!! I had the bacon egg omelette made with egg whites. Who doesn't love thick cut bacon? My boyfriend had the fluffiest, moist buttermilk pancakes with the most generous dollop of butter. The waitress kept our coffee cups filled throughout our meal and seemed well rehearsed on the menu. Good service and yummy food! Definitely a spot to check out.

Wqk5XNN9wz4jXyS4RTM9JQ.text: I really wish I could give a higher rating overall, but there weren't many positive things about my experience. This review isn't meant to be negative but simply informative.   Specific ratings  Decor-5 Waitress-3 Potatoes-1 Pancakes-0 Bacon-0  As an avid SLS fan (I often visit the Beverly Hills location as well as the South Beach property (I was looking forward to luxury in Las Vegas.  The decor is absolutely gorgeous. It's a great mixture of modern trendiness with sleek elegance. It's spacious and easy to navigate to the restaurant. Bonus points for being 24 hours.   The waitress was friendly and attentive, although not very knowledgeable about the SPG/Starwood Rewards program.   My husband and I ordered pancakes, bacon and potatoes. The pancakes field entire plate, but had some type of generic butter. The butter tasted more like oil and butter. Another disappointment was the syrup. Not a recognizable name brand but a type of liquid make sure that was horrific. The pancakes had a doughy consistency that was so unpleasant, both my husband and I refused to eat more than 3 bites each.  Why have pancakes if they aren't sweet?   The bacon was thick but had over 50% fat, so that wasn't edible either. The potatoes would have been decent if they had served while still hot and had some type of seasoning.   My overall experience was so disappointing that I felt compelled to write this review. The experience didn't not live up to the image and expectations I have for SLS properties.  The guests behind our booth had the same experience with their food and ate even less of the pancakes then we did.  I can't say that I would recommend this restaurant, even for those looking for a basic late night meal.   I will be back this year in either July or September as I didn't get a chance to check out the gorgeous Fred Segal shoe boutique inside the SLS hotel.

zxiXYSUY24hR-n1kBPmQ1Q.text: the reason why i am giving this place only 2 stars is because of the first impression i got.... My friend and I stood behind 2 couples that were waiting to be seate, no problem when it was our turn to be sat she told me to get behind the other people in line that came in after me (another 2 top) then there was another 2 top behind them and she came back and sat them also..... by now i was feeling hurt and when i mentioned that she sat 2 other parties infront of me she said "I know, we were cleaning a booth off for you." upon entering the dining area i noticed the parties that she skipped me for were in booths. she plain out lied. how are you supposed to maintain a regular customer flow if your hostess ( which is your first impression for the restaurant) acts like that.... who knows how many people may have been turned off and left or will never come back

8-qO0fbI0BfjbsLISDiVow.text: I came to northside for breakfast on Tuesday morning with my co workers before our meeting the place was really busy but even though they were so busy the   food came out quick our server juan m was quick to come to take our order and bring the drinks.i would recommend this place for a quick bite before work   or simply having breakfast

7-xozijqLfb_bx5RjZOM8w.text: Great breakfast and price point! Whole Hog omelette is very tasty! They offer a few gluten-free items. It's better to get here before 10:00AM or you might be waiting for a table. They also have a bar with 16 seats as a option but the hostess will need to seat you. We will be back

sDFSZlqw1dHkWKs6bC3dpg.text: Came in for breakfast this morning with my husband. There was a little bit of a wait so we decided to dine at the bar. We were greeted by Eddie amd he started us off with two bloody marys. We needed some more time to look at the menu since it was our first visit. Eddie suggested the buttermilk pancakes and bacon, which we decided to try. They were amazingly delicious. We haven't had this type of hispitality in a long time. Eddie was very friendly and helped guide us through the menu. He made us feel at home. Whenever  we are in Vegas, we will stop by Northside Cafe for the hospitality and great food.

BBWWHJC6pdHfbqIwODLo9w.text: Pastrami sandwich with sweet potato fries were pretty fantastic. I was unsure of this place, but very happy I came. Great late night meal. Would come back and order the same thing

t5F2kNztTsQq26mF8lCigw.text: Best breakfast place we found in Las Vegas definitely on the strip and cool new hotel is located in the SLS

NdZjvGK_BOsnjyG23gCQ5A.text: Northside was the best! We stayed at the SLS this week and went to each of the restaurants onsite. Even though Bazaar Meats and Katsuya are more fine dining Northside has hands down the best service. The guys at the counter and the servers were so kind, knowledgeable and fast. We LOVED the burger and could not speak higher of staff there.

okdKq2N4ecLTzxrOjKOdIA.text: This place isn't as good as before under different name. We went there this Saturday and we thought it would be same as before but food serving got smaller and we were still hungry after. So we went and ate at the pizza place in sls.

2JqLsnfz72OFT7gF8IgcUQ.text: The food is average, but the service is the worst. I ate here 3 times in two days cus its the easiest and i like the simple good options, i think that i had the worst service of my life all 3 times, i should gave taken a can to subway or something, that's how bad it was.

ju92KNscR7OXgSapuN37IQ.text: I like this is place.  I'm order Strawberry Waffle. They was are very yummy!!! My friend order eggs and coffee.  I will be coming to visit still with my friend !

ZcnJtxJrzdPUkQ1Dta4_Xw.text: Yummy 24/7 food inside SLS Casino! Joseph was a great waiter, he got our special order 100% correct. The food was delicious and unique, the cocktails were sweet, I had an awesome Bloody Mary. The food came very quick and was tasty! Now on to some gambling in this new, sleek casino on the north end of the strip.

uTtEJVEleYGBAKQ57kZcNQ.text: Food is good had the guacamole and chips and beef street tacos and have no complaints.  The tacos were really good and would definitely get them.again my girl had the bbq pork fried rice and said it was really good as well. Going to make this a spot we come to whenever in the strip and need a quick meal service was good and foodnl came out quickly.

7ZMjm5QmXWMYQZUHTIiEcA.text: This was the first restaurant we saw when we walked into the New SLS casino. My wife and were very hungry so we choose the Northside. My wife said her food was ok. She is always nice and doesn't have a bad word to say about anyone. Me on the other hand, not so nice. I ordered eggs Benedict. The food was first given to another table and then it was given to us.  By that time the food was cold. When I first cut into the Eggs Benedict the eggs were overcooked. After our waiter served our food we've never saw him again until it was time to bring the check. He never even asked us how the food was. Not a good start for a new restaurant in the new casino.

xy0GPuFU-w0FXaCGR18_mg.text: Didn't even get to the food... Hostess, Alexis, RUDE - have a little respect!!! I'm with my elderly mother and some other older women. I never leave a bad review, ever, but they were not very accommodating. So instead of reporting them to the SLS hotel I decided to leave a yelp review. We left without eating. Bunch of amateurs running the place.

Qz_ojSOiMBSnWRbW0ESIDw.text: Christian Santos is one of the best servers!!! Look for him highly recommended... Best place to eat breakfast nice waffle....

HnSNtwafWWhIuCm1dFLq5w.text: Let's start with the great- the food and the bartenders were it.  Joe and Joe V. are absolutely fantastic; they deserve raises. I had the nutella french toast with whipped cream; it was perfectly done and not soggy at all ( I stopped eating french toast as a child because everyone who made it for me, made it soggy- I actually thought that it was supposed to be that way- yuck).  I added a side a bacon and shared that with the boyfriend; four thick slices come with it.  The boyfriend had buttermilk pancakes which he was as equally satisfied with- they were light and fluffy and a nice big serving. The good- All patrons seemed to be satisfied with their food. The bad and it's bad- I'm not sure if the hostess was nervous or what.  There seemed to be an abundance of kitchen staff and waiters but she wasn't seating people. AND there were plenty of booths and table tops. We just stood in the line and she would come to the line and ask how many people every now and then-she didn't write any of this down. After 15 minutes in line she came and asked the couple in front of me if there were only two in their party-she left and didn't return although there were 3 2-tops available. My boyfriend spotted two people leaving the bar so he left the line and claimed the seats-I followed shortly and the family behind me left.  The couple in front of me finally got sick of waiting for one of the empty tables and  joined us at the bar twenty minutes later.  At least 6 tables stayed empty for half of our meal although there was a line and plenty of staff to handle them.   Note to Management: Your food is great- I would hate to see you lose great customers.  Please assist the hostess and come up with a better way of seating and serving customers when you have a full staff available.

fUxI6bk1oc3eWjPbNzBXkg.text: Great diner. I sat at the counter and had the two-egg breakfast and it was great. Friendly staff, great service and nice atmosphere.

WqcGF4sNbUg1UGoFfIVFzQ.text: The food was absolutely amazing!  We stayed at sls for 3 days & two nights. Our breakfasts and lunches we had here! Prices were good for Vegas, cheaper than a buffet. The food was really filling! Tip of advice : breakfast burritos are to so good! Ask for ranch !

K6Tljau0P4CzOf-Lhmx1Xg.text: Stayed at SLS and upon a late arrival and check in, the Northside Cafe was recommended to us by the front desk.  We sat at the bar which was very nice and the overnight bartender was great. (sorry that I don't remember his name) My husband and I ordered breakfast for dinner and really really enjoyed it.  We went back the next afternoon (we ate there 3x during our vaca) this time the service was very sketchy, meaning we sat for quite awhile after being seated with no acknowledgement at all, mind you we were seated in the booth directly in front of the "servers" station. But again the breakfast food was great; as it was each time that we did have a meal there.  Who ever makes the eggs......I swear they were cooked perfect each time I ordered them. (over medium) Drinks and Food are great. Service just okay, unless you sit at the bar with the overnight bartender ;)

sgFgA76jrZQBKXcx2_efVg.text: Awesome food but a little pricey. Some of the best eggs benedict and chocolate pancakes I ever had. Yum. Definitely a great spot for breakfast and I also heard their sandwiches are delicious. I would give this place a try if you're in the area. Nice selection of food and everything on the menu sounded good.

b0-DHZ0Zv2hetDmOLciAFw.text: The food although tasty took over 45min to arrive. Other guests seated around me got their orders first as I watched mine sitting in the window. The all around service here and the SLS in general is severly lacking the sophistication that they promote.

KmfE2X-4pHFM8YxX7YoTpQ.text: This place reminded me of coffee shop with an update. Open 24/7 which good considering that the other restaurants in the hotel are closed Tues & Weds. Had the Barbacoa Tacos with Charro beans and they were the bomb. The rest in my party had a mix of different dish that you said were tasty.

nAB9vNHM7iCLW3c8Pm7Eew.text: Everything did not make sense. From the hostess counter where..idk if it was soap in mason jar decoration or items being sold? Idk. Didn't make any sense with the whole "northShore" name. As soon as I walked in, the feel of the place didn't match the hostess stand or the name of the place. Then our food came & it was nothing interesting. Very bland. Even dry at times. The drinks tasted like cocktails that a preschooler could of made. Yuck. Too sweet in one drink & the other bitter. My husband & I ate Maybe 3 bites each then requested a box to go. I just Did Not like anything about this place...idk

SmEMaen6PVDptAzw0zvaPQ.text: This is my second time going to Northshore. While I love the breakfast burrito with Chorizo, the service is terrible. Both separate stays we waited for awhile after being seated for our server to come to our table. The food came out quickly, but there were several tables left with food on them. Management, servers and other staff walked by them several times and didn't clear them. Then after waiting forever for my husband to get a refill on his drink, the server brought the check. Then she came back right away and wanted it back, I found that funny. If you want better service go somewhere else, but food is good.

aDcQ32WFMybubnOF9Z_-UA.text: This what I posted about,  customer service is lacking.. 1 month after my review I get a response. . This why I said "they have a long road ahead".. This is NOT how a major strip property in Las Vegas with a department dedicated to customer service should take after a month to field a response. . #JustSaying

xtHaxL3kRG6ov9jUdEZmKw.text: Lola was such a great waiter.. Spent 6 hours there and not one time did I feel like a visitor. She made sure I was comfortable and okay. Love her

1l-OYkly0at_OOS296mEaA.text: While staying at the Sls my Fiance and I decided to dine here, which wasn't a great experience at all. We walked in and sat down, looked at the menu etc. 20 minutes passed and no waiter attended to us, another couple walked in and sat down and a waiter walked right over to them giving them a glass of water. The managers excuse was he didn't see us sit down. Which was a lie because when we walked in he greeted us along with two other servers, and we sat in the booth right in front of his station. Maybe you should change your "Seat Yourself" policy because apparently the servers and managers are in that much of a deep convo, with nothing to do lounging around that they "Did not see us sit down" while it was pretty much empty. We should of just ordered from our room, we probably would of gotten great service that way, like we did this morning for breakfast. We decided to go to Umami Burger which was a great experience with more professional and attentive servers.

pmyklo-_GPDZhFuOH9oq-w.text: This place could be fabulous with some minor tweaks. First of all there was a line to be seated when we could clearly see empty tables for at least 15 minutes. The staff was young and in my opinion not well trained this is a management issue! The food was decent not as good as my friends raved about I asked for a side of pico de gallo and I was told it was extra ok ok it came it was beautiful to look at diced perfect but without a drop of lime or salt! ! It was just ok! You can do better Northside Cafe

ueobnFrt0XKToryLYI_YnA.text: We enjoyed our meal at Northside and our waiter Joseph was great and very attentive and friendly. The ambience was like a modern diner in a nice hotel and casino. We had no wait to get seated on a Friday night. They offer a mix of classic entrees like burgers and pasta and fish. It also has a full Chinese menu. The soy sauce chow main had a texture that was so fun to eat. The one thing that disappointed us was that the sweet potato fries were not hot when they came out.

HQNiTM40Q9u6mJbj9TeiCg.text: I have extensive food allergies and so eating out can be challenging. Ismael was our server and he asked the kitchen to combine 2 different meals to make it safe for me. They complied without issues. And the food was fantastic!

qA0jwrravfQDOoTu47xqUw.text: Went here a few times with my boyfriend because we were staying in SLS. The nachos were delicious along with the chilachiles, dimsum, and burgers. The best service we had was by Nick the bartender. He kept my boyfriend happy with consistent orders of his Jack n Cokes, and he made me an AMF that was delicious and strong.

mIIA1hnN00u_KEMqv2e8fA.text: Pretty good food but the service is awful. The first time we went here we sat at the bar and had awful service. The bartender ignored us almost the entire time. The second time the manager had to come over and help us/force the waitress to help us. Foods good though. And French press coffee!

rRtQEusuzqCYP7w4nS4UZQ.text: Went for a Sunday morning breakfast while on vacation. One of the best coffee we had all trip!  Our server CHRISTIAN, even went out of his way to top off the wife's cappuccino with the letters "SLS" in foam!  Top notch service!

dshnLnFHL0T8fakDY3AEWg.text: After trying to eat at another restaurant at the SLS(where the experience was disappointing), my daughter and I ate here. Within seconds of sitting down, we were greeted and menus were placed. The server got our drink order and answered questions about the menu. The food and service were amazing. As a local, we will definitely be back.

RvyGF4J97d6Mxl8d57ncdQ.text: I still cannot get over their steak and eggs breakfast plate..by far the best I've had! This cafe in SLS hotel is open 24/7 but the food are delicious!  Prices are decent as well and the servers are friendly! I recommend this place for brunch or late meal after a night out

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not your average cafe coffee
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So fresshh
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best steak and eggs Ive had!

bOGsroiTxumgXZ4FKReOtg.text: Great food! Ask for Joseph T..He is very nice, answered all our questions and gave us suggestions...Try the dim sum...Also, the caesar salad and grilled cheese with tomato soup. Thank you Joseph for making our experience so enjoyable!  (.:

ib37hsdap9OJk6dfZKOI2g.text: The food was pretty good. Nothing great but definitely not bad. Very basic menu with a lot of variety, which I like when I don't know what I want or when with a group.   I dined here twice on my trip in Vegas.   The first was right around midnight, my BF and I ordered to-go meals to take to the room. The girl was nice and after taking our order, offered for us to sit in a corner booth to wait for our food since it would take 10 minutes or so. We took our seat and waited. and waited. and waited. a good 25-30 minutes later, we realized we hadn't gotten our food, and not one person came up to us to let us know our food was ready or not. So I got up to ask the girl what was going on, she had our food sitting on the back counter. She asked my name and gave me the bag. Once in the room, the food was pretty lukewarm. Not a huge deal, but I just wish she would have kept a better read of the situation. We were maybe 5 steps from where she was, right around the corner. Aw well. Food was fine.  The second time was the morning we were leaving, grabbing breakfast before hitting the road. The server was nice, took our order since we were ready quickly. Food and drinks came out semi quick and were all delivered by different people. When our food was dropped off, I asked for more ketchup since ours was empty. He said, "okay" in a somewhat confused voice and never returned. A server never really came back until we flagged someone down that we were ready for the check, after sitting there with empty plates for a few minutes. Now, I have worked as a server in the past, so I get it when you're busy, but there is still a way to keep up with your tables or have someone else do it. The real problem is that the restaurant was not super busy. maybe 3/4 full and I saw at least 10-12 employees buzzing around so didn't seem under staffed.   Eat here if you don't care about customer service or if you're not in a rush. The food is decent and they have a lot to chose from. At least when you DO get to interact with the employees, most of them are quite nice.

wk7jjaS9qwsSQNlSJtgQbg.text: I'm about to go in y'all.   So I took my family members who were visiting from out of town to what I thought would be The Griddle House. To my surprise GH was no longer there. They have replaced it with Northside Cafe and an all new menu. We were hungry, I hoped SLS wouldn't disappoint, and so we decided to give it a try.   Service was extremely slow: The place is absolutely empty but we receive service like it's jam packed with clients.   Extremely subpar service from waiter:  -I ask the waiter what he prefers from the menu. He shares, "I don't know just pick."  -Later, we ask for straws and he tells us that they "ran out of straws". My first thought is, 'Where they do dat at?' Anyway, we go out of our way to find a busboy who gives us straws on the spot. When the waiter comes back and sees that we have straws, he looks stifled and upset. From that point on he only returned to the table to give us the bill.   Here's my assessment: The Griddle House brought high hopes for dining at SLS. Unfortunately, NSC is not holding its own properly. Northside Cafe will need to step up its game either through new management, servers and menu to stay in the market.

MlCQhBFOq1gyW6mhpMitSg.text: Came here for breakfast this morning with my boyfriend and it was very nice! The food was good and the servers really took care of us. I will be returning very soon! Very pleased!

P0Xbx9eOnxVw7EfiP6WFAw.text: Breakfast: It was a busy Saturday morning. My husband and I were seated right away. I ordered ham & eggs with potatoes and my husband ordered huevo rancheros. We were both happy with our foods. The ham was really thick and juicy! 4/5   Dinner: LOLA was our server. She was really fast and efficient. She took care of us. Thanks LOLA!   My husband ordered the northside burger with sweet potato fries & a pickle. The burger was bomb! The meat was juicy. The bacon was thick. The sweet potato fries were crispy and delicious! Don't forget to ask for ranch. I ordered chicken noodle soup. It was good. Felt like I was home away from home. 5/5

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Northside Burger

R2Z_CS3Vu8apVSzWZTbUGw.text: Yummy food! Exceptional burger. Great squid. N buffalo wings were delicious. Fries were good. Sweet n sour soup was great! Salmon with capers all good. Julian was waiter n was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wDKxb95wJ1Aq4qL0LDd5Fw.text: I really hope SLS cleans up its acts before its too late.  Northside Cafe is a great example of whats wrong with all the recent dining shake ups at SLS. I dined as a few friends and identified ourselves as locals with ID in hands. Despite being confirmed by our server, we charged full price for everything we ordered. Upon bringing it up to our server she informed us that our card was missing a sticker identifying us as locals despite having our IDs showing our addresses in hand. It would have been nice to know that when we told you that we we locals before we ordered. Whatever.  I probably wouldn't have been that annoyed if the food had actually been worth the price. It wasn't. Northside is mostly traditional cafe fare you can find pretty much anywhere. The fries from my burger were cold and had clearly been sitting there for a while. The street tacos were tiny. Fortunately the banana pancakes were good, a hold over on the menu from the previous Griddle Cafe.   Service was a disaster from start to finish. 30 minute wait time and food took forever to come out. We had to flag down our server for refills and to get our order in. I understand  that all new restaurants have issues starting off but this was just a catastrophe. 1 star! Smh all day.

dTHFBPJMRGsFWkiZZjz4Aw.text: "Locals Beware" this place doesn't consider you as "local" even if you slap them with a Nevada ID. I was told by the Northside cafe manager that the las vegas local that they meant was the surrounding apartments and pretty much within SLS vicinity.     I'm not big on writing reviews but this place was just too much!  I had breakfast there this morning and the hostess specifically gave us the "local secret menu" instead of the regular menu. We were seated at the bar and the service was ok and the food was ok too for the price that was on that local menu. When I asked for the bill I noticed that I was charged with the full price from the regular menu. When I asked the server why I was charged full price all he said was "oh you're supposed to have a little sticker on your code card and there's nothing I can do about it" and this guy is holding my nevada ID with las vegas address on it! How local do you have to be???  This place is ridiculous I am never going back there! So locals beware don't even bother  asking for the specials they have for locals.

WwZopeim9WT3vaSB7x0qAw.text: Very poor customer service. Rude waitress indicating we aren't the only table their serving to relax lol hello aren't you suppose to be able to handle many tables at once. In general SLS has a bad service

IgmejIJsMZ43fnt7ZhZq3A.text: my coworkers and I had been looking for a place to eat and one of them suggested this place.  very cool vibe here and the staff was wonderful.    During the opening of our visit we had a prompt business call we all had to be on...this would last through out the entire meal. Joseph who had served us was more than awesome and kept us going with refills wonderful food.  we will be back!   thanks Joseph!

EnVlo9fytj0j84iwnJ0fdA.text: Great breakfast and our server Juan M was very attentive. The Americano was $2.95--vegas steal!

tXyp_s369j5Mnn_6cQ_82w.text: is metal now considered a form of protein? because I was lucky enough to chomp down on a piece of it while enjoying my protein frittata.  the chunk of glistening silver certainly spiced up the otherwise bland meal, but my teeth weren't happy about the surprise.   They were unable to accommodate my request for greens or veggies in lieu of potatoes and toast. I guess gluttony and Sin City go hand-in-hand.  My fiance said his 2 egg breakfast with bacon and potatoes was fine, but it's hard to mess up eggs...you know, unless you toss some metal bits in there or something.  The manager was quick to replace my meal and offer to comp the meal, but you lose your appetite pretty quickly after biting into r2d2.   After all you know what they say: Ruin my breakfast once, shame on you. Bite into metal twice, expect to receive my dentist bill.  I was bummed that I didn't end up loving this place after hearing great things about it, but I'm guessing that the other reviewers weren't the lucky recipients of tool box bits.  Eat at your own risk.

P6Kgbfoxbfyfh5eRJBKPRA.text: Consistently good diner food. Good service (s/o Joseph)...nothing wrong i just csnt give a diner 5*. A staple when i stay at sls for business

W06nUbhDMFHtwvg9M_ezgA.text: Super slow and somewhat chaotic service.  People who sat before me received their food way before me. I had to wait 35 plus minutes for my dinner. Other patrons had the same experience and were disappointed. Yes  - it's one of those restaurants.

LCHg36L8N28wBt7BIWxRtQ.text: We have eaten at the Northside Cafe in the SLS Hotel each day we stayed there.  It was VERY good food.  Servers were great too.  Jim was our favorite!  Say Hi to him for us from Steve and Rhonda!

g_jIdiHGE1HKufpnFc2rsg.text: Mediocre at best. The Griddle was a thousand times better!   Belgian waffle was a regular waffle. Chicken sausage was cold.  Eggs weren't cooked as ordered either. Wheat toast sucked.  Also had the protein frittata, probably made with carton egg whites because the whole plate was watery.   Wouldn't recommend.

23jsyjUpw6NfncPUiRSxZg.text: I had no choice but to eat here last weekend.  This was the only place open for breakfast at the SLS on Saturday morning.  I went at 11am and there was a line of people waiting to get seated.  Since I was by myself, the bar seating was available and I walked right in.   Ambience:  Very chill cafe style restaurant.  Not terribly big.  But I loved the fact that they had seating at the bar.   Service:  Really good.  I was served by one of the bartenders right away.  Drink ordered was placed and food ordered taken soon after.  It was easy for to get refills on my drink.  Check came out right away.  No complaints with the service. Food:  First off, their coffee is a frenched pressed brew.  It was impressive and delicious.  There menu had a little of everything (including mexican and traditional breakfast).  I had their meat lover omelette (or something like that) and bagel and cream cheese.  Omelette and potatoes were pretty good.  All of the condiments are on the table including multiple hot sauces.  Bagel was nicely toasted and the cream cheese nicely whipped.   Value:  My meal came out to $20.  The guy forgot to charge me for coffee so that was a nice break.  It would have sucked if I had a larger party and needed to wait in line.  OTherwise decent place for breakfast.

P_L55tlq4qK4K5_sDoYVhw.text: I was there last week and I enjoyed the great food and the service. Joseph, was our waiter and he made sure we were taken good care of. Thank you.

RGta_ejCWh2OFPU35GmMEg.text: If you are staying at SLS and don't want to walk 10-15 minutes to Peppermill for breakfast, it is good. The eggs benedict were solid. Get it with avocado instead of bacon, thank me later.   Just stopped by for breakfast although they are open for lunch and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t beat that price! And breakfast all day. :)

IrOF-fM-nvqtSM6-Qzhv1g.text: So many food choices.  Our server Oliver was awesome!  Friendly.  Clean. Nice place to chill.

rNo0zpFQc-1pCBtfwfSa8w.text: Came a while back and it was just okay at best. But this time, had chicken wings and fingers (hard to make those bad), and surprisingly a really good omelette. Service was faster than before also. I'll be back.

5ooC0R28od1M96aNSi3RLw.text: Food was delicious. Their Mongolian beef is the best I have ever had! Also I really like how they have different options for you to chose from. Like East meet West, Chinese to American and our waiter was really nice.

vWpkcgQNVgdYYYGRdSQ1TA.text: While staying at the SLS, we ate at the Northside Cafe everyday! Some of the items are a bit pricey for breakfast, but the serving sizes are huge! Our servers were always friendly, and to make it even better this place is open 24 hours! We first checked in our hotel at 1 am and thank god this place was open! Nothing like late night munchies

RtEOxQXA_ShYqaVxcXdapg.text: Just bad.  Service: I had to go get the waiter who were all (about 4 of them) huddled up laughing in this open door room to the left of the bar looking like they were all discussing a recent episode of their favorite sitcom. Bald guy with the beard especially never came back to our table with an answer after I asked about my Yelp check in. Just bad...  Food: I had coagulated pan fried noodles and 3 spongy dumplings. Bad  Drinks: some passion fruit drink. It was delicious, but tasted like juice  Don't go...

xHuL5qcGdXQeEvFQHFy3aQ.text: Came for breakfast, the most important meal of the especially if you got a day of shopping a head of you. I ordered the breakfast tacos and my waiter Joseph T let me know it was a great choice. He wasn't lying. These tacos were a great take on the classic breakfast burrito but better. The side of beans that came with were Amazing. My cup of black tea was perfect and twice Joseph T poured my tea for me from the pot left on my table.  Kevin really enjoyed is lox scrabble. The salmon covered the eggs beautifully. They didn't skimp you on the salmon at all. It came with a bagel which made it the perfect combination.

6iWnMkMm23Ni-7nAgv6vjg.text: This place is called "Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen" well guess what - they don't even serve Chinese or any pan-asian food until after 12:00noon. Lame. Severs were next to impossible to find - good luck getting a refill of your water here.   I think the most pleasant aspect of my meal here was the the cigarette smoke wafting in from the open wall to the casino.

uZ8xkd1NrtIxxpu-PAIc8w.text: Great food at the Northside. Their Asian noodle dishes are the best. Can't wait to go back. Charming low-key vibe with a plain dining room. Reasonably priced entrees.

One thing I was a little upset about was the fact that my husband wanted a small glass on just tomato juice and they could not give it to him BC they did not have it, but they had bloody Mary's weird OK. But all in all everyone was really nice and very professional. Try the food at least once u will want to come back.

c4lkqe9OKtZVdwWU3-ZXfg.text: Great food and service! Oliver was awesome, so warm and attentive. Cheese steak was delicious!!!!

CS8SQOa3r7Dhi4Hu9hPukg.text: Joseph did a great job at dinner last night and we got him this morning for breakfast

tQhoopEb2qPYgiPDWQqwig.text: This was my first time trying this cafe and I was really looking forward to some delicious food after a crazy night in Vegas and was left super disappointed. When watching your weight because summer is going to peek it's ugly head very soon we had a early dinner but after all that fun etc. my girls and I decided no late night binging so we slept hungry and woke up hungrier.  So we went downstairs because they were raving about this place considering they are always staying at the SLS and eating here, I really trusted their opinion, but even they were so disappointed in the quality of the food! I ordered the buffalo wrap, there was barely any chicken in there the dressing was not even properly dressed just bland bland bland! I tried the Benedict it was bleh nothing really nice to comment about it, the potatoes had zero flavor and were honestly just greasy. BUT the only nice thing I have to say about this restaurant which next time I will say I'll pass on is the Pressed Coffee! It is really fantastic! I would only stop in here to grab a coffee. Food 1-10 was a 2, coffee a 10, and service considering our server was constantly MIA was a 3.   I do not recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch

8G1ow5lcLgd2RqQArQpg9g.text: Wow!!!! The food is fantastic! I would go out of my way to eat here again!!! The street tacos and the nachos were excellent. Also the Chinese rice was incredible. Well worth a visit!

SxnpZIV3Q76R8Rb60L8e8g.text: Stayed at W hotel for about a week and the only restaurant opened 24 hours was north side cafe and since I came to Vegas to party and got to the hotel super late of course i had to eat there . Ordered the steak and eggs and that steak was the worst steak of my life. It tasted like it was frozen for years. I could Not be more disappointed ....... and super overpriced... forget about it ......

ja7lBL8z8J5l94gFFf0qCw.text: Just came out from this restaurant. My friend ordered a steak and it tasted like old meat. Imagine eating a dead rat. We told the our waitress but she didn't seem to believe us.

JNF7gq9EnKbtq6YWrIigZQ.text: Went here for a quick breakfast. 2 of us shared the bacon and spinach omelette which came with a toast and breakfast potatoes.   Food was delicious and tasty. Service was excellent.  Restaurant was nice and clean.  Definitely will come back to try their Chinese food.

i1Zyjx99jsVx3kxgfiK-tQ.text: Late night casino break with attempts to break casino stereotype. This last resort meal were the final choices of the night providing a reminder that standards still have opportunities to be elevated in the world of casino meals. While it's True that alcoholic influences surpress the critical food analysis, those with starving agendas will be at odds with their choices. If the goal is to meet a calorie quota to continue vegas activities then the choices will meet those demands. It's in the best interest to upgrade the facilities and retain all the customers for a hungry buffett session thereby retain the return of investment at breaknecking pace. Imagine a casino where the sole purpose of traveling to them is the food, what a gambling experience that could be.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2VPG_cTlM5xSQxGG6ksjSg.text: *** 3.5 stars Overall ***  Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen has a good size menu with a variety of different foods.  I was craving Asian food and my boyfriend wanted American food.  We decided to dine here because they offered both.  The restuarant was located downstairs in our hotel (SLS Hotel) so it was convenient for us, another reason we wanted to dine here.  We walked up to the hostess and was seated immediately.  Our server introduced himself and then handed us menus and waters.  The interior was very spacious and has unique decor.  I ordered Dim Sum and Sweet & Sour Soup.  The Siu Mai was very tasty - full of flavor and cooked perfectly.  The meat was tender and juicy.  The Har Gow was ok, the wrapper was soft at the beginning of the meal and then became a little chewy for me.  The meat was good, but I would pass on this dish.  The Sweet & Sour Soup was tasty and had the right amount of flavor - more sour than sweet, but still very good.  However, the mushrooms weren't sliced, so I had giant chunks in my bowl  :\  After awhile I didn't want to eat anymore because it tasted slimy.  My boyfriend ordered the breakfast burrito and it looked great.  Two people can definitely share the  burrito!  Service here was pretty good.  We dined around 11:30AM and it was kind of busy.  Staff members were friendly and attentive.  Water cups were refilled constantly.  The tables, chairs, and floors were clean.  I was very happy and satisfied with my first experience here.  I would dine here again, but would try something different next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (L) Siu Mai &amp; Har Gow (R)
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet &amp; Sour Soup
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito

axxhJEpWoQ0dg7iOzwpIsQ.text: I love eating at this restaurant however I am so disappointed they have removed the red breakfast potatoes and went with generic hash browns. Sahara you are better than generic food. The staff and service is still excellent though!

JcJYozYbxqF-MHkFu33haQ.text: We spent a night at SLS last weekend and while there we enjoyed this place so much we ate there twice.  When you walk in the place has a very cool updated feel.  The people that seated us and the waitstaff were all very friendly.    I will say, going into it was a bit concerned because the thought of a place doing both American and Chinese food rarely is handled successfully.  But I have to say, they pulled it off.  I had their signature nachos, my wife had Kong Poa Chicken, and my daughter had some Asian noodle dish.  We all loved our our food, the nachos were some of the best I ever had.  It was so good my wife and I went back for breakfast the next morning.  I had a breakfast burrito which was really good, and my wife had the avocado toast which was awesome.    Bottom line, if we ever stayed here again we would eat here in a heart beat.

BWPc7hwARIZdxd4kjEjuig.text: Service is slow if any at all.  Went in the for a quck bite before the show.  Quick it was not!  Prices ate not that good, either!

rvjsCg-CHKM4NkTIiDTHPw.text: Bring back the carna asada bowl!!! It was the best thing on your menu PLEASE!!!!   So sad when i showed up and it was gone!!!!

wFR-plEh51qphp78H79e_g.text: This place is way over priced. Go to Denny's and save your self $50 for breakfast. $18 2 egg breakfast. Over the top. Probably cause they are so over staffed with people standing around.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $18 breakfast

wOlFPr-Lnr3wYHhbqEcU-Q.text: I with my husband wait around 20mins,no body serve us,no body ask us what do we wanna drink,even when we got there so slow,waiter gave us the dirty table ,not yet clean!Bad serve ! If can give "0" star,I will do that!

W0lOuxrBHeZnl1U6tR5Tzw.text: Excellent yogurt parfait, hold the granola.   Huge breakfast burrito serving Regrettably we were in a rush. It was 7am, the place was empty and our server came through. Phew!  We were seated in a booth and he offered to bring us a check immediately after we ordered. Perfection. We needed to boggie fast- not your normal Vegas trip.   My parfait was great. I thoroughly enjoyed it. My husband's burrito was massive and sufficient. It's a good diner. But that's what it is- a diner. So I'm basing my review with that category in mind. 4 stars for solid service and a quick meal, per our request.   I ordered my parfait without granola - and it arrived as requested. It was delicious with large, ripe berries. Zero complaints with this visit and I would certainly return.

b9neHAlF3ugxIe-uhO_s1Q.text: I was there for breakfast today. The waiting period to get in was pretty quick. But the waiter was no where to find for 20 mins after seating. We finally ordered and got our food after another 20 mins of wait. While we were eating new couple came to seat next to our table.  They waited like 15 mins for get served but the waiter didn't show up and they left.  Food here is ok. You really need patience or not really hungry to eat here. Because you will get starved while you to get serve.

26wB9yOaXeGkMTiECZ-cqA.text: So disappointed. I stayed at the SLS this past weekend and had a strong craving for fried rice! How convenient there is a CHINESE KITCHEN in the hotel! I just knew this was going to be great, everything fell in place how could it not be tasty?   Well, I'll tell you how...I ordered veggie fried rice no egg & my friend ordered chicken fried rice. We waited about 10-15 minutes for our order and once we got it, of course, checked it out. I wish I would've taken a picture, but it literally looked like steamed rice tossed in oil + asparagus & broccoli. Now I should've just asked for a refund, but I was hungry, tired, & optimistic.  I get to my room too ready & let me tell you  what it tasted like: steamed rice tossed in oil + asparagus & broccoli ANNOYED. I had to put a ton of soy sauce & sriracha to make it edible.  On the other hand, my friend took 2 bites of her chicken fried rice & threw it out.  Won't be back & won't reccomend. P.s the rice tossed in oil made my stomach hurt. The reason for the 2 stars? The staff was super nice!

veK28acXp3kOgweW6zAJ0g.text: Pretty standard breakfast options although they do have boozy milkshakes. Prices are really high for the food served although it was somewhat expected being a strip hotel restaurant. I had the avocado toast with poached eggs which tasted pretty good. Hash browns tasted like bacon fat which I didn't really appreciate as a vegetarian. Haven't tried the Chinese menu, which is served in the afternoon/evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast with hash browns

4ArCDS4JbWWACT9NfKN6Cw.text: Terrible. $46 for breakfast for two. And AVERAGE breakfast at that. Service was poor. Place wasn't busy at all, yet we waited 12 minutes for one coffee and one orange juice. Had to hunt down the waiter twice, and also waited 20 mins just for the check.   Save your money and eat breakfast elsewhere.

HF8WfP5MB811rzfcp6JE6w.text: Went from a favorite to a never again. The service has been declining steadily for some time, but, living across the street, we kept coming because the food was good. WAS. Now the food is just as bad as the service. Save yourself some money and go to any other place. When we complained, the manager told us the complaints were usually the "opposite" of our complaints. So my complaint was inconsistent with the "usual" complaint. Way to manage a restaurant! This was like an episode of Restaurant Impossible where there is no saving the restaurant from the complete incompetence of those "in charge."

_dmvGUACI42J6WOWJnO-lw.text: Service was okaaaay, it started fine but felt like the server forgot about us after the first drink refill lol.   Food was delicious! My friends got the breakfast burrito which looked very large and impressive, everyone cleared their plates - must have been yummy :)

-mOix7ZKl8cVr_lRssuIQw.text: Came here super late at night and immediately sat down. There were about 5 other parties in the whole place and 2 waiters working. It didn't look that busy, but it took almost ten minutes for someone to greet us. Not a huge deal as it made up for the fact that he apologized and was super nice. We ordered the nachos and asked for guac on the side and no jalapenos. It came out with both of those on top. We didn't complain and just ate around it. I didn't prefer the cheese sauce on them, I would've just preferred regular cheese as it just made them more soggy. They were pretty good and not a ridiculous portion where we couldn't finish them. After they came, service was fast and everything went smoothly.

eqVcnqXFSmrVacLaWV3slw.text: Stopped last night for some late dinner. We had a wonderful server named Joseph to went above and beyond to get us what we needed. He was kind and courteous as well as prompt.  The food choices we made were not our best but it was nothing they did, we just picked wrong.  The only reason for four stars is that we came at shift change and was not noticed until we went up and said something. Otherwise, it's a good spot for some grub.

pjXGRgAgWtt3-GOnDIMhIQ.text: The positive: my wife ordered chow mein and it tasted great, lotus wrap was a little small but was also good  the negative: there was cake or desert on the table and floor and I had to ask two different people before they cleaned it.   my tacos were lukewarm and meat tasted tough  service was slow.

r6zaRXsc0XH2rFr6x69UHA.text: Nick was very friendly and made an excellent recommendation for the beef chow fun. Additionally we got the braised tofu and this is one of the best things I've had. Would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a not-so-noisy yet still busy restaurant with excellent food, great service at a decent price.

l2ybQmIG6rTRFWgmyrYqKQ.text: Greater by a warm friendly hostess and seated right away. Servers were super efficient, welcoming and friendly. I would give the service 5 stars. The food came out very quickly which was awesome and while the food was good, it wasn't anything amazing or special. It suited our needs and filled our bellies. The price was fair and if the food was a little better, I would have given them 5 stars. Kudos to the staff though... They are awesome and totally impressed us.
