7ti208al7N_bGMcc3nxlJQ.text: I am a vegas local and I have been here many times from the grand opening when it was under a different name and menu to right now as I am writing this.  I think this place is great and figured I should let people know about it.    Everything I have had here has been great, my favorites are the nachos, quesadilla and ribeye steak.    Oh and how could I forget the house margarita!  It's awesome!  You would be hard pressed to find one as good for the price here in Vegas. (~7$)  Service is great, everything you want in service; fast friendly but not overbearing and I don't recall a time I was here when I didn't have one of the managers come up at some point and ask us how it was / help clear the table.    You can tell they are trying to do well.

kBFk2yoXsnduw6lyCpjnrw.text: Breakfast is a pleasure at this restaurant. Be sure to ask for Oliver as your server. Pleasant and remembers your preferences!

cpHArhyCscR8xlUSddJa_Q.text: Food was good, but the service less than stellar. Lots of people and not enough wait staff. So you might be waiting around for your food or waiting around to pay. They might forget you. Also, after paying my bill I was not given the correct change by the waiter. He gave me 75 cents less back, probably because he was busy. Maybe a trivial amount but it's about the principal of the situation. Money doesn't grow on trees. I would avoid, unless there is no other choice.

pVr5jrZ0J-_OjcD1j0tOOg.text: Visited Las Vegas at the end of March and we went to the place on our trip. Service was great and food tasted good but every time I ate anything from there I got very sick. This taking into account I did not eat anywhere else. I don't know if it's the way they handle there food or something I would recommend it if you have a strong stomach if you have weak stomach or any food allergies you may not any to venture here.

yqEox967jqli6DACRa6e0Q.text: This was completely unexpected from a LV cafe. The menu was straightforward, service was great (thanks Ismail!), and the food was wonderful. I had no line to wait in, at like 9 am on a Saturday, and was offered  a nice table. I had the pork carnitas hash, a side of bacon a glass of orange juice and delicious coffee made at the table in a French press.  For me, some sauteed onions and peppers would bring a nice dimension to the hash, but it was delicious as is.  Well done!

N3LCFYTdxa2nu-vbBlac-g.text: Ambience was vegas. Server was polite and efficient.  Three mediocre plain pancakes with an cream scoop of margarine was 15 dollars.  Menu is an abbreviated dennys menu but with  less effort put into it.

nvgegAPjEZpTDXQc5mEn-A.text: Best meal, we've had all week in Vegas. Comfortable atmosphere, Great menu selection!  Server Juan M. was very helpful & never rushed us. We'll definitely return next year... we're from Texas.

0bY78xTwqxH-2MiBOsw9sw.text: This place is okay. We went for dinner last night and we have eaten breakfast here before as well. The service is decent not the worst not the best. We tried their new Chinese menu. We were so excited to see they had dim sum. We tried almost all of them and were mostly disappointed. The Shrimp Har Gow and the sticky rice lotus wraps were good, the only ones we liked. We also had the pan fried dumplings and the shrimp pork sui mai and they were not good not a lot of flavor and the pork they used was not good it kind of grossed me out by the thick pieces and texture. The soy sauce chow mein was good, a large plate and when you add a bit more soy sauce it was even better. Overall I wouldn't come out of my way here.

poazFSVhb2xRtsGlizzfNQ.text: Great food and great service. The manager came and greeted us. Great location too. The orange is to die for. Will definitely go again once I come back to Vegas.

YpQmv_ZBJup7aOrO1xkTng.text: I had an amazing time here. Lola was our server. I had dim sum, grilled cheese and tomato soup. Our service was delightful. We will be returning soon.

LXWaJIvUe1RkpUOdqCAJ-A.text: This place needs some lessons from old school Vegas in how to take care of customers.  High prices, poor service and so loud it was hard to hold a conversation. $16.00 for 2 eggs, 2 bacon, potatoes!!! Had to ask for coffee cream, and spread for the toast, asked for a pancake on side, "oh no we don't do that".  Maybe this is the new school way???  Oh no, we don't go back either!!!!

OsKe0hd5ONzai5XnDJ8Q9Q.text: Food was great! Our server Richard was awesome helped us out choosing what we really wanted and was on top of everything definitely coming back

vzSHqpM-zTjzrlg-6BN8PQ.text: I was here a couple of days ago and a young girl I believe her Is Wendy was our server, she took great great care of us. She was very friendly and knew what she was doing I will most definitely return and recommend this place.

N7gglvVSDjo3bSSwH8_GUw.text: Northside cafe at in SLS has a wide variety  of food which is excellent.The service we received by Richard was exceptional.

zomSyCWqKOBWsgmsiKkr9A.text: I stayed at the SLS for 13 days for work. When you do in-room dining, this is where you order your food from.  I ordered the Northside burger with NO bacon, the girl on the phone even repeated this back to me. The food arrives and the first thing I notice when I open the door, the hallway smells like medical supplies, it was pretty disgusting, but house-keeping is near by so I assumed that's what it was. I soon realize the smell is coming from the BAG they just delivered me! It was SICK! Completely unappetizing. If I didn't finish working 12 hours on my feet I would have stopped right there, but I'm starving so I quickly get the contents out of the bag and get it as far away from me as possible. I take a bite, and guess what, there is bacon. It was extremely disappointing for them to mess up my order like this, so I call back to inform them. The girl on the phone says they can either bring up a new one, or take it off my bill. At this point, I rather just go somewhere else and throw this in the trash, so I tell them to take it off my bill, she says okay she will get the manager so they can remove the room charge. Two days later when I go to checkout, surprise they DID NOT remove the charge as I was told!!!!!!! The front desk was useless to help me and I had to fill out a form to "dispute the charge." Why should I have to "dispute" anything when it's what I was promised?  Completely unforgivable lack of communication and professionalism in their operation, it is embarrassing.  DO NOT ORDER IN-ROOM DINING WHILE STAYING AT THE SLS HOTEL! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

pmqbui2Qzl4vFX9uKlJ6TQ.text: Great food great service. Joseph was our waiter he rushed some egg Rolls out to us right away due to my wife's hunger. Hard to come across great service anymore but Joseph was awesome! After our egg Rolls Joseph recommend the noodles and they were piping hot and delicious. He checked on out table if we needed anything else and refilled our drinks without asking. It's our first time to the sls and I highly recommend. Steve was the other waiter he was great also. Adding to my review: Just had breakfast. It was great! U can tell they use quality ingredients. The omelette was nice and fluffy. The coffee and blood Mary was awesome. The waiters at the counter Ben and Roberto provided great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The blood Mary was great. I had to take a sip before I took pic

BMwxE6Nk18rUOLC-EAKJ6g.text: Came to this place specifically for the gluten free options. Was a little disappointed by the gf buttermilk pancakes. Super undercooked & the service wasn't great. The rest of the food was decent. $3.95 for a cup of reg coffee was a little steep for me.

btGa0a2ZDYTq5yepJvKTXg.text: SLS sent us a voucher for 2 complimentary entrees, dine in only. It's completely free? Sure, why not? We got nothing to lose. So my boyfriend and I had dinner here on a Monday night.  My boyfriend ordered the Chicken Milanese-lightly breaded & pan friend chicken breast with garlic toasted kale. He said the chicken was way too thick....and dried. He enjoyed his kale so much better.  I was in the mood for pasta so I ordered the Whole Wheat Penne Primavera-zucchini, onions, roasted tomatoes, broccolini and roasted garlic. I requested to add grill chicken to it but they forgot. -__- oh well. This pasta had absolutely NO TASTE. Without sprinkling a bunch of black peppers and red pepper flakes, I probably wouldn't eat more than 5 bites. Heck, the roasted tomatoes and my garlic bread tasted better than the entire entree!!!!!!!  When you enjoy your sides more than your main entree, there's a problem here.  Also, my boyfriend wanted to order house wines and they didn't even have the main ones available....like chardonnays, merlot, pinot, etc. He wasn't too pleased with that.  Disappointing restaurant. Never tried The Griddle Cafe when it was still here but I'm sure their food tasted better than THIS.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Milanese with a side of kale.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole wheat penne pasta-horrible. Absolutely tasteless.

O9yJpTO8n1pmHWtpDzLGmg.text: I ordered the nachos. I don't eat red meat so I had chicken. The chips were fresh and the chicken was full of flavor. It was a huge portion. Came with guacamole and sour cream. Very tasty. Our sever Joseph was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. Our food came out quick and it was hot. Great service.. Will Come back again.. Thank you Joseph for your excellent customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-kLmRVDWDrn3zKqYhE_UTQ.text: Best late night spot on the strip ! First, you dont have to pay for parking to get here. 2nd , they have a locals menu which is a fraction of the regular menu. 3rd, best burger I've ever had in town w/ the delicious fries to complement.  4th, the chicken tenders are full of flavor, big and crunchy.  5th very quick and great service.  Try it, they wont disappoint

gDW93wOZjmGKmJPxI0X_Cw.text: I stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner and I asked to be seated at the counter.  The person at reception told me to take any seat.  And so I did--right in the center of the U looking straight into the kitchen.  I ordered the pork carnitas torta.  This is a large sandwich and plan to cut it and eat it in pieces.  If you attempt to pick it up and eat it like a hamburger, you'd better have big hands and a big mouth to match.  It is filled with goodness.  With the carnitas are cotija cheese, jalapeno crema, charro beans, onion, lettuce, tomato, and avocado.  With the sandwich I got fries.  You have a choice of regular fries, sweet potato fries, or fresh fruit.  The sandwich was on a large hamburger style bun, not the oval shaped torta I had expected but that's a minor critique.  It was tasty and messy eating and good eating.  Service was very good.  As soon as I sat down, a server was there to take a drink order and someone arrived with a menu and asked for a drink order.  Eddie was my main server and he was efficient and friendly.  Northside Cafe's a good place to stop for lunch and I'll have to stop by for dinner some evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Condiments on the counter.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork carnitas torta.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the signs hanging from above.

sjsgK6LaUXdQVieLsP3NHw.text: Great experience! Good customer service, loved the food Oliver was amazing. Thank you Northside!

cxz2Gqb3eqtZoepa_wikyw.text: Not crazy about this place.  The service was slow starting and just not very welcoming.  The menu is just weird.  Does this want to be a Chinese, Mexican, Italian, American?  Almost random selections of food.  I opted for the Chinese ... The eggplant vegetable dish had a decent sauce.  You would think they'd include rice and chopsticks but nope.    It's on the strip and in the hotel so it's priced higher than anyone should pay.  If this was off strip and lower price ... And had a more streamlined selection and included rice with its Chinese dishes and chopsticks and well ... I'm sure I can think of lots of other things.  It would be much better.  With so many special places on the strip, you are better off going somewhere else (or even a chain if you want to be more price conscious)

dVgB_Kxp-O5hzZ3eVKXKJw.text: Had the wrong temperature on my steak and was told by the servers that the very little glimmer of pink on the meat makes it medium. I told them that's clearly a medium well to well done. Very disappointed with their response so I just told them to forget it and we'll just eat it. The steak & eggs was adequate, definitely not worth $23 + tax&tip. Long wait for the morning "rush" and was kinda forgotten by the server that sat us and took our drink orders.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is &#34;medium&#34;steak. very disappointed w/ the temperature &amp; when I told the servers, they firmly stated that I&#39;m wrong

-Bqt0eUK6mc37erF7i6YNg.text: This place got me sick with the raw pork...  And I saw it coming after discovering the wonton was undercooked Now I'm racing back to LA before "it" happens.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw pork... ate three of these... oh man...
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uncooked pork inside the wonton
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Northside cafe...no bueno...

gwNiX5YLg1MgPZVOXMpblQ.text: I went to this place twice during my stay at the SLS hotel, once for lunch and once for breakfast.    For lunch, I had the chicken taco and tomato soup.  I wasn't too impressed by either, they weren't bad, but not the best either. It felt very "machine" made.  I would give lunch two stars.  However, for breakfast, I had the protein fritatta, which came with egg whites, spinach, ham and some other stuff. This was filling and wonderful. In addition, they serve French press coffee, which was strong and flavorful.  So 4 stars for that.  So balance the two out, and you get 3 stars - in other words, it's okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french press coffee

_ALbOMMSxI0Vfpv3m2rISA.text: The food is good but service is TERRIBLE. Waiters have a bad attitude and make you feel like you're inconveniencing them by asking for simple things like water or utensils.  I came here 3x while staying at hotel and would rather walk anywhere vs giving them anymore of my money.

OF3w42-AlbNJYBZIxdkC7g.text: Been to Northside Cafe multiple times and I've been satisfied every single time! It is located inside of the SLS hotel in Las Vegas and since we stay at this hotel a few times a year, this restaurant has been our go to place for quality food. Besides the food, service is the best I've seen in a long time. The place feels really warm and cozy so after a long night this is the perfect place to wrap things up. The Chinese kitchen can use some work but the regular menu is great, especially the breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kung pao chicken with a side of steamed rice.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded potato omelette.

ZjTSnHNydZZEGOkLVIHxYA.text: There are certain people who make your day better and Oliver, a superb server, at the Northside Cafe is one of those people! From the moment he greeted us, it was clear that he was happy to be doing his job. Oliver made great drink and food recommendations and he took great care of us. My husband and I were married earlier that day and Oliver made this late night dinner very special! We wish him all the best.

yxU50bNw-J16Cf7QUjGELQ.text: Food was excellent and blew away all other 24 hour late night places imo. Especially with the locals menu/pricing the place is a steal and we will for sure be coming back. Our server was awesome but i could kinda see why there's a lot of complaints about the service of this place. Luckily we got a good fast server and the food easily surpassed our expectations... we'll be back

im17fwLC-j4x-I4p88ap0A.text: We stopped in Vegas for one night coming from the Grand Canyon and Antelope Canyon trip.  We have literally been eating fast food for the last few hours.  Our first sit down meal is here at N. Side Cafe.  My kiddos have severe food allergies so I was worried about ordering the food here.  The chef came out (his name was Alex), and graciously agreed to personally make an allergy free meal for them! He then  delivered it too! It was amazing! To top it off our server Juan was impeccable. His attention to detail and his desire to be accommodating went above and beyond. We were very pleased with our experience and would highly recommend.

V0ZDKhc5CLlr3wpEpvJzoA.text: Although it's no longer the Griddle Cafe, some of the items remain on the menu.   We were there for the weekend switch around, when it was Griddle on Friday but Northside on Monday.  We ordered the banana pancakes with add ons of walnut, caramel and streusel -- basically the Golden Ticket.  The flavor was the same but the pancakes were significantly smaller -- they no longer overflowed the plate.  This is a good thing as it was too large otherwise.   The price point was $2 less.  Our server was a bit brusque and confused.  Menu was much smaller -- now it just seems like a coffee shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pancakes with caramel , walnuts and streusel

k3Arm2FJrf4qCnDZZ6klcA.text: Hector Busser amazing worker!! On top of everything, very clean restaurant. I am very pleased to dine in tonight. Thank you management!

7nIawK6ZoQ9rg7HQUKNGKw.text: Even in the Gomorrah that is Vegas, sometimes you just want some comfort food.  Northside Cafe is the casual dining option at the SLS hotel designed to satisfy that craving.  Pretty broad menu - burgers to steaks to a Chinese DimSum menu that kicks-in in the late afternoon.  Serving sizes were hearty and the food was well prepared.  But it leans toward the expeinve side for what you get.  $15-$20 for a burger and fries, as an example, is hard to swallow just after you split aces at the nearby blackjack table and ended up losing both hands.

P-wDL6RXhy5j7Vh5-Rnzjw.text: Oliver is the best server!  He made excellent recommendations, made us laugh, suggested a sub shop in Jersey, and brought us coffee to go.  He made our trip

r7voll-IUwK90r6aRTJ5RQ.text: LOCAL MENU----ask them about it. Cuts the prices at least half of all the favorites on the menu. What once was $18.95 lowered to $10.95. INSANE!! All you need is an SLS Code Card and a Nevada ID. Nachos, northside burger and lemon drops were ordered which totaled to about $40, but would have been less if we weren't alcoholics. All in all worth the price for the local menu and will certainly try it again, if not for the taste, at least for the price.

cUeWqtmDvQKYGk8KWru34g.text: Welcome to Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen!  It's a Chinese restaurant by night, but early mornings, it's an American style cafe/diner with tasty breakfast options.  We stopped in on a couple of occasions and had good food and decent service....at Vegas prices of course. (Breakfast is served all day, e'ry day!)  They have a $25 breakfast buffet, but we chose to order from the menu on each visit.  The Chilaquiles Verdes is $16 and includes two fried eggs (cooked to your style), tortillas, chorizo, cotija cheese and pico de gallo.  It's a very large and filling portion, but a little different than the chilaquiles style I'm used to.  Instead of tortilla strips, it was served on tortilla CHIPS.  Nothing wrong with that, just a bit different and more difficult to eat with a knife and fork.  It was kind of like trying to eat nachos with a knife and fork.  There was too much chorizo in it for me, so it made it pretty salty.  Also, not enough of the verde hot sauce, or pico de gallo, and I wish it was made a little spicier than it was.  The Two Egg Breakfast ($16) is typical breakfast diner food.  Includes two eggs cooked as you like, with choice of bacon, pork, or chicken sausage. Also includes hashbrowns and toast.  No complaints with this order.  Grilled Cheese & Roasted Tomato Soup ($13) - the grilled cheese sandwich was of ordinary size, but included swiss, cheddar, and provolone cheese on grilled sourdough bread.  I'm not usually a fan of tomato soup, but hey, my receipt shows that it was around 4:30 am, so maybe my judgement was clouded, LOL.  Regardless of my hazy state, I was happy with what I can remember about my meal.  The tomato soup was very rich and creamy.  The Breakfast Burrito ($15) was a very decent size and was loaded down with a smorgasbord of offerings.  It was stuffed with scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, green chiles, sour cream, TASTY guacamole, salsa verde, and pico de gallo. As far as quantity goes, this is probably the best bang for the buck at this joint.  They have awesome orange juice and raspberry mimosas too.  The restaurant is very cold, so bring a blanket or a jacket!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese &amp; Roasted Tomato Soup ($13)
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Breakfast Burrito ($15)
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-sn7vrOmTnxlTM44fIaqgg.text: Welcome to your typical Las Vegas casino "cafe". Breakfast definitely was better than lunch. We had the chilaquiles and they were pretty good! Lots of sauce, good eggs, and chips didn't get too soggy.   We ventured into the "Chinese" cafe and it was extraordinarily average. Our chicken pan fried noodles were okay. This was hangover Chinese food and it did the job but... Panda Express is better. Noodles were super greasy and had huge chunks of unseasoned chicken. The Char Siu Steamed Pork Buns were actually pretty good, granted hard to screw up.   Overall, exactly what you'd expect. Wait was quick around 10:30 on a Saturday.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles

779TNGaQSnYuBKMZ1iR4_g.text: Was hesitant to come back to eat here after the bad experience we had at uno mas a few weeks back, but my husband insisted on coming here to gamble and we decided to come to Northside cafe, to my surprise everything was excellent, Juan Greeted us as soon as we walked through the entrance and quickly got us some drinks he recommended, he was very knowledgeable on the Chinese menu and helped us decide between the type of wok fried noodles we wanted. We were stuffed and ready to leave, but Juan insisted on trying the molten chocolate cake and thank god he sold us on that it was the perfect end to a meal. Overall Northside cafe is my go to restaurant for a hearty meal and friendly faces. Thank you Juan!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Molten chocolate cake.

2u5GMxgffMArrd4NONVrAA.text: Northside Cafe is kind of weird but not bad. In the morning it serves breakfast. When it's lunch it turns into a Chinese restaurant. Pretty strange of a transition but they do it. The cost is a little bit higher than it should be but not as much of a rip off as others.   In the Sahara there's many dining options. It's located just off the casino floor. This is on the southern end by the Mexican restaurant. It's a little hard to find. They put a sign out in front when they're open, which helps. Prices kind of suck here, but they do give you a good amount. They unfortunately charge extra for rice so for that they suck. A good thing is that they're always open. So far the only thing I've had is the tofu. It's $12 for a regular portion. This doesn't include any rice. It does taste pretty good. This isn't like other casino restaurants that charge a lot and you get shit.   It seems to be one of the better dining options if you're staying in the Sahara. If you're not you're still welcome to come. The breakfast menu is served all day if you would rather have that.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu

DoFVWoz7ECp0QVA1S33ukg.text: For the convenience, we came to this restaurant for breakfast since we are staying at this casino. Service was very poor, we need to wait for long time to place an order. Worst thing is I ordered Steak and Eggs, the meat is not fresh and rotted/smelly. I even had my friends tried it before we spoke to server, the server keeps insisting their meat is fresh and delivered every time. She said it was because of the meat was marinated, that's why it tastes like this. My friends and I are good enough to differentiate the rotten meat. Who gonna marinated to smell and taste rotted meat. It was definitely not seasoning. The server have her manager came talk to us, the manager asked if we want the new one or something else. I decided not to order anything else. We also found a hair on Waffle plate, everyone feels like to throw up after. We will not go back to this restaurant.  #Not recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-pdNZDhuYF8EpG0wzbIDog.text: We went here on Mother's Day for a quick bite before heading to the airport. We got a table for 6 immediately. The menu is huge! We were overwhelmed by all the options, but the Chicken fried rice caught my eye. It was $10.95 and enough for a meal so I opted for that. It was DELISH. I literally cleaned my plate and could have easily had another. There were a lot of onions so keep that in mind lol.    The service was great. Waters refilled regularly, checked in on us, very patient with us. The restaurant was clean and aesthetically pleasing. It was pretty empty, but this casino/hotel is located a bit off the strip so that was expected.   Everyone at the table was happy with their selections. I would definitely go back to this place. Great place for a quick, tasty, affordable meal in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried rice
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried rice

GHwnsRlUpS7hzOaK3wzWbw.text: Came here around 2:00am on a weeknight. The place was actually busier than I expected and only one server was working. He was definitely overwhelmed (not his fault). Therefore service was super slow. Took a long time for us to be acknowledged and to order.   We ordered nachos to share and asked for jalapenos and guacamole on the side. That didn't happen as both items came on top. When you're drunk and hungry it's not worth complaining about but the requests were simple and we're not honored.   Maybe other menu items are better? Maybe coming at a decent hour of the day or night is better? Who knows.

v-rwOVx63Ev-cUC2xWEIoA.text: We had the udon noodle dish and the chicken fried rice and they were excellent! Better than most Asian restaurants in Chinatown ! Our waiter Joseph was awesome he was the only waiter working the night we came in he had eight tables and he had to bus dishes and did an excellent job and made sure that everybody was taken care of ! I highly recommend seeing him and the food was really good too

p4Os3zgBhwtY5ElVBJt79A.text: Really poor service and mediocre food at best.  Seat yourself, and then hope you can flag down a server - they seem to travel in packs from the server station to the kitchen and back again. There were tables all over the restaurant that hadn't been bussed for extended periods of time, so I have to imagine it was increasingly difficult for patrons coming in to find a spot anyway.  The food is nothing special. Had to retrieve my own flatware, napkins, and soy sauce. We were told the steamed dim sum takes 20 minutes, so we avoided ordering it - but the food we did select ended up taking just as long.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AP6pGjhXtvnJBIQGjkcUSA.text: I was surprised that my friend wanted to get a drink after dinner, since she usually sleeps early- it was past 2 am LOL. We decided to just grab a drink here since it was located in our hotel at SLS.   The bartender, Carlos, recommended the raspberry mojito, so she got that. I tried a sip of it and it was really sugary, like soda. Since she couldn't taste any of the alcohol, he added another shot for her and she was happy with that. I agreed that it did taste a lot better afterwards though.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry mojito

TdwY4vvGII19YeuJuGletg.text: Typical casino cafe with eclectic menu. I can concur  that service is slow. It may have been more of a kitchen issue in our case, not so much a server issue, but slow nonetheless.  I ordered their Ahi Poke Bowl which was indicated on their menu as a "favorite". $18 and the rice wasn't seasoned. Didn't complain because it helped me avoid carbs this meal, haha. The other ingredients were good and ample.

2Ed28Vvrbck3lrpwkfKaIQ.text: Have to update, the service here is soooo bad. The last 2 times we had the worst waiter. I only put up with this place because the food is good but i give up. The bad servuce has over shadowed the good food. Wont be coming back.

fPR-Y1ST8ShshpK7UDgdlQ.text: Amazing Chinese food , fast service , cool atmosphere! Awesome for 2am when you're drunk and gambled out . Wish they delivered to the resort rooms though.

S-oawDFIt6dt-JnDSWXwZw.text: Okay. Sorta basic.  How can we make a Chinese menu more ...what's the word.. Common?  Maybe it's the diner look that makes everything more American flavored. There wasn't much that I liked. We were there to share plates amongst a group of seven guys. Food dragged. But from my experiences across many kinds of restaurants in Vegas, food often drags. We ordered some dim sum and tacos, all for sharing. Nothing stood out except the lack in timely service.   And to think, Chinatown was a mere ten minutes away.. I'll undoubtedly stay at the SLS again. Eating here? No thanks.

AMg4WW7mhMK2L1OOakBGkA.text: Naaaaaaaahhhh  Totally fail... No hostess to escort to your table seat your self .. No a big deal .. Slow service.. No even a welcome or hi ...from the order taker Just "what are you having " Now the food part  Price double than panda or any fast food food asian eatery...with less quality.  Sup came after dinner appetizers with dinner drinks never refilled plates never remove after we done sharing utensils never provide or plates  Or just a quick check to see if the food was ok... I even stock a the plates for easy pick up and the only answer I don't pick the plates went I'm to busy..REALLY DUDE!!! the only thing he ask more than once if we are ready to pay... Like a little kid  "Are we there yet".....  Does any one really return to this place.... Not us

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I don&#39;t pick plates up went I&#39;m busy  Respond from the server

XKCkkLT8kBbSwYegYdSu4A.text: First and foremost I want to say that the service at this place is consistent!   For this Vegas trip I stayed at the SLS and being that it was a bit far from the strip, we had to work with what we had. Northside is on the first floor of the SLS. We went in not expecting so much but the menu was LENGTHY! Burgers, Sandwiches, Fried Rice, Pho...What?   The menu was really diverse! the first time I came here I went with the Pho which was a bit too greasy for my taste but on a freezing January evening in Vegas, this definitely hit the spot! Oliver, the waiter that evening was so helpful and welcoming! He helped me make a decision on my meal that evening and he also knew how to describe a lot of the menu items precisely!   Next morning, we were starving so off to Northside we went. Let me tell you, this was one of the best yogurt parfaits I've had! The yogurt was creamy and smooth and not too sour being that it was greek.  I wasn't so hungry so I got the oatmeal with a side of potatoes and turkey sausage...delicious. Our server that morning was great but unfortunately, I forgot his name! He was very accommodating to my order. They brought my sides before the oatmeal and he made sure I had warm potatoes and sausage so he got me a fresh plate of those.   If I ever venture off the strip or stay at the SLS again, I definitely won't mind coming here throughout my trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and Potatoes
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oatmeal
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yogurt Parfait

Vz_MnsWyhRa4tRonmi4A-w.text: Found a hair in my whole pig omelette. Ruined my appetite. Told manager she just took place an said she would tell the chef. Didn't receive apology.

U-faDDaIguBehbnjYfFxBQ.text: Ate here twice this past weekend: 1) I grabbed some pan-fried dumplings and a kale salad to take up to my room right after check-in.  The dumplings weren't numerous, but they were a great size, and very tasty.  Meaty and flavorful!  Some of the more traditional dim sum condiments would have been nice, but I didn't ask.  I was sleepy.  2) The next morning, I ate there with friends before we got our day started.  This time, the restaurant was packed, so service was slow.  Northside is clearly THE main casual full-service restaurant at SLS, and they delivered a solid breakfast.  The bacon was fantastic.  The coolest thing about this place is that in addition to the fairly diverse menu, it has a really nice selection of Chinese dishes.  From what I experienced, they did everything well.  It's unfortunately dark inside, which I don't like during breakfast/lunch hours, but an affordable go-to in SLS that you won't regret.

QTEszSREd6EYjRHNB81Ksw.text: My son and I came here for a late dinner as we checked in to our hotel at 1am.  The service was kind of slow, but that was ok because I wasn't in a hurry.  I was just really tired.  Another thing, some of the menu items were on the pricey side.  I ordered a latte, chow fun with gravy and honey walnut shrimp.   The honey walnut shrimp was really good and the size of the shrimp was huge!  I really enjoyed that dish.  The chow fun was ok.  The noodles weren't fresh and were kind of hard.

d6VnZsihVLWA5Sh7Rc-6Lw.text: It's 9:24pm on a Saturday night, the restaurant is dead. The recommended Bloody Mary is tomato juice and a celery stick is completely devoid of flavor (evidently the bacon was the only highlight to this cocktail, sorry vegetarians!). The staff is aloof and the bartender spent minutes chatting with my server, rearranging the condiments on the wall, and finally decided to make my drink. My mahi fish taco was overdone. I think next time I'll go for fast food to match the caliber of the north side cafe. The waiter did remove my drink, eventually.

2KKjniUlFor5KwHV47beMg.text: Waited about 10 mins before anyone approached our table. Service was mostly detached once they arrived. Waitress just asked us what we wanted, seemed distracted. We had to ask very specific questions to get any answers. She would not help us with questions about drinks - instead, she referred us to the small drink menu at the back of the table which listed 6-7 specialty drinks only. We ordered water. Food was mostly cold (and it came out pretty fast, which was weird) and mostly bland. Jalepenos were possibly the hottest i've ever tasted, not in a good way. A second wait person took over saying our waitress was "overwhelmed."  Overall not a nightmare experience but well below what we would expect from a Strip hotel restaurant.  Getting the tab took 15 mins.

7fAfAM6GHFxjbcaAUzwSfg.text: Super delicious bloody Mary's!!!! The breakfast is yummy too! The service could be better though our waiter disappeared a lot

w0k7RckMP0DfnfJny0zKpw.text: This was a great cafe that we came in for brunch it had a good menu and we were in and out quickly anyone who wants a quick bite should come on by

0gZ0TlLH76KGGwr_4t9CQg.text: I liked the quality of food here. We had nachos and burgers and a warm chocolate chunk cookie at the end . Christian, who served us, suggested all the good stuff in their menu and he was right . Quality of service from Christian was great and thanks to him, we had great lunch experience in this restaurant

_pDjHJzeTqz6DFBSAB7ugQ.text: Can you say delicious! OK so we're are staying at the SLS Hotel and the travel company we used offers a free continental breakfast but we passed that up to come here...and it was so worth it! I ordered the bacon omelette add onions, it came with your choice of toast and breakfast potatoes. My friend ordered the protien scramble, it came with toast too. We shared the Hazelnut French toast and GAWD it was FANTASTIC!! It was the perfect amount of chocolate w/o being too sweet.. So good I would definitely order the same meal again. I'm a True foodie so trust you won't be disappointed

3msTLBcHrjdeW2P03hyAAA.text: This is a place to go when nothing else is open  servings are small so don't expect much I got the Adobe quesadilla they use the small taco tortillas for almost $11 this sucks this is my second time here first time was better this is not Bad it food is good if you can remember you had some gone fast...

7b_9VD5VfJbTBzx4zcCnNg.text: Food is okay but the really expensive. I guess that what it is for hotel restaurants. Pancakes are really good!

L1YsQSB_8wWXTGE4myLX8g.text: This place was great spot for breakfast. I don't really try the lunch menu there. Breakfast was great I was watching my diet and had egg white omelette almost every day but I sampled my husbands and my brothers food. We loved the eggs Benedict, and breakfast burrito. The Nutella French toast was the best thing I've ever had. That was my treat the last day and I'm glad I didn't get it on the first day because for sure I would have gained a few pounds eating that every day .

wnc311_UFphpH5NSl-D0Ig.text: Came here for breakfast! Food was awesome and pineapple margarita was super good too! I recommend coming here for breakfast! :)

zyObwtL7J9kFoEz4uuPoYA.text: I would come back here strictly for the COFFEE! If based soley on the food, It would probably only get 2 stars.   THE FOOD: I will start with the coffee. Freshly ground beans in a french press. When I started working full time, I started drinking coffee to get through the day. I didn't like it much but it kept me up... Then I started having REAL coffee... not folgers, and actually really enjoy the flavor. The coffee they make here is GREAT. They only serve french press and they offer 2 sizes. The regular is enough for 2 people (about 3 cups). I did not order the large but it seems like a pretty hefty amount. So, to eat i ordered a breakfast burrito, which i was somewhat disappointed with. It was large and filling but not very flavorful, and the guacomole, sourcream, and pico de gallo was on top of the burrito... I don't know about most people but I like my ingredients on the inside. The potatoes, which at least were inside, were too big. They might has well have wrapped a baked potato in a tortilla. Call me spoiled from Southern California, but It should not take multiple bites to finish one cube of potato in a breakfast burrito. I don't ask for a burger with the ketchup on top of the bun. My girlfriend ordered a Reuben which was definitely better. Go with that.  THE PRICE: A moderate price for Vegas. $14 for the breakfast burrito and $14 for the Reuben. The coffee was $5 which is pricey, but remember you get about 3 cups worth, so it isn't too bad.   THE VIBE: The Northside Cafe is located in the SLS hotel near the pool, with a pretty casual setting, tables, and bar seating. The staff i encountered was pretty friendly. It is open 24 hours and perfect for a hungover morning, a meal after a dip in the pool, or a late night snack coming back from the clubs.   OVERALL: The food isn't bad, but if you are a coffee person staying at the SLS Hotel and Casino or even at a nearby hotel trying to get a morning "pick me up", swing by the bar in the back of the Northside cafe and take a french press to go. You're day will go a lot smoother.

AjBRpKxfLucvp8MnXcIZbA.text: Good for kids (chicken tenders are a big serving...really a starter). Fettuccine was also really good. Right in the SLS and reasonably priced.

tU4X4BjokV6-jRVdaEwtRA.text: We went for breakfast.  Ordered the breakfast burrito.  Was by far the best I had ever had. Presentation,  mix of flavors and a generous proportion.  Very courteous waiter. Highly recommend.

Tih4HAIBdIWjHD8791eHAA.text: Worst service ever. Ordered my food - got the oatmeal. Never had milk brought out with it. When I finally got our the attention of our food runner, I asked him some milk for my oatmeal and he looked at me as if I was asking him to pour OJ in my bowl and rudely responded with a "yeah".  Waited another 10 minutes to finally flag our waiter but by then I just wanted to leave. My whole party had finished eating. Never again.

tNuGThI-oj-vwYQdfd-SHQ.text: The food is GOOD without a doubt but that's about it. We waited outside after talking to the hostess for about 15 minutes. We were seated only because we saw the restaurant was empty and went in to ask about seating again. After being seated, we waited for our server for another 10 minutes. Then our party of 6 was given 5 waters, coffee with no spoons, and overall inattentive service. If my party and I weren't so hungry, we would have left for sure. Again, the food was really good but the service was ridiculous. After everything was said and done, the bill came with an included 20% gratuity... So we were forced to tip for crappy service.

PD7zkKn4ux-MakDJboEmYw.text: Steamed buns were hard as rocks, tried to post a video but didn't work! Order wisely!

ETqEUNBor3KwTtuZNSBUQA.text: Since the hotel I was staying at didn't have any eateries open at 4 in the morning, I walked across the street to the SLS. I looked at the menu posted outside the restaurant and found something I could eat (I'm on a restricted diet). I walked in, was seated and then handed an abbreviated menu. The selection I wanted wasn't served until 6 am. I ordered a salad after inquiring about another menu item. The salad was decent and I waited for my bill. My bill came out to $16.11 and I gave the waiter a $20. He comes back with $3 change. Because I needed a couple of nickles for something I needed to do later, I asked him about my missing $0.89. He went off to go find change and tossed $0.85 in the bill folder on the table. I grabbed a couple nickles and left him a $3.79 tip even though the service was average at best. All the waiters didn't seem overly friendly to any of the 6 or 7 groups of patrons in the restaurant.  If I ever stay at the hotel I did, I will make sure I plan better for early morning food needs than go back to the Northside Cafe.  Note: 1 plus month post visit: emailed the manager after she sent me the form email reply. Never heard back from her but didn't expect it either.

qcKhcm-ybOyyjUTDalJCkg.text: Do not order the corn beef. Th portion is too small.  The French press coffee is quite good, and omelette better than expected.

5hB_Xl9U8i3ym_ZyDl2wrg.text: This morning we ate at the North Side Cafe at the SLS Hotel and Casino and it was fabulous. I ordered a strawberry waffle,  breakfast potatoes,  and scrambled eggs.  The waffle was fluffy yet crispy and was not soggy. My friends ordered chilaqiles Verde and they said it was delicious.  The servers were very friendly but I have to say we had to wait about 10 minutes before being seated. This is a restaurant we would definitely come back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs, potatoes, and bacon.

32Lewq8eSQPNrEB3CvrsPg.text: We have been eating here almost since they opened, We are usually get the Sirloin it is awesome! The steaks are always very good but that one is our favorite. From all the times we have eaten there we had one time with a problem, My husband ordered the Alfredo dish and the pasta was not done and it did not have a good taste at all, I even tried it cause he thought it was him just not liking it , he told our waiter and the waiter said no problem ordered what he wanted in place of it with no problem what so ever. The manager on duty even came over to make sure everything was better with the dinner he received after that. They were both very apologetic.  We have always had good service, one of our favorite waiters are no longer there but we have had a couple after that we really like. The place can get pretty busy at times especially at dinner time, but the wait is not usually that long.  We really like that they are open 24 hrs, some nights when your playing the machines time passes by so fast it is hard to find a place open.  We have tried a few of their desserts and they are very good too! Worth checking out when you want some good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another time ..so good!
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Filet Mignon. yummy!

bG1AMNpDbVN97_xLkQsR4Q.text: The Northside burger inside the SLS was AMAZING!!!  The service was great. My friend and I went our first night in Vegas I ordered the Northside burger then we went back the second day with our husbands and I ordered the same burger actually we all ordered it!!! Very tasty!

w6LnG-LmeeNDoJgri3qpgQ.text: We came here on a Sunday and there was a little bit of a line but it moved fast. We just so happened to dine here on National Margarita Day so we took advantage of free margaritas with our meal (they were delicious). Our server was pretty awesome- very attentive and outgoing. The food was quite good and we were all satisfied. Although we did not have the bloody marys, I am dying to try it next time because everyone's looked so good! This is one of the few times where I had almost all of the meals of my trip at the hotel I was staying at. Good selection SLS!

WrRv4Ee3wHzwrdXXuV-UZA.text: Wow, the food was amazing! Huge portions and delicious. I had the breakfast burrito and my husband had the huevos rancheros. Definitely didn't expect such a great meal. Super convenient as we stayed at the SLS hotel. Located close to the elevator. And very reasonably priced.

q11__no2-niFfKJ4PmYyZw.text: So we went to SLS for the first time (which was, in and of itself, a pretty cool place) and we went to Northside Cafe for breakfast and it was super good! The food came out super fast, the waitress was awesome (she started by putting on my boyfriend's sunglasses and cracking a joke) and the Bloody Marys are adorned with a whole stalk of celery and a huge slice of thick cut bacon... Which is never a bad thing. :)  I played it safe and got the two egg breakfast with perfectly cooked over easy eggs, pork sausage, and breakfast potatoes. However my friend got the chilequiles and it was huge spicy and awesome!   The best part is it was all pretty affordable and due simply to the fast and friendly service, ill definitely go back!

b7OPhzJv62hqmCvljZ-ykA.text: Joseph was a great server! He was attentive and genuinely cared about making sure we were taken care of. We'll be back again!

xlLsAYSdF_85ezxNO4C3Hg.text: I gave it two stars because the food was really good, a bit pricey but really good. The service, well let's just say we complained to the manager about it and he comped us the dinner. We never saw or server from the time out dinner was delivered until he asked about a coupon before running of to get the check. Never came back to check if the food was good or to check our drinks. Really shouldn't be so bad because there are a lot of people running around waiting on tables and its not that big a place.

8IWWMxbePr2Osg9YvVDm0g.text: Had lunch and 3 breakfasts here and found the service and food to be very good.  My lunch consisted of the kung pao chicken, which was full of flavor and veggies and spiced just right.  The only negative was that rice was not included so ordered it on the side.  Not surprised -- another way to force you to pay more for your meal.  Eggs Benedict was awesome, and the sauce was perfect, served with a side of roasted potatoes.  French toast was overpriced, $10 for 2 average bread slices of French toast, nothing else on the plate. However it did taste good.  They serve both American and Chinese food here and do it pretty well.  Prices on the high side, but yes, it is Vegas.  It is just inside the entrance to the SLS hotel and casino.

c187KARi92hwSb0jIAi25g.text: Great brunch!! Straightforward options, coffee & bloody - Joseph was great even had to go coffee at the end for us

EOG5anm2__W1IBDN-Z7ucA.text: Food: Philly cheesesteak with sweet potato fries. The food was not bad. The meat was nice and thin and the cheese was a nice velvety texture.  Guest services: Joseph was our server. He was very attentive to us and got our food and drinks out right away. He had eagle eyes and constantly refilled our cups and checked in on us. He was not over bearing or giving us pressure. Great service!!!  Ambiance: i like the whole diner feel to it. Just confusing how there is a Chinese menu with American food.

2bxPfVH4oRpt3STJPun6oQ.text: Great place to eat at SLS.  The food variety is good and very consistent.  Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner are all great.  I've never had a problem here.  And, the service from Joseph and Lola are outstanding.  Very friendly, and management should give them recognition.  Keep employees happy, and customers will reap the rewards from pleasant staff.    ALSO:  The Northside burger OUT RANKS burgers from Umami (main burger joint in SLS).  Don't get me wrong, Umami is good, but I'm sorry Umami, your fries do not measure up to the fries at Northside.  Same with your burgers.  Good, but not as good as the Northside burger.  If you order the Northside burger, I recommend choosing the burger, not chicken.

Gu2wLu4TRyVx2LkjB0bE-g.text: Incredible! Everything I've had here is DELICIOUS!Great service, too. Thanks, Joseph, for being an awesome server, too!

63M7KOpMIcc3P1EpGJtueA.text: Very good American restaurant that is fair prices. I had the nachos which were very good. It is a pretty busy restaurant so I would call before trying to just show up if you don't stay in the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R3PMkOoJTbVwL1E8MZQQ5Q.text: Grabbed a bite to eat before rushing off to a show and Joseph went above and beyond to provide amazing service. Food came quick and was delicious! Great restaurant if you're staying in or near the SLS!!

LvVh9sxiDOApZdnYEEP5UA.text: The food was delicious! Joseph was an awesome waiter. Perfect service and very pleasant! 5 stars or more...

f6C2HhCzekS8BoWpDqqx9A.text: This was a really nice place and  a good break from the insanity of The Strip.   I started with the roasted tomato soup, absolutely delicious! Basil and the garlic crouton really complemented my soup...  It open up my appetite to have a philly steak, the steak was on the perfect seasoned, cooked on the perfect medium rare just how i asked for, and wasnt  too heavy like other places i have tried...  Overall, thought the price for what we all got was good, and the ambiance was great! My waiter was Juan M, he was very polite and attentive through out our whole experience in Northside Cafe, even though he was busy with other things we really felt his whole attention to our table, I will defiantly come back and try something new now that I know that what i had was great delicious food! I highly recommend this place

R2zL8_K41jaOcmLgnSOBSg.text: We are staying at the SLS hotel, and had the privilege of dining at the Northside Cafe on a daily basis. The breakfast and Chinese food were delicious. All staff have been so accommodating and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Our servers Joseph & Jim were fun, helpful and outgoing. They gave us great recommendations on the wonderful menu. Stephanie was our hostess and always made sure we had a booth.

pWRv341CDkjhgu1C604UzA.text: Delicious. Excellent. The food was great. The waitress was even greater. There 24 hours. I'm definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QgZ66r-QLqfh5-2cQfXymw.text: Great selection, energy, music, convenience... DONT ORDER TOO MUCH FOOD she got an omelette & I got French toast- split it and save money and avoid wasting food.

p3WpbasaNTpa5-NP3tGpnQ.text: Our waitress Maria was super sweet and nice.  But if it weren't for the two free meals I would have complained.  My friend got the surf and turf for 29.95 she said the flavor was on point but the portion size was ridiculous and the sweet potato fries were excellent.  I got the ribeye and it was full of fat and the garlic mashed potatoes were gummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf with regular fries
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with garlic mashed potatoes

PF9G6XaSoPNKFUBo7XHa0g.text: Wendy was great she took care of me and my gf she an excellent server highly recommend this place

B8yTHCjTYL7i_p3ipS6cSw.text: Big fan!!!    Love the SLS but this is a special review just for the chef's and staff of the Northside.    My contingent only stayed at SLS because a year ago we were trying the previous restaurant that was banging heads in the local culinary landscape at the Hash House a Gogo. We were disappointed when half way through 2015 we found out they had folded up their tent and the SLS has put in some "version" of a breakfast place.   YOU win! Ok, I'm not concerned that the cuttsie names and pancakes the size of a Donk wheel are gone, what we were all glad for, is that the food is delicious, unique "enough", fast and the staff is super friendly. Not one breakfast over our tradeshow was spent out of the hotel.   Thanks for making it great. Already booked rooms for tradeshows into 2017. Hopefully, it will still be breakfast then too... and the French Press, winner!!!

j3sxpIr_CziyWOHtuZ1sew.text: Omg this place is delicious! My boyfriend and I stayed at the SLS for about 6 days in June and once we tried it, we had to eat there every morning! Everything is so good! My personal favorite were the hazelnut (Nutella) French toast! Their French pressed coffee was great. We tried so many different things and were extremely happy! The chorizo burrito is great as well! The yogurt parfait was amazing too! The only thing that wasn't the best were the beans they used on the nachos. They called them "charro beans" and being Mexican you expect real charro beans. Instead they were literally chilly beans. But other than that great service as well. I just went back to Vegas mid July, I didn't stay at the SLS but we sure came here to eat!  Oh and if you're staying at the SLS the room service is the exact same menu with about $2 added to every item so just go down stairs and eat :)

fRDR5A0bLBGkg8ZNSkgWIA.text: The food was fantastic, the service was great, the atmosphere was nice, BUT the portions weren't worth the price. $15 for two slices of French toast, even in Vegas, is a bit ridiculous (even if the French toast was delicious).

oBWkcxKtHyWXasK7qhPrrw.text: Good food.. Awesome service... Joseph was amazing!! Very attentive and friendly.. It's nice to be be helped by someone who actually enjoys their job! Thanks for everything Joseph!!!

K_dcpggr_bM3RUAHQrlL_w.text: Joseph was a very accommodating server for us needy & buzzed casino goers. Food was as good as 24/7 joints get.

r2kBOjpGjRiSCExBcUoeCw.text: A nice surprise! Walking through SLSlooking for a burger place, we found this one. I ended up getting the beef noodle soup that was tasty. Food is presented well and pretty good! Prices reasonable.

-x_UeVrIxb8AjwniK6jW5A.text: Joseph was awesome! Very patient and on top of it. Our party was a demanding one and he handled it like a champ. Food was good. Service was better.

J3h1V1N4AV4YxIpydFxJsw.text: "SAVE YOUR MONEY" We would of been better off going to a run down casino in down town and ordering a $4.99 midnight steak and egg special. The food was horrible, we didn't eat it because it was so bad, the bill was $46. The service was just as bad no one seemed to show any knowledge of food or restaurant etiquette.

yxjwcirBzCcAobNofKqsOQ.text: as for 24 hour cafes in Vegas, this one does well at 2am.  Ordered the steak and eggs of course - (VEGAS MUST) and the meat was tender and a better grade of meat as for what NY Sirloin is.  Service can be a bit lacking - thus the one star deduction, so I think it would help if they hired one more waitress.   They also have an espresso machine, and the latte was made well.  Overall the food is good.

y7_1ZlTHv1sMVLgJLTOeQQ.text: One of the best brunch breakfast thus far on now the start of my 6th day in VEGAS. Service by Ishmal our server was fast friendly. The blue berry pancakes and huge side of sauce did not disappoint nor did the dark elixir brought to Table in a French press. While the corned beef was homemade as promised the dish was mostly diced potatoes. Hence the 4 star rating. Bloody Mary was great with maple bacon. Also lose the industry brown napkins.

XZ5CQF8lZwB5eIbKd2pYug.text: Food here is reasonable priced and the food taste great. During my stay I had the grill cheese and tomato soup, chicken tenders, buffalo wings, carnitas hash, and nachos.  I like that they add a spicy pepper on some of the dishes for looks and provide enough kick to get your taste buds watering from the heat.  Service is good and they are open 24 hours.

GFD0Wr65rUQ-IdjH1wY1PQ.text: Joseph is the best! Fun, friendly, and the best. He helped with beer choices and menu items. He is enthusiastic and eager to please. The food is good, service great, and the atmosphere is welcoming.

-RPKpXS2c8kHBB_o8Hnh6Q.text: Joseph our waiter was amazing. He was really nice and explain d the menu very well. Very satisfied with the service here. Joseph made us feel at home.

YDmafmkDo7my22G4941r-g.text: Service...5 Star!! Food...5 Star!! My waiter...I believe his name was (Joseph) did an awesome job...he made our group fill welcomed & he service level was top notch!!! I will always eat here!

_SDAqTeGw0UXCUCby_m7dQ.text: Nachos were great! Large portion, good flavor, and definitely worth it. Also Joseph was an awesome server! Handled my allergy like a champ. I'll be back!

dRBwLgcb8lyQCIV2ZXtZPQ.text: I've eaten here several times. Since the second time I couldn't wait to get back here. The waffles had me hooked!  They are on the light and crispy side so I put them away fast. I ordered another right away to have my fill.  Can't wait to go back...again and again...  Btw, cocktails are good quality here and start at 8 bucks which is what you would pay for well drinks on the main strip. Enjoy!

LpARQEVlq0GluvTJq0bKUw.text: Food was great and our server Joseph was  awesome. Our party made many demanding requests like -subtitle this for that, heat our croissant, no oil or butter on omelette, etc. Joseph handled it like a pro and took good care of us.  Highly recommended.

LC7W92wGswiRjk1wSnWrzg.text: I stayed at the SLS and this was one of our go to spots while we were in Vegas. I ordered the grilled cheese with roasted tomato soup. AMAZING! No complaints the only reason I knocked down a star is because the service wasn't that great and the waiter takes a bit long to check up.

o-DSUSFGs_Gy5My8enDhGA.text: The service for this place is horrible. The cafe is not busy, and yet it is taking them more than 30 minutes to get our food out. One of the dishes ordered was a chicken noodle soup... How much work does it take to provide a chicken noodle soup? The food is average and the food is pricy. Never coming here again. Stay away fellow yelpers.

PAx4zQApVsllny5Iuf_wcA.text: Had a great dinner after a long day at work great food try the Nacho's and the North side Burger out of this world Joe the manager was so friendly and our server  Dominic was amazing

yKHb7sENywwYHSwLNw4vDg.text: Great food! Our server, Tony, he was really nice and accommodating. The Croisant bread pudding was BOMB! Sooooo good.

qeUiqoj_7amPMrvcXeRQGA.text: Love the fact this place is open 24/7! The food was great! I had the breakfast burrito it was huge and delicious! We also ordered the breakfast tacos which were great as well. Can't wait to come back the next time we are visiting!

A3kmtig-wHwzTdSm9Ak3nw.text: This place was awesome I had the huevos rancheros and the most awesome bloody mary I definitely recommend you try it. Although I am biased I needed the drink. Service was great juan m recommend the dish I was feeling like Mexican and so I ended up with huevos rancheros but they were better than traditional. If you are staying in SLS totally recommend it. Thanks for the hospitality.

0pjQvli4LIUsCAc-dFIy1A.text: Food was good....a little on the pricey side. My 2 Nutella French Toast were $15. I think the staff were a little short handed. I finished my water and was dying of thirst after eating Nutella, but didn't get a refill until I we were done.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cDmVyckqYOB1DzdAApB8xg.text: I came in to breakfast this morning at north side cafe I had the chilaqiles verdes first off those are a 5 star in them self a definitive must  try not only is the food great but the service was even better my server Juan M took great care of me and my wife and said the chilaqiles are a must try and I must say he was definitely right he went more than above and beyond made my experience a great one to remember I definitely recommend north side cafe to anyone and everyone in town. Make sure you ask to be seated in Juan's section I'm sure he'll take care of you like he did with me and my wife.

a_AG36jta3L1h9J6BJSuiw.text: I came here because I was looking for breakfast places on Yelp for me and my boyfriend and this place seemed so good so we came, and I regretted it so much! The food is really good I'm not going to lie, I had the chocolate French toast and egg breakfast. But let me tell you why I'm NEVER going back! First of all, the service was terrible!! When we first got here, we waited 20 MINUTES and no one acknowledged us, asked us for water, NOTHING! We just sat there trying to get servers attention looking stupid. And it was not busy AT ALL let me tell you, but all the servers were sitting around watching the basketball game not doing anything so we got up and walked out. We ended up going back though because my boyfriend had work in about 1 1/2 hour and we really wanted to have breakfast. So we go to the manager and he gets us a seat again, THEN FINALLY a server comes to us. First of all, there was never a drink menu given to us. I still don't even know what they have to drink there. I tried asking my server bout coffees bc I wanted one but he was just very short and gave me one coffee option. So I said sure I'll take two (trying to be positive and make the best of the situation). So anyways I'm still asking about drinks and he interrupts me and just says "Do you want to get your foo order in?" So I'm like fine and we order. MIND YOU I DONT EVEN KNOW WHAT THIS SERVERS NAME IS! My server never introduced himself, nothing. He did bring us water though. So he brings our food and that was it. We never saw our server again. Didn't ask how we were, he refilled our water once and that's it. So we ate and enjoyed each other's company, then he took another 20 minutes to get us our bill. Honestly $50 for bs. It was shitty service and I never got my damn coffee either! I give two stars bc the food was good but not worth the money nor the service. I would NEVER EVER go back to this place.

yC5u9vtFUzs_PHyt4EKgnA.text: Checking out the SLS Hotel Resort for the first time, we picked the Northside Cafe because of the simple but expansive menu. The service was impeccable,  the food was tasty and perfectly prepared. A bit noisy but with a cool and casual vibe.  they have a small dinner menu and a three-course dinner offered as well, but we were in at about 1:30pm, and breakfast is offered until 5 pm. the coffee was rich and hot!  Well worth a try.

AjQtk0xTS6pVE1hFOWYv6A.text: This is basically a diner that adds some Chinese options at dinner time. I was kind of shocked that the Chinese food doesn't come with rice. Really, I have to pay extra for rice?   The best thing it has going for it is that it's open more frequently than the other eating options at SLS. It gets very crowded at breakfast and the staff just can't keep up.  Its hard to find anything vegan on the menu, so I had the roasted veggie wrap. The first time I had it, it was good, but the second time it was swimming in oil.   It will do when you don't want to leave the hotel, but I certainly wouldn'd go out of my way to eat there.

L2mhMM2-RMzKEkRppk5hmA.text: My wife and I had the huevos rancheros and the chilaquiles. Excellent flavors and huge portions! Our server Joseph was very attentive, friendly and even helped us with some local shopping  info.

EJA0jwsp14nzcbK9ddiAtA.text: Horrendous service.   Had to seek the waiter out on multiple occasions.   Forgot orders and would come back after ten minutes for a reminder.   Then had the audacity to add in a TWENTY PERCENT gratuity. Just a terrible experience.

DnlbhQ3D6Ev0sDXSJtQRbQ.text: My gf and I ate here for breakfast and dinner. All I can say is our dinner server JOSEPH is amazeball! He was courteous, friendly, and attentive! Thank you for amazing food (prime rib with house Cabernet), and an amazing night celebrating my birthday! Woo hoo!

2AcJ9yrFiCzAm-a85ZcKGg.text: My go to favorite spot for hungover breakfast and late nite munchies at SLS. Waiter Christian gave phenomenal service catering to our many specific requests of on the side this and that and extra sauce and to go water cups. As picky eaters as we were he gave stellar service and the food was delish as usual. Only qualm I have is that the menu changed and they got rid of the top selling egg scramble with spicy sauce and tuna sandwich and other favorites!! So mad at ownership for that but hope they will read this and bring it back.

5FhjGqPuVbflG0j2yi_0Uw.text: Food was just alright. I'd compare it to Denny's but pricier. With that being said, I should have just gone to Denny's. Had to send my first dish back, the waitress assured me that the cook wouldn't spit in my food though so that was a plus, right?

NdYbza9PgG7ZvnpjSJ9CMg.text: Been here 3 times on this trip...not many choices for food at this hotel. The pros: good pancakes, friendly staff, sandwich had lots of meat with good quality ingredients.the cons: very slow, expensive, few choices, no substitutions allowed for anything even when you have food allergies. But it is the only breakfast choice in hotel except the coffee shop that has basically coffee and pastries.

UvlViKmwDy1b8GJ--AmhNg.text: The food here is delicious!!! The blueberry pancakes are packed full of blueberries and the strawberry waffle was crispy but light and smothered with a ton of strawberries. Wisler was our server and was polite, friendly and responsive. I would definitely come here again and I hope you do too.

TAbtfnhN0HnjQi9yQesTcA.text: Three strikes and you're out.  Opportunity #1: Eggs Benedict for Breakfast was very underwhelming.  Opportunity #2: Take away Turkey Club Sandwich around the lunch hour...did not impress, bland.  Opportunity #3: Late night group meal, combo of breakfast & dinner items. Brought out Buttermilk Pancakes when Blueberry Pancakes were ordered. Speaking of the Blueberry Pancakes, the menu noted inclusion of Blueberry Whipped Cream which ultimately ended up being a large dollop of whipped cream with a handful of blueberries sprinkled on top. Really? Standard eggs, bacon, toast order had the most issues which resulted in sending back the order completely and guest having to share food with others at the table. Eggs & bacon arrived first and 10 minutes later the toast finally arrived only to be warmed bread. The response for reason why toast didn't arrive with the rest of the meal was "it's made on a conveyor belt".  Take two with the toast attempt was the exact same result which by then the eggs and bacon are cold so entire meal was sent back. While the order was removed from the bill, we did receive mean eyes from the manager.  If you like pickles, this is the place to go. However, if you like anything else including service you may want to pass.  Considering the attention to detail in and around the SLS Las Vegas, Northside Cafe did not rise to the occasion to continue the high standard of excellence.

LCk7Znl13-Hs14f1OepZQQ.text: Dined here a few days ago and the experience was great. As a server myself I am pretty picky on service. Our server was Juan Mayorga and he did not disappoint!  Very friendly, knowledgeable and on point! Thanks for making the experience excellent Juan!

hX0cH1lZP9--0xjQ-1Z48w.text: The service is horrible the only good thing about this place is a omelettes. Thank you excludes delicious but today's not so good I will give them one star for t pancakes. And by the way I still don't understand who was always server five with six different people were coming in giving me a bill and bringing her food all the different people. I would not come back here again.

uKYFYd0Vgw185cV7ixskwA.text: We waited over an hour for them to deliver our food & it was mediocre. Needed to ask multiple times for them to tend to our requests. Would not recommend

AE33FCMdARz6zucM3_Tp_g.text: I love this place. Whenever we stay at the W we eat here. The food is great with a large variety, we have always received exceptional service. The longest we have ever had to wait is 5 minutes. Great for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

kmu8NdGubZJQoBGZRjOHlg.text: My friends and I were so happy that this restaurant was in our hotel.  The avocado toast is simply delicious.  We also tried their late night menu.  I couldn't get enough of beef chow fun dry noodle.  Definitely a great place for homestyle food.

qsQOrfgMxfCS8BNDswxleA.text: Joseph was our waiter and he did a great job. He was attentive and friendly. He hustled to fill our drinks and get our food out. Our party had a great dinning experience and will come back because of great service.

YGWq9nXuqv4DLOIxlYHMAQ.text: Came here twice. Once for a quick to go bite at night, the other for breakfast and we sat in.  Dinner: Ordered the orange chicken-- you have to pay $2 separate for regular WHITE rice. I get that it's Vegas but talk about nickel and diming. Also ordered some dumplings and chicken tenders. The orange chicken was pretty legit, hot, flavorful and tasted good. 4/5 stars. The tenders were also good, no messing those up. The dumplings however, were absolutely terrible and inedible. They were pork and shrimp dumpling and smelled like rotten seafood. The smell penetrated the container and smelled horrendous, -2/5.   The service was questionable. I needed an extra silverware set, and asked for one. The guy at the counter let me know what he didn't have any more sets to give. I told him I was staying at the hotel and needed one. He says again, "I really don't have any more" mind you, I'm STARING at a cup filled with regular non-disposable silverware. I finally ask for the in house flatware and he grudgingly gives it to me. Next time, try to problem solve instead of telling a customer you don't have a necessary item to eat the food they just ordered.   Breakfast: this was a more change. We were promptly seated with a kind waitress and ordered. Got the whole hog omelette and  the breakfast burrito. Both came out hot and fresh, and tasted absolutely delicious. The serving sizes were plentiful, and the service was great. 5/5.

H-ZFGpCBAbTXFtedEenUDg.text: Don't order the Southwest Salad. That's the only comment I can think of for my experience.

mm7qpA4SQK_4QpvXWl1tDQ.text: It is advertised as "home style" food - a home with a terrible cook.  The chicken noodle soup is so salty to be inedible.  Salads poor. Fish burnt in tacos with cheese whiz on top. Noodles tough.  Fruit bowl is hard cubes of cantaloupe, etc.  French fries look, taste like previously frozen.  This is Vegas, there are too many good choices to settle for Northside.

EXB26SGRexnZb0qy5a48LQ.text: Really like this place and want to it all 5 stars but can't because of bad service we got a few times going there...but I have to say it's not all and maybe that's cuz they are open 24hrs. The first time I tried the eggs Benedict I loved it and not soo much the next few times I did...philly cheese steak is really good and the Nutella French toast is amazing! Overall really love coming here it's not loud super comfy and open all the time!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WjAcpM7d1Q9nHohZh53WTA.text: Typical breakfast an cafe food plus a bunch of Asian dishes. The food is good but nothing special. Rather large selection of items.

TDgqVpYdfrBXT-mY-LhojA.text: I would give this a zero if that were possible. This may be the most horrid meal, and dining environment I have had in two years, and I have eaten in third world countries! I was looking for good Chinese dim sum, like the picture outside the building. What we got was a highly confused menu- part Mexican, part Chinese; at least that's what the names of the food implied. What we actually got was oily yuck. If one has dry skin, then one visit here and that person will be sweating oil for days upon days. The Baja taco, the won tons, and the tortilla chips had all been fried together and equally, had no flavor. The cook forgot to drain the oil, but certainly remembered the salt. Hint: a little salt is good, a container makes the food inedible. Yet I paid. I paid the inefficient server because we hadn't sent it back. I tipped 10% for never having been asked anything about the meal, but being continuously provided copious amounts of weak ice tea. Don't eat here. Unless you wish to spend quality Vegas time in the nearest Restroom.

yQYIB4Iftn7gVjFUDc9-3w.text: BF was a fan of the pancakes when this spot was previously the Griddle Cafe- despite the name change and menu expansion, they kept some indulgent pancake options (though not the originals offered previously), downsized for normal human consumption. He really enjoyed the blueberry version; the blueberry whipped cream on top was a nice touch. I'm not into sugar for breakfast and couldn't stomach more than a few bites.  But nachos for breakfast? Now you're speaking my language! The Chilaquiles Verdes dish is basically nachos, but they throw on a couple of fried eggs so you can pretend to fit in with your breakfast-loving pals (they're all heathens). Saucy, spicy, and crunchy, it's a party in your mouth- and one I'd get again.  Service was pretty solid and I'm glad to see they still have the french press coffee. We'll keep coming back when they're featured in the Social Sundays program.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles verdes
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry pancakes with blueberry whipped cream

XU0JFzg36AuzoPQIRy9ynQ.text: Went here on Social Sunday which something that SLS features every sunday. Different restaurants take turns giving locals 50 percent off pretty much the entire menu. This alone is what attracted me to this establishment.  Yes, I know they used to be Griddle Cafe (which I am sorry for not doing a review even though I have visited twice already), so I had mixed expectations. Well, im here to tell you that the generous portions are no more. :(  My wifey ordered the Red Velvet Pancakes ($12.95) with a Latte ($3.75) and I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak ($14.95).  Like before, I have ordered the Golden Ticket when it was GC. It was 3 huge pancakes about 12 inches in diameter. (That's what SHE said). For these guys, it was more like 6 inches. Basically, same price but half the size. The Red Velvet pancakes themselves were pretty good. Fluffy with some sweetness to it. Topped off with a cream cheese frosting and chocolate shavings. The latte was decent.  The Philly Cheesesteak was a pretty good size. Has thinly sliced strips of grilled sirloin mixed with grilled onions and melted provolone cheese. It came with a side so I chose sweet potato fries which were very good. Puts regular fries to shame.  Service was good. Kailena was our server and did not disappoint. Took our orders and brought our food out in a timely manner. Even refills on our waters were done without asking for it.  In closing, everything was on point. I only spent $17.10 because of the 50 percent discount plus 5 bucks tip. When I say on point I mean the price I paid was worth it. Under normal circumstances I would not come back to pay the marked up prices for what you get. The locals discount is what will bring me back because what you can get here is what you can probably get for half that at some other restaurants. It's good to be a local. Oh and they are open 24 hours.  Yelp 2015 review #20 518 overall
