Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly Cheesesteak with Sweet Potato Fries.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes.

wf4w0potb3MV0HLnDmbrBg.text: Amazing service from Joseph today! Highly recommend coming here if you're staying at the SLS

sOJ_ztqufhuPwpRZim7XZg.text: Given it's self-proclaimed reputation as the "foodie" hotel on the (northernmost reaches of the) Strip, the food options at SLS weren't that spectacular.  Aside from several chains, there were few really compelling options.  Thus, my friends and I ended up at Northside Cafe, which served somewhat affordable (~$10-$20) American fare in a casual environment.    The restaurant had an extensive breakfast menu that continued to be served through lunch, and had an array of lunch items ranging from tacos and wraps to burgers and sandwiches.  The staff was friendly, but didn't offer substantive answers regarding questions about their food.  Since I have food allergies, I would have liked the staff to actually take the initiative to ask the kitchen about ingredients if they weren't entirely sure about the contents of one of my selections.  Nevertheless, I was generally satisfied with what I ordered:  Barbacoa Tacos: Overall, I would highly recommend the barbacoa tacos.  After I had ordered, the waitress mentioned that this was one of their most popular items, and it was clear why.  The meat was delicious, tender, and juicy.  If you've had barbacoa at Chipotle, then I would say that this was much more flavorful.  On top of the barbacoa, were decent portions of salsa, guacamole, and cilantro.  The side dish featured charro beans, which had a mixture of cheese, meat, and beans.  I didn't sample this dish since I'm allergic to dairy products, but my friend who sampled it gave it the thumbs up.  The one drawback to this dish was the fact that you only received two tacos for $12-13.  While the tacos were filling, I would have felt more comfortable paying that price if I had received at least one more taco.  If you're staying at SLS and want something somewhat more affordable than some of the higher end fare, Northside Cafe definitely fits the bill.  But, keep in mind that the food is pretty typical of what you could find elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barbacoa tacos

YDR_aq-HFYQVgsC-GvLR5g.text: this is one of my favorite places to come and eat when I am in Las Vegas staying at the SLS Hotel my server Juan O is  very attentive, this place is a great place for a multitude of menu items and you can watch it being prepared fresh in front of you in the in the kitchen. Make sure that you try the breakfast quesadilla it is scrumptious

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D54WQttFSvg5sG47KTnmsQ.text: I enjoyed this place because it was open 24hrs. Had the fried rice it was so good I had to get it twice. Wasn't too salty and the shrimp and chicken was delicious. Staff were friendly and prompt.

RofByWLVrCRM5KClYZV-TA.text: Incredibly bad food. Surprising that a Starwood would put up with this low quality food.   I had a simple breakfast, eggs over easy, bacon and potatoes.   The eggs couldn't come out any harder and more well done. They took them back, but left the rest of the food in front of me for over 10 minutes to get cold.  Went back for another Kate night treat. Had the pork buns. They were like rocks. These should be soft and delicious. I know being from NY. When I complained, they looked at me like I was insane.   Starwood needs to manage the quality better in their hotels.

AfIX_fmpF_1EQN5h2US5cQ.text: Enjoyed a decent breakfast here on a Monday morning after the big fight weekend in Vegas. We were statying at SLS and I was given a $50 food & beverage credit so we decided to use it at Northside.   We waited about 5 mins to be seated as they literally have a velvet rope for the line to be seated. The hostess was nice and so was our server. She checked in on us often. The only misstep would be she forgot to bring us the strawberry jam and I had to remind her... I opted for the ham & eggs. It was a big slice of bone-in ham and I went with scrambled eggs. It comes with breakfast potatoes which would be better if they crisped them up a little bit. The ham was great and filling. Good smoky flavor and thick cut to satisfy the hungriest carnivore. The eggs were just ok. Needed salt & ketchup as usual. You also get a choice of toast and I went with sourdough. White bread is not an option. I got a side of bacon on the side and that was good.  Northside Cafe is a decent option for breakfast/lunch inside the SLS. It's a scaled down diner or family restaurant. It's too bad they didnt stay The Griddle because those pancakes were legendary... Service was good. Food was ok.

Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ham &amp; eggs
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french press

D3FKVvtPcJhE4eHwrwFbmA.text: Stayed at the SLS and went here twice bc this is basically the only lunchtime option and the SLS is so far from the strip.   It has a very broad menu that covers basic fare like sandwiches and salads and also a pretty fulsome Chinese food menu. I was in the mood for Chinese food both times so I tried the pork/shrimp shu mai, cashew chicken, kung pao chicken, mongolian beef, and moo shu pork.    Everything was pretty good.  I wouldn't mind coming back here again.

p2pT8MDBU0a_5eEwQExD2A.text: Our waiter David Garcia was great he was very nice and respectful and got everything we needed plus more, there need to be more waiters like him thank you

Us0xg3PqcBcm_qf7vMxbQQ.text: The three stars are for the food. The food is great. Y'know what's not so great? The service. My partner and I are (new) locals. We live across the street, so we've eaten here twice out of sheer convenience. The first time we came it was late at night and this place has a "seat yourself" setup. The servers here are just not very attentive. Do not eat here if you are ever in a hurry. Tonight we went in, and it's a Saturday night. There were about 10 tables. Took a bit of time for some waters, then a lady took our order. After that, she left for her shift so my partner and I entered the land of, "Who the f*ck does this table belong to?" Eventually, the food runner saw all our food hanging out under the heat lamps and brought it to us. My three course dinner became two courses at the same time, and I was so angry that I left without bothering to eat the third (not that it was ever delivered). My partner's appetizer and entree also came out all at once, despite our previously departed server initially asking if we wanted the app first. No one checked on us after that. We sat there so long we essentially became a part of the decor. I work in the service industry and I used to be a server myself -- I am REALLY bad at being rude but I am also really sensitive to poor service. This experience made me so angry. There were two other servers on duty and two bussers. It took two attempts, but my partner flagged down a busser for a water refill, after that I began a social experiment where I set a timer to see how long we went being straight up ignored by the rest of the staff, who repeatedly checked on the other tables around us. I guess my partner got tired of waiting because he flagged down a different busser for our check, explained we had been ignored for about an hour, and he went to get the manager on duty. Three employees looked super confused when he pulled up our check on their screen. The manager came to our table, his attitude seemed less than apologetic face to face, but he said he would comp us 25% of our check and gave me a ticket for a free dessert. The price ended up at an amount WAY less than what we actually ate, so I don't think they actually had a record of our meal? I'm not an entitled princess, so I left a 20% tip anyway. I don't want to go back, but my partner is into the idea of a free dessert at a later date so I guess we'll see who wins the next argument...

CR_yzEdr95zWkA2KKEJz2g.text: My burger was bland and the fries were stale.  My lady asked for hot sauce for her greasy food and was never given any... Was not impressed... I've had better food and service at fast food restaurants.

nsx63HanKPxf8BubUeY-eQ.text: The food is great like normal but service still stinks. Our server came to the table took our order and never returned to check on us, until after we spoke to the manager because we wanted our bill.

FRDGD55SKYu3vpUsn-zy9g.text: Good food. Great experience. Service is fast.  Great service from Christian. Will be back for sure

OOzbtWrUldDZAHsSu-XPTQ.text: Really can't go wrong, there is something for everyone breakfast lunch or dinner. Chinese food is incredible, try the dim sum selection ...also Ask for the secret locals menu!!  The service is fantastic and the ambiance is really comfortable. Will be back!

2KHin77bLMwcDHr8bSUU_A.text: I love this place for breakfast. They have such a tasty variety of everything. My favorite items are the breakfast items. I especially loved the bacon omelet!! I could eat the bacon omelet every day! 2 thumbs up!

GK2UDvqjk9pDepmUKJww3g.text: Best bloody Mary I've had in Vegas ... the carnitas hash needed more carnitas but a great meal none the less

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

93DO3nSu4AUWM-hO5rPj3w.text: Terrible experience!! We came on a Sunday afternoon around 1pm. It wasn't very busy, but being the only decent priced breakfast place, it was our only option since we were staying at SLS. A girl came and took our drink orders, that was fine. Then this guy server took over. It just went downhill. 3 of us got out orders in decent time but the other 3 didn't get our food for another 15 mins. We ordered 2 pots of coffee with 4 cups. They brought 3 and we had to ask 3 times to bring the 4th. Then, after all the food had arrived and we were eating, I realized my soup did not come. I asked the server when he finally walked by and he acted like he forgot, but it's coming. Another person at our table had soup and she got it early so obviously he forgot. Then, we got an entree delivered that we did not order. Ok...what was this server doing?? My friend ordered a wrap where you can pick a choice of sides: Fries, sweet potato fries, Etc. pretty standard. She choose sweet potato. Our server however thought she wanted a whole separate side of fries and ordered her a side of sweet potato and her wrap came with regular fries. Why would she want that??? Finally, after hunting him down for the bill, there were 3 things wrong!!! Omg! Banana pancakes, we did not order. 2 flatbreads (which we did order, but 1 did not ever arrive!), side of sweet potato fries ($5.95!) and an 20% added gratuity. Ohhh... so THATS why the service sucked!! I spoke with the manager about the many errors and she didn't really care because he brought back the bill and only took the sweet potato fries off and not the other 2 things that we didn't get. I would definitely go somewhere else next time. There were a lot of people working and the place was less than half full. Not sure why they kept dropping the ball but our server was terrible. He never apologized because we barely even saw him. Fail.

FKQ1_RYLkXutQd-Z21HL1w.text: Went for dinner. Had a great great experience. Nicole our waitress was amazing. looking forward to going back again. The food and drinks were really really good

OHXqPFY-KZ1_e9sEdxuI9Q.text: I'd recommend elsewhere for breakfast.  The meal was fine.  Blueberry gluten free pancakes were tasty, but for gluten free they were just so so.  The bacon and eggs were good, not spectacular but good.  Service was very good.  Ishmael our server was fantastic.  Just definitely not worth the price.  $16 for 2 pieces of bacon and 2 eggs on a mid-small plate that is just above average diner fare... $13 for 3 pancakes no sides?  They both better be worth it for that price, and instead all they did was make me miss 100 small town diners that do it twice as good at half the price.  That's why it's 2 stars.

taChXpVG2yX6ZDfapfSJtQ.text: Umm, I think we had breakfast here every single day. The food was GREAT. The service was amazing one day, and lousy the next (but the lousy day wasn't bad, as there was someone to pick up the slack). The food was amazing and I'd go back to Vegas just to eat here every single day. I'll be sure to stay at the SLS just so access to the Northside Cafe is an elevator ride away.

gAMg1yMAKt6RxlFiFsfbhg.text: This place is amazing. I ordered the caramelized banana pancakes and they were to die for. I highly recommend this restaurant.

5-mNCi9pxjx0SFPW9krulg.text: Soooo much better than The Griddle!! The menu is much easier to order from, and you're not constantly asking what is what.  I had the Reuben sandwich, which was amazing. So happy with the redo.

clAQz7Z1DdS_PDqOhnyGkw.text: Wife and I had breakfast here and enjoyed it. I had the two egg breakfast which is offered with bacon or choice of chicken or pork sausage and breakfast potatoes. The wheat toast was excellent. My wife had the protein frittatta made with egg whites, asparagus, turkey, onion and feta. She loved it. I thought the price was 10% or so to high but we will be back.

t-sa8omc7w81H2lgUQFf5g.text: When Christian offered to add salsa Verde and sour cream to my order, I knew we were in good place. Had a great time here.

p2lAIPjdXxoXifPWMP75jw.text: Had the surf n turf. Big, plump, juicy shrimp in yummy sauce. Perfectly cooked filet, perfectly seasoned and good garlic mash. Mom had pastrami sandwich with fruit. Fantastic bread. Delicious pastrami. Grilled perfectly.

W9ET4F0okg0aEftbuvm_Yg.text: Great!!! And delicious good quality food...employees are very helpful..have to visit this place at least 3 to 4 times being in vegas

2PwsdkAzjy7aqBe66oy5fQ.text: The experience through waiting, watching empty tables and then finally getting seated, only to be ignored by the server was too much. After 10 minutes of waiting for just acknowledgement, we left and went next door to Ku.

n8gZbM5nzpeKrOJa8GJWUQ.text: I typically stay at the SLS Hotel when I'm in Vegas. Northside cafe is my spot for late night eats. I love the atmosphere, food, and the staff. The place is just managed and run very well..and on top of that, the food is pretty darn tasty. I typically get the breakfast tacos, but today I changed it up and got the pancakes and bacon. Still stuffed. Got to give some props to the staff there, since I feel like they went out of their way to make my experience better. Vicki, the hostess. Nick, the bartender, and Jessica, the night manager, all gave me wonderful service. I will visit northside again during my next visit to SLS.

z54qVQfogOE5dLnVm8sLvg.text: Probably better than three stars in most key categories; location, selection and flavor but the service is not great, mostly because they are constantly understaffed. More importantly, the portions are really skimpy for the prices. A $13.00 Quesadilla is one small tortilla folded in half with a teaspoon of pico and guacamole. I couldn't believe they could serve it with a straight face, whatever, poor value is poor value. Cutting cost where it impacts quality is rarely a good business decision.

O9v42yZ621ZveVnBg4FVyg.text: Clean place, love it when I can see into the kitchen.  Caesar salad and beef tacos.  Very tasty food and really friendly staff. Good value for hotel restaurant.  Cheers!

9pgalkTecmmZTghtbY3Www.text: The food was good, I just didn't like our server. When we got there it just seemed he wasn't happy to be there at all and it showed. When my boyfriend would ask him a question it seemed that he was annoyed by it or us. We placed a drink order and it took about 15mins to get and he didn't bother to let's us know or even come take our order, he walked by our table numerous times and finally when the host came by to offer us coffee she ended up taking our order and pretty much took care of us. I wish I got her name because she stepped up and she was awesome. The food was good and my Bloody Mary was great! But the service we got from our server was AWFUL

oYgNugl3WELoasDybnJdCA.text: My husband and I make it a point to come dine at the Northside Cafe at the SLS every other week. Best nachos in town, hands down! The beef soup and the seared salmon are delicious! Joseph, who's been our server on numerous occasions, is exceptional! He is very attentive to his guests and you feel that he is genuine and sincere and most importantly, consistent! Even if we don't get him as our server, we watch him interact with his guests and you can tell that he likes what he does! Marco is 1st runner-up, he, too is friendly, upbeat and makes sure you're enjoying your meal!

FdbInwz8ugxvBo2fHXUYIw.text: Yes! Eat here! It was reasonably priced for Vegas. I had Chicken Alfredo Fettuccine and it was delicious! My sister had a Philly Steak Sandwich that was to die for! We both had a mixed drink (Bloody Mary-Very good!) Not your average bitter low quality drink.  It was not real busy at 10pm and our server was very delightful! Give it a try!

DIhbk96MxNxE5f3p5iWhNg.text: Love this cafe!  We were staying in the W Hotel during our stay in Vegas.  The Northside Cafe and Chinese Kitchen was located in the lobby are of the SLS.  So, it was a stone's throw from our hotel lobby.  We enjoyed 2 breakfasts and 1 lunch during our stay.  Everything was delicious.  I personally enjoyed the pancakes and LOX for breakfast.  We enjoyed fried rice one day for lunch that was equally delicious.  Food service was prompt.  My only complaint was the promptness of receiving the final bill.  The wait staff was so busy that we did have to wait awhile to check-out.  Otherwise, it was a great experience.

4R8ZX-XRcaOT50k1CRvGAw.text: We had a big group and the food was great and Joseph was an extraordinary waiter. The Fish Tacos are sooooo good.  You can't go wrong here.

PbRMGztIrvOUDKGuQ6khgQ.text: Don't eat here. There are better breakfast places in Vegas. The potatoes were undercooked and the bacon was soggy. The chilaquiles were made on top of chips, not tortillas which made the dish like nachos.   I'm only giving this place a 2 because our server was super nice.

yWyoLMJu6WxuOQXEGbGq3g.text: Place was well organized and neat, food was very flavorful plus Nick the bartender made me one of the best old fashioned, thumbs up!

Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. egg whites &amp; spinach and a side of grilled chicken....the meat was  cooked perfect and great flavor. Nick,  was very personable!

BS5IcQm7LZUQYOdNxEvm3g.text: Looking for a spot for a late night snack, I think this is one of the few good spots on the strip with few healthy options. They have a large selection including Chinese food. I usually order for pick up.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar section

_q3FmR521dBAG51fAaB_SQ.text: Food wasn't all that great. We had the Chinese menu. The food was fast and service was ok. The fried rice was pretty plain. The dim sum was nothing special. I guess it's good for late night drunk food.   Buzz eating should be okay here.

vw2HsoEpRme_J4HwtPvU1A.text: How is it that a notoriously cheap curmudgeon such as myself can give four stars to typically over-priced hotel coffee shop? Because it's pretty frickin' good, that's why!   I will state my objections and get them out of the way first: It is small, crowded, and noisy. Booths would fit four normal-sized adults (which describes no one in my family), and other than that, they have only tables for 2, so don't go with a crowd. A great deal of the noise is due to the fact that is seems to be perpetually busy in here, which I guess is a good sign, although it also means there's a line, which one normally only encounters at a buffet.  I also wasn't crazy about the decor - the ubiquitous brick and dark industrial gray that seems to be the signature color of hipsters everywhere, and the too-loud background music did nothing for me, but maybe this was the ambience they were going for.   But now that I have finished complaining that it's not Denny's, let me tell you the good part: it's not Denny's! The wait staff is very prompt, friendly, and noticeably young. I pointed this out to the Anaconda, and we agreed that it's a definite contrast to your usual Las Vegas coffee shop wait staff where at least a couple of the employees have been there since sage brush was growing in the parking lot.  But the best thing is, as it should be, the food. What a surpise! The Eggs Benedict  ($14) were great- perfectly cooked, runny yolks, smokey bacon (or ham, who cares?), nice tender potatoes, and a really great Hollandaise; rich and lemony and not from a mix. The Whole Hog omelette  ($14) was so good, the Anaconda wanted to get one again the next day, but I wouldn't let him because I wanted to try the caramelized banana pancakes, so he ordered those and I had steak and eggs. For $18, I was prepared to be picky since you can get a decent special for $4 around town, but this steak was tender and juicy and the bread was thick sliced and tasted homemade. It was even good when it got a little cold because I was busy battling the Anaconda over those pancakes.  Normally, I am not a fan, because I find them heavy and akin to trying to eat a blanket. These were more like pillows. Light and tender and airy and topped with caramelized bananas and optional crunchy streusel topping. Yum. And in case that's not sweet enough for you (it wasn't), the accompanying bottle of maple syrup will put it over the top. Wash it down with a shared pot of French pressed coffee, and the noisy crowd will disappear around in a euphoric haze.

suPtq7lo2FxHuhVeqb6GuA.text: Two stars only because the food was good. They charge a 20% gratuity on all checks. Maybe it was just our server ( gerardo ) was terrible. We were the only people there and it took almost an hour to get our food. Then all of the servers stood by the computer and ignored us the entire time. Food good, service bad.

cak7dn5L7kL-5NvnsXqLaA.text: My girlfriends and I went to northside cafe after touring northside of the strip we stopped in sls to check it out and we was so hungry but short on time . Our really cute server Juan M came over and got us seated right away , he had waters on the way while informing us about the menu and since he knew we were short on time he recommended food items that wouldn't take as long and said that he will even speak to the chef to inform them of the need for us to leave within the hour.  Our food came out quickly , he gave refills quickly without even being asked :) , so nice, friendly ,funny we will definitely come back to eat here again , everyone was great but JUAN M was amazeballs

5oauhCOtHgE6NraQL63CqA.text: Some of the best Chinese food I have had.  Our server Juan M did a fantastic job.  I Will definitely go out of my way to stop in again.

Zf2mNI-oe3eKcT8-aPtI9w.text: I have to say very disappointed with "service".  took us while to get our coffee. Ordered my eggs benedict the English muffin was hard as a rock and the hollandaise sauce tasted like it was spoiled.  I don't like writing these kind of reviews but seriously your paying money for the food whom some reviewer says it's good food.... If your a Server you need to leave the attitude at the door and pick it up on the way home because paying customers doesn't need to see it. just sayin...Maybe someday I'll come back hopefully to rewrite this review.

yeOxK5d0IDovevXGCwoLGA.text: Atmosphere was very pleasant. Our waiter was friendly and courteous, and the food was well-prepared, and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very pleasant atmosphere. Good food, and courteous personnel.

aIxlc1C4AXnpTp6KoDlPkQ.text: The food is AMAZING! But it's by FAR THE WORST SERVICE ever!  It takes about 8 minutes before the time you sit down to the time you get your water, that's regardless of whether they sit you in the AM with a hostess or you seat yourself at night. Then about 10-15 mins for someone to come and take your order.  They'll get the one star for the good food. But the services definitely takes away 4 stars.... I've tried this place 3 times now trying to give it another chance, but obviously this is systemic. If you're in a hurry or have things to do, DO NOT even think about this place.

Nlz5VITvI4659iqZtvB-Cw.text: First time here. I came here for Lunch on Valentine's Day. Service was exceptional. Let Christian take care of you. His service is what I expect from a 5 star restaurant. His timing and knowledge of the menu was on point. He has such charisma. The food was good. Better than I expected. The nachos were loaded with meat, cheese, sour cream and guacamole!! Enough to share with 3-4 ppl. I'll definitely be back.

vcfM1nLf-glKwOyhVpPO3A.text: We had an amazing experience here. Joe was our server. 11:00pm on a Friday night. He was super friendly, attentive, helpful with our special order. We would absolutely sit in his section again. The manager (working despite a torn achilles tendon!) was super helpful and friendly.   We had the Chinese Shiitake Mushrooms and Snow Peas with Tofu and the Breakfast Burrito. Both delicious! We would order both again. The Ice Tea was FRESH at 11pm! Delicious!  Great first experience! We WILL be back!

8MjKqDpXmkzPdK1g8tKBuw.text: Amazing Mexican breakfast! Joseph, was super attentive and awesome! We love the SLS! Definitely recommend this hotel and all it's amazing amenities!

PBdCNsWzwponfSNpje_QJQ.text: I had chance to dine at SLS Las Vegas popular restaurants such as KU Noodles and the 24hr Northside Cafe and I highly recommend for the top notch presentation to the detail of revised menu since the opening almost a year ago. The ambiance is casual and hip trendy approach with a great selection from comfort to Asian fusion delicious items. The wait staff were attentive and friendly which makes a big difference compared to other dining outlets in the strip. The cafe has one of the most helpful staff Cristian Santos in which made our dining experience daily a memorable one.

PxKT_YiM866kee3YG9vl8w.text: Service was top notch! Jim was engaging and offered great suggestions.  The food was generous and delicious! I am a local who doesn't care to eat on the Strip but this has to be a new go to breakfast spot for me!!

8XGfacwY9TqoKra_l0tdig.text: This IS the place to enjoy yummy food and great service 24/7! They serve healthy choices and really good "cheat day" food too. Ask to sit at the bar and then ask to be served by Luciano. Luciano knows good service and knows how to treat his guests. The Tuscan Burger was amazing! The atmosphere is casual but the service is top tier...definitely ask for Luciano and enjoy delicious food and good conversation!

9JcL4FhMP2jBvEZbqT5d_w.text: We went in for a party of 6 at 5:30am there was no wait and the hostess sat us right after a 10 min wait. Lola was our server and she served us two eggs and some French toast. French toast wasn't on the menu but jessica the manger agreed to make us the French toast. Our service was quick and on point! Great for a fight weekend!!! Congrats Northside Cafe!!!! Thank you!

LPwFhGSXI0dlo7LI2-KaJg.text: Server was sweet & our food was good. The price was too much for the food though. Our server gave us a $1 less change than she was supposed to but I have noticed that more than once in Vegas. We would have liked to see just a few items for children. There are zero.

I83A8FqqLmIsZvxGvGX9BA.text: This place hit the spot! Perfect for late night drinks and grub. The food was delicious and the drinks were spot on. I will definitely be back. 3 mins from parking. Late night staff and manager are worth the trip. Definitely recommend.

Lbz38f0emBVjzC-w_Mbz8A.text: food was on point. just like are server was with us. maria took care of us. will be back on my next trip . also here eyebrows where on fleek

zt75VMmzrszFlxIEmVmEFQ.text: horrible drinks...need to get rid of the bar staff right now. chilaquiles verdes came out cold their excuse was they out cold Pico de Gallo on top.  and if the staff want to talk shit about their customers at least go in the back where they can't hear you. one of the worst experience ever. being locals I'll be sure to spread the word about how terrible this place is. DO NOT GO HERE. YOU HAVE SO MANY OTHER OPTIONS!!!

Hzkw8kKrnzMm3rkx0EmXbQ.text: Let me tell ya! I would rather drive through a blizzard than eat here again. First off the menu that was handed to me had blood smeared on it....... Blood. The waitress acted as if it was ketchup....... disgusting. Being 2:30 am I decided to brush that off and order food anyhow. We got popcorn shrimp and the club. My fiance decided on a Cucumber Margarita which sounded delicious. The waitress returned 5 minutes later to tell us they ran out of cucumber....... I mean really? She then settled for a Strawberry Margarita. Ten minutes later our food arrived. The popcorn shrimp where falling apart on a bed of stale popcorn. Worth the price....... I don't think so. The club was ok to say the least. Twenty minutes later the Margarita arrived looking more like a Bloody Mary. One taste out of this beverage turned stomachs. Being a Bartender myself, I take pride in my drinks but this was something else. The over pour of spirit was terrible. The strawberry syrup that was used was very sad. Half down one side of the glass was a sugary substance that our waitresses hands where all over. Presentation was a zero and taste was in the negatives! Tasted like it came out of a warm slurpy machine in a Third World 7-11. Terrible! It was a sad example of why some Hotels aren't what they are cracked up to be. I would've like to talk to my waitress but she dropped the check and disappeared. I will never eat here again. The lack of respect for your customers especially the ones that live here is ridiculous.

DF6qTZG57YLS3GV4f6iFyw.text: I loved my dinner.  I ordered the New York Steak with French Fries and a Mixed Green Salad.  The NY Steak was outstanding.  Not one of those huge steaks that overwhelms you, but just the right size.  It was perfectly cooked, tender and very flavorful. Simple but excellent. The fries were freshly cooked and served hot. Very tasty. The mixed green salad was also great. A generous portion of spring mixed lettuce served with carrots, tomatoes, goat cheese crumbles and just the right amount of dressing -- a nice red wine vinaigrette.  For dessert, I had a piece of warm apple pie with vanilla ice cream. It seemed homemade and tasted like Grandma had just finished baking it.  The bill for all this and a beer was surprisingly reasonable -- under $45 -- and the service was great.  This is an attractive restaurant with the feel of an upscale diner within the new SLS Las Vegas Hotel.  The overall environment is outstanding.  I can't wait to go back to the Northside Cafe.  The menu had plenty of other appealing choices and I want to sample them all.

UNHvp6jgo2tyiOg0fPjIfw.text: I was so excited to find this place right in our hotel!  I read some review before we came down and I was worried about late night service, etc.  I'm SO glad we gave it a try anyways! The wings and nachos and Chinese we ordered was amazingg! The servers took amazing care of us. We probably had at least 3 guys check in and make sure we were taken care of! I definitely recommend. They will be one of the main reasons I return to Vegas and stay at the SLS!  And their pricing and 24 hour menu cannot be beat!

NXdrp5aLgtF3hPyJjV-t2g.text: Ask for Joe, from Jersey.  Super friendly, really funny, great service.   Surprisingly good food and a great deal on cocktails.   Also, having the option to get a breakfast burrito and spring rolls has never been presented to me before. Odd but awesome combination.   Great for a hungover brunch before the drive back to LA.

UmNNnwKogkvfy6y9pC_zfw.text: This place hit the spot right on!! The server was amazing, knowledgeable and prompt at 4:00 am.... what more can you ask for NADA  stop & eat here!! The food was good, not fast food... I had rice & chicken and a beer. Lol.. loved it. Such a nice change from your late nite diner eating after the club. We need places like this in NJ

OFx2xJTFgkZwiIZE_NV8GQ.text: The food was pretty good. My wife and I flew all day and wanted some food. We walked to the SLS and found Northside Cafe and decided to give it a try. There was a booth that was not cleaned and we stopped someone and asked if we could sit there. His response "If that guy there cleans it." Not a great first impression. We sat at a table and 5 minutes later the booth was cleaned and we moved over to it. We both ordered the Three Course Dinner (salad, fettuccine with chicken, and a sundae). We waited about 25 minutes and the waiter brought the salad and the entree without chicken. Wish they would have come separate and correctly. We asked for chicken and soon got it. We then asked for our deserts and the real wait happened, 20 minutes later we got our delicious ice cream. Look the food is amazing... the service leaves a lot to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WUyvbEzgW2bVAD3hI90iZw.text: Second pot of French Press coffee was really good, first was nothing special. Still, very nice to have a personal fresh pot for a 'diner'-ish style place. Early breakfast of steak & eggs, eggs done as an omelette with avocado, asparagus, and salsa (nice options, although I crafted it myself from ingredients I saw they had on other menu items). Steak was good as well.   Above my expectations for a "breakfast joint", would happily come back if convenient.  I appreciate the server and kitchen's flexibility on my order modifications.

BXxyJ99NhzCi2NppVHMWNg.text: We stopped in here for lunch, almost by accident. It ended up being a happy accident. Our original plan was to try KU Noodle, but they weren't open for lunch, so we looked  at the Northside Cafe Menu and decided to go with it.  Our Server, Wesley was there to greet us almost as soon as we sat down and was friendly and attentive throughout our meal. We started with The Shrimp Cocktail. A solid version of a Vegas classic. Six large, plump, sweet shrimp curled over a glass full of spicy cocktail sauce.  After  our earlier Vegas Taco Fiasco at Pink Taco, I had to try Northside's Baja Fish Taco's.  Spiced, Seared Mahi-Mahi, Pickled Slaw, Pico de Gallo, Cilantro and Sour Cream restored my faith in Vegas Taco possibilities. Flavorful and moist, I loved every bite! Diane had the Pork Carnitas Torta with Cotija Cheese, Charro Beans, Jalapeno Crema, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion and Avocado. She loved it so much I only got one little taste of the meat. What I had was rich and spicy.  Since this was a celebratory trip for us, we had several drinks. Diane's Spiked Lemonade was Sweet, Summery and packed quite a punch! After two she was feeling a little buzzed. I started with an excellent Peach Bellini and followed that up with my favorite drink of the trip. Unfortunately, I don't remember the name, but it was a play on a Mudslide.  Northside Cafe is rarity in Vegas. A high quality, enjoyable 24 hour Casino Diner. I can't wait to go back!

t6XlgNZzXw7ynoscYuGhBA.text: I would consider myself a cheerleader for the SLS.... I have been there several times, enjoy the facility and the staff... so i really wanted to like this place.   Experience yesterday did not enable me to unfortunately.   I came to redeem a food offer id received and went for what i had hoped to be a quick and smooth business lunch, which did not turn out to be the case.   First: fries came out cold - but i kept eating them because thats what i do... and i was mad at myself for it.   Second: I understand that not every place can cook a burger to order, but just don't ask how i want it if you're clearly not going to attempt to do it that way. I ordered mine medium rare and it came out put-it-on-the-grill-and-go-take-your-dog-for-a-walk-and-call-your-grandma well done.  Again, not a huge deal if that's what i'm expecting... but i can get something like that at mcy-ds.  Third: service was slow. Took about 10 minutes from getting the bill to leaving, and the place wasn't even crowded. This was particularly annoying because we were in a bit of a hurry.   I know this restaurant just got started (at least in its current branding).... so i'm really leaving this review in hopes they can turn it around. The first few months are crucial so it's not the time to be blowing it. Maybe it's time for a locker room pep talk and get the team back in the game.

qbPqxVruGoTEnU0uddE98Q.text: Service was alright. Conveniently open 24 hours. Food is greasy and unhealthy. The waiter admitted that the healthiest thing on the menu is a grilled cheese sandwich. So yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

MzWoVcHb5EGuJdCBeUsNfQ.text: If you don't feel like driving to get something to eat, you better get in your car and get something to eat instead of settling for this place. Seriously.  The wait times here are asinine because they're probably understaffed, they're open 24 hours so when the clubs are closed, people flock here to get their grub on. In addition to that, they aren't exactly the nicest people probably because of the aforementioned reasons. It's just a bad recipe for a vicious cycle.  I ordered some sort of a skillet, I think. I said, "I think," because I was half asleep and pretty turnt when the food arrived, but what I know for a fact is that my girlfriend ordered a pesto sandwich with shrimp, but got chicken instead. She said something, but the waitress just sort of brushed it off and gave us an empty apology and went on with her life.  The food was mediocre and the worst part was that it was expensive mediocre food.

uB1u52LQNs9WETIBYwf04w.text: It's just awesome!!! Came really hungry and left with the best smile in life. Ordered Heuvo Ranchero and strawberry waffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry waffle - fireworks in the brain!!!

-AgA_r7EkLBc9lRsrlEV8A.text: I had the spicy shrimp tacos and a some of the sauteed kale. The shrimp tacos were pretty good, the pico was slightly overkill for the shrimp. Shrimp was cooked perfectly juicy but would've preferred them crispy just to add more texture to the pico and pickled radishes & carrots that it came with. The kale was amazing; just the right amount of saltiness and flavor.  I was not too impressed by the service--the waiter didn't really have any particular suggestions for me when I was I decisive, so I'm not too sure how knowledgeable he is about the menu. Gave them 4 stars bc I just love their "upscale diner" concept and I am definitely thinking about coming back again just to explore their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy shrimp tacos. Wasn&#39;t as flavorful as I expected.

D6FzL2A3Kfa2LcVg4GxX6A.text: Subpar service. Baja fish tacos were awful.  Mostly breading with a terrible sauce. The two egg breakfast was typical but good.

Nq2Qj0WxTiyQr_085eVU-A.text: This is a 24/7 diner-style joint inside of SLS, so if you are hungry at any odd hours, chances are you will end up here. The plus side is they have gigantic portions -- great for when you're hung over, but if you don't want to waste any food, you should probably share an entree with a friend.  On the other hand, the food is quite greasy and generic. The Mexican-inspired entrees lack zing, while the American brunch items feel like something I could get at any average Joe's diner. The prices do reflect the portion size, but they are still a bit high comparing to what you can get outside of the hotel. Guess you are always paying a little extra for the location ;)  Service is a downside. I know it's really busy here during brunch hours, but we hardly ever saw our servers and the turnover rate might have been slow as a result (slow to get our bill etc). I can't blame a specific server because it happened multiple times on multiple days.

W1l4bF8r9MgxDSOfvnOTfA.text: 4 days in a row and this place has been great! Eat at the bar and see Oriel. He is very attentive and gets what you need fast. Day one I had the steak and eggs which were magnificent. The steak is a little small but very flavorful. The eggs were over easy and just right and I love there breakfast potatoes. Day 2 I had the egg breakfast and again it was made perfectly. The chicken sausage was delicious. I also got a frittata to go which tasted amazing. It has all of the right fillings. The coffee here is very smooth and the ok tastes fresh. Job well done north side. On top of good food the staff is amazing. Day 3 was the breakfast burrito. This burrito should rank number one for burritos in Vegas. I cannot believe I ate all of it. I came back on my 4th day for the steak again and it was better than before. You cannot go wrong with so many items on the menu. I am still scared of the pancakes but so far everything else has been scrumptious.

On4xbTCHL7GEEjTlV5bjkw.text: I'm giving it 3 stars because my friend ordered eggs and there was a curly Q in them. Eewww.  On the other hand I had the carnitas hash and it was very acceptable for my very Mexican self. I tried the buttermilk pancakes with syrup and those were very good too

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas hash

cOAfKZx3N2BJ5PyqbziB2Q.text: 24 hour restaurant in the casino.  Many options to choose from.  Large portions and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella french toast.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese and mushroom omelet.

yi68yQLKiowxeb2SiLiUTw.text: Great Chinese food for a hotel cafe'. We ate here after checking into the W Hotel at midnight. Bartender and server were both WONDERFUL. Definitely recommend the fresh squeezed margaritas and spring rolls, it may sound like an odd combination but so so good.

iSYxi9G6Gyv1FYqw0vO5hg.text: Ismael was very attentive and efficient. I ordered carne Asada bowl. It was really good. The flavor of the meat took me back to a memory I had when I was a little girl and my dad use to make steak and eggs. My husband had the fish tacos and said they tasted fresh and flavorful. We highly recommend this place.

EkYGp33jvgfq3W3-ABspoQ.text: The food is super average bit the service is aweful.  I know it is hard to find good employees but these guys are  unresponsive  and rude.  Go to McDonald's at least you get a smile with  your bad food.

2Yq6vLkpamnILuEpMahNEw.text: Really good late night Chinese food to grab on the way back to your hotel after a night out! Fried pork and shrimp wontons were delicious.

9VsT1EayP2SuwJPNsBXaBw.text: Update: After my first visit/review, I decided to come back to Northside another few times. In 10 days, I've eaten at the place at least 7 times now. I have updated the rating from 4 stars to 5.   I am in love with the Buffalo chicken wings. I just can't seem to get enough of them. They are perfectly sauce and cooked. I always get two orders now, even if I can't finish it as I know I'll eat it later.  The service has always been good. I've also tried other good such as the Buffalo chicken wrap, cashew chicken, the burger, and their chicken tenders. The wrap was good, the burger was okay, the cashew chicken sucked, and the chicken tenders were amazing. Since they ran out of chicken wings, we asked to get the tenders covered I'm buffalo sauce... And omg they were delicious with their ranch sauce.  I'm in love with this place now :). Especially since it's open till 4 or 5 am! it's perfect for lunch, dinner, or for late night drunk food.  Previous review:  After arriving to the hotel at midnight, not many places were open. The hotel receptionist recommended me and my friend to come here as it  was open late.  Leta say I wasn't disappointed. We ordered wings, dumplings, King pao chicken, noodles, and Margarita.  All of it tasted really good, especially the wings, the King pao chicken and the Margarita. I was pleasently surprised and woild definitely come here again. The wings had delicious buffalo sauce on it with a side of ranch. Both the sauces were made in house and I could easily tell by the viscosity, they weren't as thick as the usual ranch and as thin as the usual buffalo sauce. The kung pao chicken was perfectly cooked with perfect amount of sauce.  Would definitely come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YmtAeCKil_OngJTjm6LhQg.text: Had the breakfast and portions fr the price was on point. Highly suggest if your looking for a breakfast spot.

LuFpgpeGZXkpMdkVmWZ-cQ.text: Our waiter who I believe was French was a very nice guy very professional very friendly. The atmosphere in this place is somewhat different than other places. Don't get me wrong, they dropped $415 million renovation this hotel, so it's nice, but different.   Wife and I only had the chicken noodle soup, which I m sorry, was no bueno. Too much carrots and celery and not enough chicken. The noodles were too tough, but when you hungry, you ll eat it. Besides hamburgers and breakfast menus salad so on so forth this restaurant also serves it's Chinese menu. Sorry, I would not go back to this place-   Just put a Denny's in there and you ll do better-

CcpRieBsfFCHRpSlfJSVSg.text: Quite surprise the food was actually pretty good and on point with the Asian flavors. I am of Asian descent and ordered three items: Walnut Shrimp, Pork and Shrimp Shiu Mai, and Hot and Sour soup. Considering its a restaurant inside a hotel, I was assuming two things, overprice and mediocre food. That wasn't the case. Price was fair and food was great. Only downside is maybe the service. The hostess at the front constantly disappears and leaves the front unattended. I waited a little bit before being told to order at the bar since I wanted takeout. The bartender took my order and I did waited a little bit for the food. During my wait, I saw a few other customers had to seat themselves since the hostess wasn't available. Other times, the hostess is just chatting. The servers were great from the short time there.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rS5Wv3noEzQBW7gGD7eRWQ.text: The food was good but the service was terrible.  Convenient but staff was not engaging or followed up.  There was one guy that seemed to be "on it" but he kind of seemed like either he's the only on that cares or he's the manager? If so then I would follow up with my staff and give them this feedback.  I only ate there the one time and didn't bother to come back even when I knew it was easy and convenient and the only thing open late after hours.

zM8edvJvxJEXbiqyH-yfPw.text: Very very good!! Me and my family were debating a few different restaurants and this one wasn't our first choice but wow! Super impressed. We really enjoyed it. The service was impeccable and the food was amazing as well. 10/10 would recommend.

usbOxTi4ULdr92B8QIhpiw.text: Great food and an interesting variety to choose from. At the table we had nachos, chilaquiles, waffle with strawberries, chicken sausage, and fried potatoes.   I switched out the chorizo on the chilaquiles for Barbados beef instead. There was a tangy salsa verde which was pretty good.  They serve the Chinese menu after 11 am and the items looked good. They even had chow fun which was a surprise. I love that stuff.  Our server was Tina and she was great! Friendly, attentive, and got everything right. Definitely a good spot to try when nursing a hangover, not that I am hungover, but the menu is setup to cover all the hangover food groups in the hangover food pyramid of Booze, sweets, greasy, carbs, breakfast, and tacos. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilequiles

le9rLtn3zNh3MRKUnShb4g.text: in the SLS hotel...  i needed food..stat... they were open early....many other places in the hotel didn't open until 11 am.  i ordered off the lunch menu (cobb salad)... service was friendly.. my water stayed full i had to ask for coffee refills (the coffee was just ok)  my salad was quite good and HUGE ...ate some then and saved some for the LONG drive home from Vegas..  it's right across from the pool so you can get your food to go and head to the pool to eat

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cv5S_aFrdJXdOjvUN_B7sQ.text: Amazing food at an amazing price. The 3 course salmon dinner is maybe the best salmon dish ever.  We went back two days later and ordered it again and also the chicken fettuccine.  1st course salad was large and the cheesecake for dessert very good, all this for 25.99!

GwK8hB8c0mQUc8St-SpzTg.text: Came around 9pm on the weekend, and was told there were a lot of things on the menu that weren't available already.  They do have a lot of hearty comfort food options, and have large portions.  However, the food didn't really stand out.  Wouldn't necessarily come again unless I was super hungry and 800 degrees was closed.

pp7uH2pA-aqz1y6d_ReW_Q.text: I have to say. For a restaurant with A LOT of options, it really does a pretty good job with quality.  I'm spoiled by the delicious and authentic food in Hollywood so I was a little skeptical of this place.  I've had breakfast here every day, usually ordering the side of egg whites with a side of wheat toast (I ask for no butter) and a coffee (only $11). I don't eat much in the morning so this suited me best.  I tried the bean and rice bowl (no cheese, no meat) and it was delicious. The kung pao chicken isn't bad. It's not authentic, but you get the decent flavor you're asking for.  I also tried the wonton soup. This is why I deducted one star. The wontons were just meatballs wrapped in wonton paper and they were completely bland with absolutely no seasoning or flavor. This grossed me out so I left them alone. The soup was okay and so were the noodles. I just added the chili paste to give it life.  Today I tried their oatmeal for breakfast and it's okay. I don't normally like oatmeal but I'm trying to eat better so that's on me, not them.  I will say the service varies. My first time eating here was mediocre. The rest of the times were very pleasant.  I recommend it for their options if you're in the SLS hotel and hungry. Their prices are a bit high (per normal in Vegas), but they're reasonable compared to other places in this hotel.  I would definitely come back.

jpk19obdh2alIE8lcmrp9g.text: Food was fantastic! I highly recommend the seared salmon. Our waiter Joseph was amazing. He was very attentive and took great care of us. We will definitely come back.

O0Rel8P266_UgTGGFhYD5Q.text: Second time around !! Perfect way of starting Sunday morning!! Their blueberry pancake is to die for! Very fresh not too sweet and enough to share with somebody.. same goes with omelette  .. I like the fact that you see the kitchen and you can check how clean they keep it!! I drove from Las Vegas strip to taste this for second time and I am happy I did..

Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue berry pancakes
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach and ham omelette

TNej8GAiZThHkQ17VX-EyQ.text: Excellent food & a great menu. Oliver provided exceptional service & had great menu suggestions. We didn't have to ask for drink refills and he always had a smile.

myt6mpfIiUAo0kXXvexO_Q.text: We came by during Rock and Roll half. Oliver took really great care of us. We had a few dietary requirements and that was no problem!! The cashew chicken was tasty.

n-eLXr0vQPaeI8TuPrSe9g.text: We checked into SLS and were searching for dinner options when we landed on this place.  The decor gives me NY pizza joint vibes.  I'd say the interior is casual and comfy.  So we decided on giving the Chinese dishes a try even though we were skeptical.  Man were we surprised!  The Yang Chow fried rice had chunky fresh ingredients and the flavor was on point.   My husband raved about the salted pork with century egg congee.  The seafood and tofu claypot was so delicious.  And I'm usually not into claypots!  The tofu was lightly fried and when you bite into it, the inside just melts in your mouth.  Every ingredient in the claypot was cooked just right - tender and tasty.  The next morning we decided to give their breakfast a try.  I was so disappointed by the wait time.  We sat there for probably 40min after placing our order.  The manager apologetically explained how the printer wasn't printing our order back in the kitchen.  Honestly, I didn't understand the hold up but I was appeased by his apology and hospitality.  The blueberry pancake, when it finally showed up, tasted heavenly!  They totally made it up to us.  My husband's French toast was done perfectly as well.  They mixed up our egg orders (he wanted 2 and I only wanted 1) but that was alright.    Overall, I'd recommend this place to weary travelers!  It can get a little crazy when the place gets crowded but the food is worth everything.

dB6Ho8sxPngu8mdxVW5fpA.text: Best place ever!!! Juan M helped us and was so friendly, knowledgeable and gave our party of 6 exceptional service!!! We love this place- great service and food. We'll be back!

0a6_r8QI3vv8TwMAlfTyOQ.text: The ability to chow down 24/7 while staying at a casino is always a win in my book.   As I was here for a biz trip this became my go-to spot for a late night meal and early morning breakfast.   I liked the option of being able to take a seat at the counter area and eat in solitude while gathering my thoughts, or going over my notes for the day's business dealings.  Really nice staff - very attentive and friendly enough. Decent eats too. Egg white omelet was served up quick and tasty just as I ordered it for a late night dinner. Breakfast served all day and night is so choice. One morning I had the Continental Breakfast with vanilla yogurt parfait, fresh fruit, croissant and some coffee that hit the spot. Another night I had a salmon plate with roasted asparagus, roasted tomatoes & lemon-caper sauce. Was more than satisfied with everything. Plus, you can charge your orders to your room for convenience.    The portions were hearty and considering it's a Vegas hotel the prices were not too expensive.   Also, it's right off the casino floor for a quick exit to the slots and tables for some gambling fun.

Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0AJbPA8pfB2PTMvMNciaSA.text: We had a great lunch experience with our server Joseph. He was able to recommend great drinks and advise us on entrees as well. He was super friendly and attentive.   Our entrees, Chicken Alfredo and Al Pastor Tacos, was very tasty. Great way to start our day!

BiSAZnCT3gfTFwj-2KhtdA.text: Great food that was a big surprise. One item I see on a lot of reviews is the service, but I thought the service was just fine.  I had the omelette and a side of flap jacks (don't judge me). All came out really good and again service was great.  Will be returning.

qJ_tlXCsCBQFn5SdbF3VlQ.text: Atmosphere here is OK.  But the Chinese food kills it.  Get the pork, shrimp and chive fried dumplings.  Unlike many of this sort, it is NOT a pulverized 'meatball' of ingredients stuffed in a wonton wrapper.  The shrimp were whole.  Excellent.

NQvnfVcwXm5cyt-0flqdPg.text: I ordered the Chicken Fried Rice. It was great! Joseph was amazing, helped us out with our drinks and food, Great service!

-bbzAofQwlHZnqUMzQvUXQ.text: If you're a local, keep in mind you have to ask to see the special locals menu. Asking for the discount afterward, even with ID, doesn't work here.  The ambiance is nice, the employees are friendly, and the food is good. I really liked the Orange Chicken and would order it again.  The drawbacks here are in other areas, like the previously mentioned locals issue. Also, the menu posted outside with tons of delicious breakfast items isn't the menu offered in the evening - so if you're ready for pancakes, think again.  During my last visit a guest came in with no shoes on to get alcohol from the bar; no staff said anything about this, which was pretty unsettling. We informed the waiter but he didn't seem very interested.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Chicken and Brown Rice

fzaF9Mdap4aV4SDWeSvcSg.text: Surprising Little Spot at SLS. (See what I did there?)   It's not so little but I was surprised by how much I like the food here. Yes it's perhaps pricey but it is inside a Vegas casino. You can't compare these prices to a diner or going directly to chinatown. But then you can use comps here if you gamble so it's a wash. They have a nice variety of food; and it's interesting that they also have Chinese food. I'm pretty sure that it's to cater to Asian clientele who only eat Asian food (like my mother).   I'm sorry that I didn't photograph everything that I've tried here, but I did share all the dishes we have tried between the last two visits. We have had the wings, fried rice, salt and pepper pork chops, wonton noodle soup, huevos rancheros, steak and eggs, and waffles. I wish the quality of the steak was a little better, and the waffles I got had way too much whipped cream. Like I scraped all of it off and it filled up another plate.   If you're already staying at SLS/W, this is definitely a great dining option.

gAhpcPe1tpGLVKqJhqsrAQ.text: Their food is so good !!! I love it ! Every time I'm here I order a big plate and finish it all ! I'm usually the type of person that doesn't finish food at restaurant since it's always so much but omg this food cannot wait for later ! Delicious !

56C-EzqHlX_whOy_B39ktA.text: So glad this wonderful lunch spot is in my hotel! We were seated by the kind hostess. The decor inside is seems new and looks cool. Very clean !  We ordered 4 items and it kind of took a long time to come outside but it was neatly organized on the plates. The food was delicious i would totally recommend this spot to others.   The bill was $64 and i got a free orange juice lol! Very affordable. Thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken quesadilla starter
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu !

j8mC2w-KAhFP76802rnoNw.text: I'd give Northside a pass. Definitely my least favorite meal at SLS. The Alfredo was a little sauce heavy, but probably the best thing we ate. The kale salad was in a bath of dressing and was light on vegetables. The nachos were covered in movie theater cheese and the toppings were piled on just a few top chips, making them cumbersome to eat. The banana split was mostly whipped cream. Definitely not the best meal at the price point. Try Umami burger instead.

-ZIAG4TMrg_51d74SCn7OA.text: Four of us came here for a nice little dinner while we were staying at the SLS Hotel. There were several choices but ,this one was recommended. Glad we came here. As we all really enjoyed our meal. 2 of the girls got the grilled cheese with tomato soup. It also has bacon inside it. I wouldn't think it was something however, that I would like. But, they both raved about it so next time I go I'm going to try it as well. This time I tried a divine hot pot! It was fantastic, see the photo! I also tried the hot and sour soup. Just OK, not fabulous. Our other friend got the orange chicken with rice. She said she liked it but she didn't eat it all and she didn't want to take it with her. So I don't think it was her favorite.   Then all in all the food was good . The service was excellent.  We had a wonderful time and enjoyed our food.  Yes, I will eat there again. I love the way it was decorated...50s ,60s diner like . With American food and Chinese.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange chicken
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A look at a bit of the menu
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

DZqa3CQTJhB3cmH4Byk1mg.text: This is a really nice option for a casual restaurant in Las Vegas.  Great breakfast especially!

JtsDkSF8k8EFaAj42PObHA.text: You know what's surprisingly good and conveniently located in the hotel you happen to be staying at? Northside! I would definitely check it out if you're at the SLS or W Las Vegas. The name sounds ridiculous, and how/why would you have a Mexican/American/Chinese restaurant at the same time and possibly have decent food, right?  Well. It's decent. The Huevos Rancheros had a hard shell, which was odd, but the asada bowl was good to my taste. Furthermore, the portions were ridiculously huge, which is great because hey, you need more energy to power through the day.  GOOD: no wait, happy servers, decent food, big portions OKAY: location (depending on where you are and staying, as it's off the strip) BAD: odd combo of recipes that sometimes might not work

CBdDreWSMmU4BnJB4qAYHw.text: We had great prompt service.  Breakfast  Fresh hot Classic pancakes Everything Bagel with dill cream cheese and smoke salmon.  Breakfast potatoes were good too.  The menu is pretty crazy, a little bit of everything. This was trip #2 for us.  All good.

Tze5X6NLTVPIBvcpQO0EmQ.text: Not good Chinese food, drinks and WAY over priced. Plastic steamers?  Tops worst meal ever. Better off eating anywhere else.

EYktgpksRChKTGvb_5klZQ.text: I had friends in town that were staying at the W, and I joined them for an early dinner at Northside Cafe on a Thursday night. There was no wait to be seated in a rather comfortable booth.  Northside has a diverse menu; with breakfast offered all day and dinner options ranging from burgers and salads to pasta or steak as well as options from the chinese kitchen. My chicken fried rice was fine, nothing exceptional, but decent flavor and a good sized portion. My friend had the pan fried noodles and really enjoyed them. Pricing for the items we got were fair for the portion size and on strip location.   Service left a bit to be desired. The one time our waters were refilled my glass was completely overfilled and water spilled all over the table and my lap. The server didn't even notice, I had to take napkins from the empty tables nearby to clean up the mess he made. We were not checked on after receiving our food.   As a local I have very little reason to go to the W, and I would not return to dine at Northside Cafe based on the subpar service and average food.   Yelp Reviews 2018 28/100

1e3z3JgoDmfdNZfbWjQwKA.text: This is my first yelp review. The Chinese food is awful here for Chinese  You had better no try this restaurant if you want to taste Chinese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u4efxmDGpIB-PHGytjOJsg.text: The only reason they're getting 4 stars is the food. Had dinner there the night we landed and ordered the grilled cheese and roasted tomato soup. It was probably the best grilled cheese I've ever had in a restaurant! The soup was pretty tasty, too. The 2nd time we ate there was the morning we flew back to Seattle. I ordered a side of fruit and the bagel with cream cheese and my mom ordered the seasonal fruit plate (which was huge and had a large assortment lf fruit). Mine was okay. Can't really go wrong with fruit and a bagel (although the bagel was a Tad over toasted).   The customer service was bad. The waitress we had the first night was semi friendly and at least checked on us and was quick with the check when we were ready to leave but the waiter we had when we had breakfast came across as grumpy. Acted like we were an inconvenience. Finally got him to drop off the check and then waited and waited and waited. Finally gave up and left cash. I feel bad that I wasn't able to leave a tip as I really didn't have much cash on me but we had a plane to catch and not a lot of time to wait until he returned.

pbxwjmpFfGlIeFfTlGLWTA.text: Finally decided to eat here after 10 days in this hotel on Saturday morning before checkout.  The food was pretty good although the room itself was very loud and our waitress was fairly unattentive.  As you may know by reading my reviews I always go back to the value of the meal and experience and this one was really a miss in both!  Even though the food was good the pricing was a little high and overall between poor service and a loud room I wouldn't go back.  Vegas offers very few opportunities for social interaction and this spot isn't one of them.  Thanks for reading my review sorry I didn't right on this one but there's really not much more to say.

7a2mocb7VcSx2T2XRZwfxA.text: Northside seems solid for breakfast/lunch, but not so much for late night. We returned to the SLS so again had a decent brunch there. I actually ordered off the Chinese side this time - beef noodle soup, and I was surprisingly satisfied. The brisket plentiful and pretty tasty. However, for a place that promoted dim sum until 6am, we returned after clubbing, only to be told by our server that he wouldn't recommend that right now because their Chinese chef is not in. While I guess it was nice that he was upfront about that, it was kinda odd, since people usually train others to make stuff and also not like they would be churning out fresh dough or anything (dimsum often already premade)... I ended up getting the burger, which was fine, but service definitely was lacking. Quite a different experience during the day vs. night.

c9wMZarqFJEI9gAj5G-ewg.text: Food was Awesome but my waiter Oliver was even better!  He had the best food and drink suggestions! Eat here and ask for Oliver :-)

s7nZfFEs3fRvJBiimcBHAg.text: Staying on-and-off at the SLS for work. Probably come in for dinner 3-4 times a week when I'm here. Oliver is the best. Consistently great recommendations and always makes sure to take care of me. Asked him to surprise me on one of the dim-sum buns and brought out the custard one when I was nearing the end of my meal. It paired really well with the spicy basil beef I had for dinner. On the occasions I don't stay at the SLS I still come here for late night dinners.

YcbquxY13OF5ufvJ6mYbsw.text: I really like this place. Food is delicious. I always get the Yang Chow fried rice I still need to try the Northside Cafe Burger. People are friendly there and it's always clean. I highly recommend especially for locals free parking at the SLS and there's a locals menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yang Chow fried rice Yummy
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yang Chow fried rice - My favorite

1AKI3ztH7vWy0qcez5X-bQ.text: This is a very solid eating place, and it is open 24 hours/7 days a week, which is good because many of the other restaurants in the casino/hotel are not open Mondays-Wednesdays.  We came here mainly for breakfast 3 days in a row - everything we had from the corned beef hash, ham and eggs, banana pancakes, Belgian waffle and French-press coffee were all really tasty and filling, and I would think lunch and dinner would also be pretty solid as well based on their breakfast.  Service was friendly and attentive.  I kind of miss this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belgian waffle with strawberries and fresh whipped cream
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash

1-XjpfyM79XtyVRwCua5yA.text: Just had eggs Benedict. Was a solid 4/5 for you traditional Benedict fans. Also tried their dim sum. Another solid 4/5 for you True dim sum foodies. I've eaten here only one other time and we had a few things like breakfast and lunch. Their traditional breakfast is really good. Not quite Bellagio cafe good but look, your at SLS down on Sahara and the strip and for that reason alone it's the best you will get down this far and it's very good. Plus if you add the service which was 5/5 all day long, our waiter was Joseph and he could be working any 5 star restaurant to be honest. I did pay attention to other staff and they were also very in tune with customers and I didn't see anyone that wasn't getting great service. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. North side Cafe SLS is the chit. Enjoy and you&#39;re welcome.

DFl-Uuyzc7xS86ZTQYR9nw.text: Service 5/5 Food 5/5  I came here with my baby while his Dad was at the Las Vegas Convention. I was immediately greeted and seated. They got me a high chair and put it out of the main traffic. Jim was my server and was very attentive to all his guests. I asked for his opinion between the ham and eggs and steak and eggs, he suggested the ham and eggs, but I ended up getting the steak and eggs. Loved the steak and eggs! Steak was perfectly seasoned! I normally have to get A1 at restaurants, but this time no sauce needed. It was juicy and flavorful. A little charred. It also came with eggs, potatoes, and wheat toast. Eggs and potatoes were average. I like my potatoes a little crispier. But the toast was really good. Great overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs. (Medium steak)

1lLoO_sr1WT-0Cgf_Jb0iA.text: Not bad of a restaurant more like 2.5-3stars , pretty decent food for a good price. Doesn't cost you an arm and a leg to get full haha.  Very spacious lots of tables and booths, and it's self seating.  We originally came for the $12 prime rib only to find out it's a deal that only happens on Fridays but we decided to stay and check it out anyways.   They have a weird half and half style where they have a full menu just of Chinese food and a menu just with cafe food ie. burgers and pastas.   Hot & sour soup 3.5/5 - Was actually very surprised it was good, thought it was going to be super Americanized but it's not  We got the 3 course meal for $20 where we chose --   Caesar salad 4/5 - Can't really go wrong with salad but the Parmesan slices were just a little too big of chunks and their dressing is very subtle but not in a bad way  Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken 2/5 - Pretty bland and oily, I prefer my pasta on the softer side as well. The sides of garlic bread were bomb though crispy on the outside but soft in the middle I could've eaten a whole basket !   New York cheesecake 2.5/5 - Your basic cheesecake with strawberry syrup on top with a few fresh strawberries, probably wouldn't order again but it wasn't the worst.

xCkz9LZoxq9bL1btFbBLWA.text: This is the only good thing about the entire SLS Hotel/Casino.  The service is great & the employees are friendly. The food is yummy, and they have delicious French-press coffee.

w7Lhvs3aVTMi2VepRSBEOw.text: We came for a late lunch on our stay on Tuesday afternoon. The service was below par and the food and atmosphere were OK. The restaurant was about 50% full when we were sat and our server was busy leaving us with about a 5 minute greet. She did give us a drive by about 3 minutes into the wait.  I had the blueberry pancakes ($11.95) which were delicious and my wife had the burger ($12.95) which was standard. The timing and communication of the kitchen wasn't that good as the food runner brought out my pancakes at least 5 minutes before my wife's burger arrived.  The menu is large and I would try other items maybe when the locals' discount is offered. Northside is your only option for breakfast and late night at SLS. I would revisit if I were in the hotel and hungry during these times. But it wouldn't be my first option at other times.

xCdT3QFQdJRYvI-pGR4OOg.text: Ruben was awesome!!! Took a while for the check but it's because it was busy! Very yummy

2GHKg6OXJh75ZkOvpKZ41A.text: Date & Time:  Saturday December 5, 2015 @ 2am Location :  SLS Dining Companion:  The Husband Decor:  Diner w/ Red Leather Booths Service:  Fast, Friendly, Efficient Imbibe:  Tea Mediocre:  New Dim Sum Menu Available 5pm-6am Total:  $25
