Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CtSuBN5y8aRLqp4Qn0hFaA.text: After a 7hr flight from NYC -this place was the perfect choice!   The Streak and Eggs #onpoint !!! Possibly the best steak ever!   Great for groups settings and full bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So yum !!

WAbHe6T9uvF3YWZ5gHyCDg.text: The service is slow. We waited for more than half hour for one noodle and congee. The food was even not hot...

UWGM1oenHklYAyMgPm9P7w.text: I ate here twice while staying at the SLS hotel and the food is 1 Star ok. The service sucks.  The people were always hanging out huddled around the bar talking while you look at them as you walk in self seating yourself.  The only reason why I ate here for the second time is because I didn't want to walk anywhere to eat at that moment.  For such a nice hotel, I hope the new owner will gut this restaurant and get something better in there.  I mean really? A Chinese food place AND a cafe all in one? That can't ever be good.  And it proves it self to be unworthy.

PM-_3NZKCln95CJPI96ZaA.text: legit the best french toast I've ever had in my life.   definitely would go back, service was good! price was a little high for portion size though but that's okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french toast

XveoI-dxL99W95Ai28Bd1w.text: I really liked the energy and vibe of this place from the moment we walked in. It's in a boutique hotel so it shouldn't be surprising to find more a chic restaurant located there. The server immediately seated us where we were immediately greeted. The highlight is probably the French press coffee. Outstanding!  I normally don't get ham & eggs but something was pulling me towards that choice this morning and it was money. The ham wasn't too salty, it was juicy and just really good quality. The eggs, potatoes, English muffin were all good. It's a really good option for breakfast whether you are in a hurry or just looking to hang out.

A99XGkgdx5Q7nIO00nGA4g.text: Where do I begin?? This place could and should be so much better!  First of all, the staff here doesn't seem genuinely welcoming or caring. Feels like they just want to get you in and out in a hurry.  As far as food goes... Had the nachos one night, and they were pretty good, flavorful and the portion size was decent. My server, a hispanic man, acted like he didnt give two sh*ts about me. Ice water they served tasted funny.  Came in for breakfast as well...had the corned beef hash. Big chunks of undercooked potatoes and chunks of corned beef. Had to cut up the potatoes and flavor it all up with salt, pepper and Tapatio. My server James was nice, but I felt rushed with him, too.  Staff: Be sure to constantly check the condiments at the tables. I was missing pepper and Tobasco. Very basic!  **TIP: Call ahead and make a reservation if you insist on eating here

x84AG7Oyr01ldBXNRAAJSw.text: Honestly, i feel so bad leaving this review just because i feel like the food would have tasted so much better had it not taken so long. We ordered a pretty large order, and it was to go (to our room of course) since there was a huge line outside. The service was extremely slow, as we stood there to pay at the bartender for almost 20 minutes before we were acknowledged.  When we finally got our food, we took it upstairs, and turns out they had a bunch of items wrong. They gave us a chicken wrap instead of a club sandwich (the wrap was extremely salty). They forgot the frosting for our pancakes so we had extremely dry pancakes. The salad was super soggy and droopy, and the burger was falling apart. The tacos were decent. I am sure if we had dined in most of these issues had not occurred, but after waiting to even be acknowledged for so long, I did not even want to bother with going back at that moment.   However, we did call in to let them know, and they did offer to switch out our wrap for the turkey club and give us the frosting & some syrup for the pancakes.   We grabbed the food in a hurry left, and upon checking later in the car... Turns out we had gotten  the turkey club sandwich, and yet again no frosting or syrup for the pancakes. At this point we threw out the pancakes, and the turkey club had old tomatoes, so that ended up in the trash too, and we went elsewhere.   Like I said, it may have been a different experience if we had dined in, but after everything we went through, the quality of the food and service was just awful.

s64oM4JnCa3WY94F2RZZ9Q.text: I love being able to come to eat and enjoy drinks !!! I had some items off the chinese menu and they were tasty! Ill definitely come back and see Amber who always makes sure I'm taken care of !  She does an awesome job working at the bar there.

NNMM8Jg5atzvO8lw63tAMQ.text: This review is for brunch.    This place is OK, as far as the food and service are concern. The decor and servers had me feeling some type of way...  However the coffee here is AMAZING! You get a great big carafe for the whole table.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carafe of coffee
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A side of Chicken apple sausage.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white spinach omelet with feta.

IBL-WXB5cn48Ei_41zfX2w.text: A ok!!!  Huevos rancheros was fantastic.  I huge red chili on top,  packed with flavor. The churro beans are new to me-- very good-- they're pinto with pork.   Mimosas are only $7 (good for vegas!) and strong!  Well worth the money.   The rest of the table ordered french toast,  2 eggs with chicken apple sausage and bacon.  All delicious.   So, the wait was crazy. Came at 10 am on Saturday and waited about an hour from being seated to eating food.  But the food was so good,  it was almost worth waiting that long.   Manager Eric was amazing.  We inquired about the wait and he made us feel like we were being taken care of. Our waiter,  Jamie, was great too. Did his job.  Seemed very busy with tons of tables and was responsive when we called for him. AND he went out of his way to go to the change machine for us when we needed small bills.   I would come back for the solid meal (and since they're open all day AND serve breakfast all day). I'll just be mindful of the potential wait time.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict with smoked bacon instead of Canadian. A++++++
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros--- fantastic!

EFSp6_fBBsj7eMmpCRIbjA.text: Staying at the W stumbled upon this place at 1am and it was awesome!!! I had the steak and eggs. Yummmy! My husband said the breakfast burrito was probably one of if not the best breakfast burrito he has ever had! Service is fast and the food was great! Loved it!!!!

by0BTFGJmDIuvfQV33dCfw.text: The coffee shop at the SLS. The food is standard coffee shop fare, despite the hip ambiance: eggs, pancakes, burgers, salads, sandwiches.   I've visited several times and found the service to be extra pokey and often forgetful...but if you wait long enough, it'll all come together. Expect to pay about $13 for an entree.

qhJnPTQpM8P2y5h-3lrilQ.text: I was fortunate to be comp'd breakfast here for the entirety of my most recent stay at SLS and have to say it was a great experience. The service I received was solid and I appreciated being able to select anything on the menu (it was $15 credit which covered most of the morning menu completely) and was able to try something new every day as a result. I had the carmelized banana pancakes, greek yogurt parfait, continental breakfast (fruits, toast and yogurt), protein frittata, breakfast tacos, and bacon spinach omlette and all were great. If I return to SLS, I'd definitely eat here again, even without the comps.

Fnj-TASuYGD9f3X-O75asg.text: We ate there two mornings in a row as the food was delicious and ample portion sizes... and our server was fantastic! Joseph managed to recommend two very good cocktails to accompany our final breakfast which was a very appreciated recommendation. Joseph was not only really helpful without being intrusive, but a great personality and felt like a friend. Great job!

KEqKU9Y4yYq1TzBXxro15A.text: My favorite is the French toast and omelet!  I came here one year ago and food was amazing!  Today food was okay and the portion were ALLOT smaller!!! Bit annoyed at all the sls restaurant changes!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast and huevos rancheros

GGE1V58qn0dZ6M84hASJ8A.text: Honestly the most disgusting food I've ever attempted to eat. Completely overpriced garbage! Unless your trashed and just need calories don't eat here. I tried the Chinese food pan noddles disgusting rotted beef rubber noddles smelled like leftovers from a fridge that was a month old. Wings were worse than a fast food joint nachos were gross. Honestly replacing this restaurant with a Taco Bell would be better. The food will make you puke! I picked this hotel because it has 24 hr food. I wish I had known the "24hr food" was only from this gross place. Ohhh and if you expect in room dining be prepared for a 1-2hr wait for the shitty food from this kitchen.

2XLwNkhHR2NQbMyVlDnCKw.text: Inreresting cafe with all cusines and very goof customer service. But the food overall was average.   Got the nachos which was a good size portion and the meat was tender.  Got Farmers salad with chicken - if you want something healthy, that's definitely the choice to go! Minimal salad dressing and the chicken breast was just grilled with barely any seasoning.  - custard steam bun: who steams without wax paper underneath to avoid having the bread stick to their dish? They do. Other than that, they got the custard part right but too much breading - chicken fried rice: not bad at all

URMrfEUDYUTKa5RbPWNTOw.text: The Dim Sum and Kung Pao Chicken are great and reasonable priced. The breakfast was so-so. Great place to go for Dim Sum cravings and avoid paying for parking at casino. I recommend this place.

VR5dan0OTDKw7ezdzl4GgA.text: We had the Nachos and chicken wings... WOW!!! Definitely surprised with how great both items were. For desert we had the banana split, best banana split I have ever had. Super soft smooth creamy ice cream and the flavors exquisite! Coming back again! Also our server was great!

4b3LbD05OxJinu5Z1_LHxA.text: Same sub par food that you get on the room service menu. Over priced and small portions. The service is incredibly slow when we went on a Saturday morning. I would suggest you just stay in your room and order room service. Or better yet, skip the Sysco food entirely and find a place you like more!

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior of restaurant.
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get used to seeing an empty glass that won&#39;t be filled very often. Very poor service.

DAH74bZN-4TtvP1iFWAq_w.text: Many of the reviews listed long wait times. I am pleased I did not experience that. However, as many have noted the service is not good.  Once seated it was exactly 13 min before someone came to take an order, I ordered coffee. My meal arrived long before my coffee did. My wife ordered a side order pancake. As of this review breakfast is almost done and no pancake. And no one has checked on us in over 20 min.  Upside coffee is good.  Follow up: just before bill came out pancake showed up. Eye rolling. No explanation, nothing just here you go.   There is a family style restaurant not in hotel about 3/4 mile away. Go there.

OObkS5He3YY4BWlvzpBpmg.text: So my daughter and I own a daycare and decided to get away last minute. We stayed at the sls hotel and decided to dine at this restaurant. This restaurant is so amazing!!! The first day me and my daughter had the philly cheese sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. The next day I ordered the omelet and it was over cooked. The place was so busy, I asked to speak with the manager Kenyan and he immediately took care of everything. Kenyan was so nice, our server was nice and this place have the best food. I'll be back!!!

cF-Ej7mfDimyQU4QGeyhgA.text: Omg this place was incredible!  Definitely officially my favorite restaurant in Vegas.  The Mongolian beef was the best we've ever had! We crave it almost every day!  If you haven't tried this place, make sure you do, you won't be disappointed!

AP2lrWiEMcbGBURJwTX2zg.text: Came here a few times on our vacation. The fish street tacos are amazing. The service is top notch and quick. Also Oliver is a fantastic host.

sO5DEMyDiveo-SkZwBuwXQ.text: Really good food ! A bit pricey , but the portions are good. I recommend the Caramelized banana pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramelized banana pancakes and a small carafe of pressed coffee ! Good prices !
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramelized banana pancakes and coffee! A pressed carafe of coffee.

kFKdHpSO9erDjVCL3h5cRA.text: Delicious food and cocktails, we went hear for brunch the food and service was so good we came back the next day for breakfast!  Try the cucumber margarita - it is very refreshing!

7ixIL8L0r2Jbk0TGv-ofPA.text: Great eatery, cool vibe - and 24 hours! The sangria and Bloody Mary are amazing. The staff is really attentive (Tina is awesome) and informative and the food selections are perfect for an at-home diner feel amplified.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3i33IXaUbMx98hSW2NOYIA.text: I ate here for dinner and breakfast the next morning while staying at the SLS. I enjoyed the Chinese menu - it was a nice surprise to see all my favorite dim sum dishes on the menu.   It seems like they are still ironing out some new restaurant kinks. The inside of one of my pork buns was still cold, but I didn't really care because I was drunk and starving and at least the pork was already cooked.   The breakfast was yummy. They had all the usual breakfast favorites. There wasn't anything too surprising or original, but I REALLY appreciated the homemade whipped cream on the waffles. The waffle was really crispy which I liked, but there wasn't too much waffle "meat" in the center because it was so crispy and airy.

kHZObd8Hni6lUzefSRyU1g.text: This place is located inside the hotel near the casino area so little noisy. The food was good. The tomato soup was exceptional. I ordered some dim sum and was surprised there was not accompanying sauce/dip. The quesadilla is small and does not offer much but others at my table were happy with their choices. The green tea is loose leaf and good and so was the espresso coffee.. These were pleasant surprises.

wyPbrW2mWQeWYNENu_I8Nw.text: I completely agree with some of the reviews below me about the bad service. Sure, the staff are friendly enough, but the wait time is just ridiculous. Maybe I came at a bad time at 1230 in the morning and everyone was just tired, but that really isn't an excuse for over an hour of waiting for 6 plates of food.  This place would've gotten 4/5 stars if it wasn't for the wait time. At least when the food finally came out, it wasn't all that bad.   If you're really hungry and looking for a late night snack, this isn't the place to go. You'll be extremely starving and grumpy by the time the food comes out.

eMdR61uSPoDaW91WSJBZfQ.text: What would you expect of the hotel restaurant? Especially, walking in at 2:30 in the morning with a party of drunk companions? We were greeted by Stephanie, neatly dressed, awesome smile, wide awake, alert and humorous. She was patient with our tipsy friends and hinted what would be the best food on the small but varied menu. Her recommendations were awesome! I couldn't believe the piles of food that came out: giant mounds of barbecue laden nachos, perfectly cooked eggs with equally crisp and hot potatoes, and mondo burgers layered with delicious sauteed onions and peppers. Who would think that a cook would take such care and have such creative flair at 0300 in the morning? Great job all around. Thanks for helping to end the party in such a positive way and make our night perfect!

zJ2SLFdQbHlBUaAnyh0P3w.text: We ate breakfast today and it costs more than I expected.  Too pricey for an order of blueberry pancake $14.95 it came with three in regular size but it's good but not excellent.  The regular bfast food is okay but not an awesome place.  I guess when your in Vegas everything pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Northside Café and Chinese Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4QAMAojMA53wE2V5jx7mfg.text: Wow although amazing restaurants everywhere my gf and I ended up stopping my Northside Cafe and not only great food but customer service was great! Luciano was our bartender and made us custom drinks and was on top of his game. Def recommend!

tLWBILT_k3bZEWmQgQND-g.text: Not gonna lie... But after a night of partying, the late night breakfast was pretty dang good.

EG-SP7jfWJI4Y6uF-34J2A.text: Food was great. Service was exceptional thanks to our server Joseph T. We are staying at SLS and will be sure to eat here for the remainder of our stay. Great place!!!!

DVbqT6Dv6J5uoYierVkrkw.text: Came with a family group for breakfast.. First thing arriving here is that they only seat people by the waiting line. If you're the third group in line and there is a table for 6 people  available to fit they will seat the people who are first in line even if they are only a party of 2. Second the servers are polite and helpful & took the orders with ease.... But when our food arrived it was 45% wrong and some plates were missing, so that was disappointing. Third, on your receipts they charge you a tip automatically! Which is random. So don't tip them extra.

YZyaSVZExq_ZijUMwGv2Lg.text: Great service from bald guy with piercings (sorry didn't get name). Good food, little pricey buy welcome to vegas!

jjTuTHsg6LcebHT1vyfFag.text: I always do my research before I decided to eat out because I want a good food and a great service and I saw a great stars on this website so I took a chance. I took my family for my husband's 35th birthday couple of days ago here at Northside Cafe for dinner. We didn't wait long to have us seated which is good. cause we don't have reservation. The waiter came up and took our orders which a lot. Even thou our food took a lot of time, the waiter Christian I recalled keep us informed of whats happening with our food. He treated us like we are the only customers he had that night cause its busy and everyone is hungry. Make my story short, it is all worth the wait which the food is great and great service Christian did for us. I will definitely come back cause of him.

ARZ7VEgQE2OmlXBixjb9Zw.text: This place is awesome ! The food was delicious! I had the chilaquiles verdes and a bloody mary to go along with ! My boyfriend and I also shared the french toast which was delicious !!! Our server Juan M was friendly and attentive! Definitely returning here !

kxNR_XlWMtatOfOC5IBrVA.text: (Im writing for my grandmother) It was a memorable experience for my friend and I. Our server, Christian Santos, was very attentive and cheerful. The food was good, but our waiter made it a pleasant time. He really knew how to deal with people! Excellent service.

3KbdmjcnDH0yp9ZCF2UjwA.text: only main breakfast option.  caramelized banana pancake and breakfast burrito fairly standard but at vegas prices.  pancake a bit more mushy from the banana.  burrito with chunky potato pieces, egg, and some meat.

UZUtdcK4eRuZCftwfM8dMg.text: Tony was great.   Needed a quick meal before a concert. He got us in and out ....  I was even able to fill out this post   Popcorn shrimp and Nachos are awesome

GbgpIWP66_0qL1eXnHYE1g.text: Have been going to this cafe for awhile.  Great service.  Ate there last night with my family, had a great server, Christian, who made some wonderful recommendations.  Keep up the great service y'all

h0sD1G0AuGDh49oEB9V1QQ.text: Went for dinner, 2 of us, what a miserable atmosphere, bad service, drive-thru restaurant type of food. Asked for an iced tea, got the tea, no ice. Dr pepper soda sat there waiting for a refill, had to call the manager to get it. Hamburger bun, cheapest type you can get. Server never showed up at anytime, dirty plates sat there till we left.  Table next to us had ordered many food but had no plates,they went to the bar to get"em. When exiting server came running saying he forgot to include  the iced tea on the check, we replied what iced tea, it was just tea. Manager then waived charges. Biggest joke "We love locals".

4UePlQfJEpNrK90EBiq9Jw.text: Prices about $5 more than chain restaurants selling the same food. Service was poor :(  I had to ask for a refill on my water which was refilled with warm water and no ice. Waiter didn't take the order correctly and gave a member of my party fries instead of fruit. Sandwiches didn't look to bad. Alfredo with chicken tasted fishy. And some of the pasta was undercooked. No Parmesan was offered and when asked sliced Parmesan was brought out. Lol! It was edible but I would not waste my money.

fQmMksPtLdC_MFpS2TvmKQ.text: We had the best time and food! Kassey our waiter was fantastic.  We have been here all week and have had nothing but great food from here. Thank you northside cafe and sls for a great time... money in the wallet is always the way to leave!

7acqtCdOYc-wo1nbwMmO4A.text: I have to take the time and write a review about this place because it was delicious and we had a tremendous experience, our server Juan M was absolutely amazing, he was very attentive! Will definitely be going back.

2J2MUw9H7jBZwB6lOF2RlQ.text: Was staying at the Casino and stopped at the cafe for breakfast. We were seated immediately, the cafe was clean and well maintained. Our server was Juan M. He did a marvelous job. He was very helpful and attentive. Checked on us regular and had a great attitude. Our food arrived in a timely manner. I ordered the French toast which was quite delectable. Overall my experience at the cafe was very welcoming. I left the restaurant very satisfied.

PMCR4XZsADK3XL3fi45fwA.text: Food was excellent.  Had ham and cheese omelet with side of bacon.  Service was average but food made up for it.

3qiiziip2lW5DYq9NRI10g.text: Im just writing this review to mention that i was staying at sls with a couple of friends for life is beautiful last weekend and let me tell you we had a blast at foxtail and all of their food venues. Of course i have to mention the cafe because when you come to a cafe you dont ecpect the food or service that northside provide for their guest. I wont get into details but i must say if you do go in there ask for juan m he took great care of us.

JBBoMb18qqQ4Ac0NlRfGdA.text: Great restaurant wasn't sure what to order but the pretty server Wendy was very helpful with the recommendations I had the huevos rancheros and mimosas are only 7 dollars great deal for Vegas and the food was delicious great staff and atmosphere

t1cojTe4U7AenNOUlQYTdA.text: Just want to let everybody know this whole place is amazing, food is great and the cocktails are even better, we went over there after swimming for a little while, this cafe is located right off the pool, which is fantastic ..I definitely recommend it and will go back again... Ps..thank you Wendy for your great service!!
